title: ABC Residence Hall Council
descriptionSnippet: To create a friendly and fun living environment for residents of ABC and promote a positive, inclusive community spirit. "Keep the Quad weird and live honorably."
fullDescription: To create a friendly and fun living environment for residents of ABC. "Keep the Quad weird and live honorably."

title: Absolute Texxas
descriptionSnippet: Absolute Texxas is dedicated to developing men and women based upon the principles of individual leadership, personal integrity, and teamwork. We are committed to fostering life-long friendships and personal development that will enrich our lives and c...
fullDescription: Absolute Texxas is dedicated to developing men and women based upon the principles of individual leadership, personal integrity, and teamwork. We are committed to fostering life-long friendships and personal development that will enrich our lives and craft a truly lifelong Absolute Texxas experience.if you are interested in joining us and would like more information, please like us on Facebook!

title: Academic Counselors Association
descriptionSnippet: Staff organization. Our goal is to build recognition of the importance of effective academic advising and enhance the professional development of advisors.

title: Academy of Managed Care Pharmacy at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: AMCP is a national professional society dedicated to the practice of pharmacy in managed health environment and to promote the development and application of pharmaceutical care.
fullDescription: AMCP is a national professional society dedicated to the practice of pharmacy in managed health environment and to promote the development and application of pharmaceutical care.

title: Access Christian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: For UT students to develop personal and life-transforming relationships with Jesus Christ, who will then go and spread the Gospel so others may experience the love of Christ.
fullDescription: For UT students to develop personal and life-transforming relationships with Jesus Christ, who will then go and spread the Gospel so others may experience the love of Christ.

title: Action Committee for Career Services
descriptionSnippet: Law students partner with The University of Texas School of Law Career Services Office (CSO) to perform employer outreach, staff on-campus recruiting programs, and help develop career-related resources.
fullDescription: Established in 2003, the award-winning Action Committee for Career Services (ACCS; pronounced "Aces") partners with the Career Services Office at the School of Law to perform employer outreach, staff on-campus recruiting programs and receptions, and help develop career-related resources. Some of the annual projects ACCS members include checking in employers who participate in On-Campus Interviews and Public Service Career Fair, assisting with Public Service Table Talk, inviting UT Law alumni to attend the Cocktails & Conversation Networking Reception, and selling of student business cards, among other activities.

title: Acts College Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: Christians gather together to worship and fellowship in Jesus Christ.
fullDescription: We are one of many Christian ministries (organization) on campus, but one of very few "church based" college ministries on UT campus. ACF is part of a church in Austin called, ACTS, which we strive to follow the Great Commandment; the Great Community, and the Great Commission. As a Christian ministry at UT, we exists to proclaim the Gospel of Jesus Christ, to raise up genuine followers of Christ, and to make Christ known on our campus and beyond. We are a group that genuinely loves God and desires to make progress in becoming more like Jesus.

title: Actuarial Science Club
descriptionSnippet: Enhance opportunities for social interaction for students who are interested in actuarial science. All members gain experience and knowledge of the actuary field, its past, and its future.
fullDescription: The Actuarial Science Club at the University of Texas at Austin was established with the goal of enhancing opportunities for students interested in actuarial science. The club provides resources for these students to aid them in pursuing internships/full time jobs, preparing for actuarial exams, studying for their actuarial classes, and developing a social and professional network.

title: Adventist Christian Fellowship at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: “Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.”(Matt 11:28). Come and expermient this rest with a refreshing Bible study and fellowship every first Friday of the month at 6:45 pm. Snacks will be provided.
fullDescription: “Come to Me, all you who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.” (Matt 11:28).

title: Advertising Graduate Council
descriptionSnippet: AGC supplements the educational experiences of graduate advertising students by providing opportunities for social and professional enrichment
fullDescription: The Advertising Graduate Council is a student-run organization that serves the needs of graduate Advertising students. AGC supplements the educational experiences of graduate advertising students by providing opportunities for social and professional enrichment

title: Advocates for Cancer Awareness
descriptionSnippet: Advocates for Cancer Awareness aims to promote awareness of cancer types, screening options, and current treatments, along with promoting cancer research.
fullDescription: ACA provides unique screening opportunities for students, faculty, and staff along with educating members about cancer's ubiquitous impact. ACA hosts multiple fundraising opportunities to donate to cancer research organizations and charities. ACA hosts a research poster competition internally to promote early undergraduate involvement in cancer research. Guest speakers from the Dell Medical school will deliver speeches to members, discussing their practice in oncology, the patient experience, and advances in treatments.

title: African American Male Research Initiative
descriptionSnippet: The main goals of The University of Texas at Austin African American Male Research Initiative (AAMRI) are to increase and increase the number of African American males attending graduate and professional schools.
fullDescription: The main goals of The University of Texas at Austin African American Male Research Initiative (AAMRI) are to increase the four-year graduation rate of African American males at UT Austin and increase the number of African American males attending graduate and professional schools. The initiative also works to increase the number of African American Males attending four-year colleges and universities across the state of Texas.

title: African Students Organization
descriptionSnippet: ASO is a social organization committed to promoting African culture on the UT campus and surrounding community through dance, music, poetry and more. At meetings, we actively focus on educating everyone on issues that affect Africans and Africa.
fullDescription: ASO is dedicated to form links between African Students on the UT campus and the Austin community at large. Although we strive to create a medium for African students to socialize and interact, ASO is open to students of all backgrounds. We aim to encourage and enhance awareness about African issues, culture and values. We are committed to advocate the rights of African students on the UT campus. We are eager to form ties with similar organizations here on UT.

title: Afrikan-American Affairs
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of Afrikan American Affairs is to provide support, enrichment services, and leadership development to Black students on campus, those in the greater Black community as well as anyone interested in Black culture.
fullDescription: The purpose of Afrikan American Affairs is to provide support, enrichment services, and leadership development to Black students on campus, those in the greater Black community as well as anyone interested in Black culture. This is achieved through dynamic programming and dialogue as well as through providing an online magazine, for students at the University of Texas at Austin, about information useful to the Black community.

title: Afterglow ATX
descriptionSnippet: We are an online music publication with a mission to publish innovative work.
fullDescription: We are an online music publication run by and for students. Our mission is to publish innovative work, ranging from local music news to album reviews to artist interviews/profiles to playlists, with a special focus on topical stories that push boundaries on how we view different artists, genres, and trends.

title: All-Write All-Write All-Write
descriptionSnippet: All-Write All-Write All-Write introduces young fiction writers to literary opportunities and provide them with a space for writing and constructive criticism. All serious fiction writers are welcome!
fullDescription: All-Write All-Write All-Write introduces young fiction writers to opportunities in their field and provides them with a space for writing and constructive criticism. This semester, we will be meeting on Mondays from 5:30 to 6:30 in RLM 7.124 starting on February 11th. We hope to see you all there!

title: Almetris Duren Residence Hall Council
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose as a council is to represent the residents of Almetris Duren Hall in all their needs by sponsoring a diverse array of social, academic, self-interest/awareness and cultural activities.
fullDescription: Our purpose as a council is to represent the residents of Almetris Duren Hall in all their needs by sponsoring a diverse array of social, academic, self-interest/awareness and cultural activities. We will work efficiently to distribute funds equally to all types of hall programming. The council will continuously work to build a strong community within the residence hall, with University Housing and Dining (UHD), with the University Residence Hall Association (URHA) and, ultimately, The University of Texas at Austin.

title: Alpha Chi Omega
descriptionSnippet: The Alpha Chi Omega Fraternity is devoted to enriching the lives of members through lifetime opportunities of friendship, leadership, learning and service.
fullDescription: The Alpha Chi Omega Fraternity is devoted to enriching the lives of members through lifetime opportunities of friendship, leadership, learning and service. The main purpose shall be to encourage the spirit of true sisterhood, to develop through personal high moral and mental standards and to advance the appreciation and practice of allied arts among its members.

title: Alpha Delta Pi
descriptionSnippet: Founded in 1851, Alpha Delta Pi Sorority is the first secret society for women. Alpha Delta Pi at the University of Texas at Austin was founded in 1906 and is the oldest surviving chapter of ADPi.
fullDescription: Founded in 1851, Alpha Delta Pi Sorority is the first secret society for women. Alpha Delta Pi at the University of Texas at Austin was founded in 1906 and is the oldest surviving chapter of ADPi.

title: Alpha Epsilon Delta - Pre-Health Honor Society
descriptionSnippet: Alpha Epsilon Delta is the nation's oldest and largest pre-health honor society. The Texas Alpha chapter of the University of Texas at Austin serves to prepare undergraduate students for future professional school aspirations.
fullDescription: Alpha Epsilon Delta is the nation's oldest and largest pre-health honor society. The Texas Alpha chapter of the University of Texas at Austin serves to prepare undergraduate students for their pursuit of a career in the health professions. AED offers opportunities for intellectual and professional development, provides a forum for students with common interests, and extends a program of service to benefit both the community and the individual.

title: Alpha Epsilon Phi
descriptionSnippet: To provide unity and sisterhood to all of its members
fullDescription: The mission of Alpha Epsilon Phi Sorority is to inspire and support exemplary women dedicated to friendship and a lifelong commitment to Alpha Epsilon Phi

title: Alpha Epsilon Pi Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Alpha Epsilon Pi has the tradition of helping build the most successful Jewish gentlemen through the ideals of honesty, perseverance, mutual helpfulness, faith, and humility.

title: Alpha Eta Mu Beta University of Texas at Austin Chapter
descriptionSnippet: To honor and professionally develop those students who have been exemplary in their pursuit of a career in biomedical engineering.
fullDescription: To honor and professionally develop those students who have been exemplary in their pursuit of a career in biomedical engineering.

title: Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority
descriptionSnippet: To cultivate and encourage high scholastic and ethical standards, to promote unity and friendship among college women, to study and help alleviate problems concerning girls and women, to maintain a progressive interest in college life and to be of serv...
fullDescription: To cultivate and encourage high scholastic and ethical standards, to promote unity and friendship among college women, to study and help alleviate problems concerning girls and women, to maintain a progressive interest in college life and to be of service to all mankind.

title: alpha Kappa Delta Phi
descriptionSnippet: Our mission is to provide sisterhood among women, scholarship, leadership and Asian American Awareness in the University and community.

title: Alpha Kappa Psi - Prof. Bus. Frat.
descriptionSnippet: Alpha Kappa Psi is the world's oldest and largest professional co-ed business fraternity spanning across all careers and backgrounds. We pride ourselves on our three pillars: Professional, Social, and Philanthropy. AKPsi is open to all majors.
fullDescription: Alpha Kappa Psi is the world's oldest and largest professional co-ed business fraternity spanning across all careers and backgrounds. We pride ourselves on our three pillars: Professional, Social, and Philanthropy. As a brother, you will make your best friends at the University of Texas, while being provided with an incredible opportunity to develop professionally. Additionally, we have a vast network of alumni and brothers who are able to provide guidance, advice, and even job opportunities. While currently around 70% business students, AKPsi is open to all majors.

title: Alpha Lambda Delta Phi Eta Sigma - Freshmen
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the society shall be to encourage superior scholastic attainment among women and men in their first year in institutions of higher education; to promote intelligent living and a continued high standard of learning.
fullDescription: The purpose of the society shall be to encourage superior scholastic attainment among students in their first year in institutions of higher education; to promote intelligent living and a continued high standard of learning; and to assist students in recognizing and developing meaningful goals in life.

title: Alpha Omega
descriptionSnippet: We are a fellowship of disciples of Jesus Christ, anchored in faith by our increasing knowledge of the grace and truth of Christ and the inspiring Word of God. We want to grow in our love for God and one another, spreading the gospel to our campuses.
fullDescription: We are a fellowship of disciples of Jesus Christ, anchored in faith by our increasing knowledge of the grace and truth of Christ and the inspiring Word of God. We want to grow in our love for God and one another, focusing on growing in our faith, establishing a strong community and spreading the gospel to our campuses.

title: Alpha Phi
descriptionSnippet: Founded in 1920, the Omega Chapter at The University of Texas at Austin was the first Alpha Phi chapter in Texas. Our members share a commitment to excellence and a strong desire to help one another and our communities.
fullDescription: The objectives of our Fraternity are the promotion of growth in character, unity of feeling, sisterly affection, and social communion among our members. In all that we do, we try to obey God's principles of justice and right. We have banded ourselves together to improve our minds and hearts, and we seek to aid each other through a constant watchcare always given in love. We believe ourselves to be sincere searchers for truth.

title: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to promote scholarship, brotherhood, fellowship and love for all mankind in a unified effort and therein render service to our community....

title: Alpha Phi Omega
descriptionSnippet: Texas APO is the premier co-ed service organization on the UT campus. We pride ourselves on the principles of leadership, friendship, and service, and have lots of exciting and meaningful opportunities to help the community and make close friends!
fullDescription: The Alpha Rho chapter of Alpha Phi Omega is the premier co-ed service organization on the UT campus. Our fraternity is based on the principles of leadership, friendship, and service. We give our members opportunities to volunteer on campus and in the community, create meaningful friendships, and develop personally and professionally through many leadership opportunities! We can also be seen at home football games and many campus ceremonies with our World's Largest Texas Flag opened proudly.

title: Alpha Sigma Phi Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: To Better the Man through the creation and perpetuation of brotherhood founded upon the Values of character: Silence, Charity, Purity, Honor, and Patriotism.
fullDescription:
We are Alpha Sigma Phi and we are seeking the best men on campus looking to leave their legacy the at University of Texas. We are Alpha Sigma Phi's first chapter in Texas!

Interested in joining the 10th oldest fraternity and changing your life by becoming a Better Man? Contact our Recruitment Director, at texasalphasigmaphi@gmail.com or send us a message!

title: Alpha Sigma Rho Sorority
descriptionSnippet: Recognize the necessity of promoting sisterhood and Asian Awareness within the University campus and the community while in the process of pursuing academic excellence as well as interpersonal growth, moral development and strength in unity.
fullDescription: The purpose of our sorority is to recognize the necessity of promoting sisterhood and Asian Awareness within the University campus and the community while in the process of pursuing academic excellence as well as interpersonal growth, moral development, and strength in unity.

title: Alpha Xi Delta
descriptionSnippet: To foster the ideas of sisterhood, lifelong friendship, and service making a common bond for a lifetime.
fullDescription: To foster the ideas of sisterhood, lifelong friendship, and service making a common bond for a lifetime.

title: Alternative Breaks - Student Chapter
descriptionSnippet: The Alternative Breaks program sends small groups of college students to communities outside central Texas to engage in meaningful service during their academic year breaks.
fullDescription: Alternative Breaks (AB) is a program within the Longhorn Center for Community Engagement that sends small groups of UT students to outside communities around the United States to help individuals grow as leaders and learn about social justice issues through an immersive service experience. Alternative Breaks is great for students who are passionate about social justice looking to spend their holiday break on a productive and interactive service learning experience. For more information visit utbreaks.org

title: American Academy of Environmental Engineers and Scientists at the University of Texas
descriptionSnippet: A professional association for Environmental Engineers and Scientists. The organization will have opportunities for mentorship, speakers, and hands-on environmental engineering and science student projects.
fullDescription: We are a professional student organization for environmental engineers and scientists. We want to provide an opportunity to gain exposure to professionals in the field, learn about both technical innovation and practice, and serve the community. We will have hands-on engineering and environmental science student projects, as well as regular meetings and speaking events. The organization will also serve as a connection between the environmental engineering and environmental science undergraduate students. Furthermore the organization will have a social component to build a community of students with similar interests and professional goals.

title: American Association of Drilling Engineers
descriptionSnippet: The dissemination of knowledge of the theory and practice of all aspects of drilling engineering and the furtherance of the professional development of the student member....
fullDescription: The dissemination of knowledge of the theory and practice of all aspects of drilling engineering and the furtherance of the professional development of the student member.

title: American Chemical Society - Student Affiliates
descriptionSnippet: The American Chemical Society chapter acts as a liason between professional chemists and students in chemistry or related fields and provides a means for the furthering of a student's interest in chemistry.
fullDescription: The American Chemical Society chapter acts as a liaison between professional chemists and students in chemistry or related fields and provides a means for the furthering of a student's interest in chemistry.

title: American Constitution Society
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Law chapter of ACS is a progressive, law student organization at The University of Texas School of Law.
fullDescription: ACS is a progressive, law student organization at The University of Texas School of Law. The purpose of ACS is to help revitalize and transform the current legal debate from a staunch conservative vision that lacks appropriate regard for the ways in which the law affects people's lives to a more respectful vision that values human dignity and access to justice.

title: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics
descriptionSnippet: To further, within its locality, the objectives and programs of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Inc., i.e., advancing the arts, sciences, and technology of aeronautics, astronautics and hydronautics....
fullDescription: To further, within its locality, the objectives and programs of the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Inc., i.e., advancing the arts, sciences, and technology of aeronautics, astronautics and hydronautics.

title: American Institute of Chemical Engineers
descriptionSnippet: Expose Chemical Engineering Students to academic and career opportunities, while also providing a fun social environment for peer networking.
fullDescription: Expose students to academic and industrial career opportunities as well as provide a fun social environment for peer networking.

title: American Library Association Student Chapter
descriptionSnippet: To be a liason between the students of the iSchool and ALA, which is the major professional organization in the library field.
fullDescription: To be a liason between the students of the iSchool and ALA, which is the major professional organization in the library field.

title: American Marketing Association, UT Collegiate Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Texas AMA gives students the opportunity to learn about marketing and how to market themselves. AMA hosts guest speakers, workshops/certifications, marketing-based community service, and socials. AMA is open to all majors, so come out and join us!
fullDescription: Texas AMA is an organization that gives students the opportunity to learn about the different aspects of marketing and how to market themselves. AMA hosts our Speaker Series where marketing professionals from different industries come and talk about marketing in their field, workshops, AMA certifications in Market Research, Sales, and Career Development; and our community service is based around helping local non-profits overcome their marketing challenges. This organization is open to all majors. All you need is an interest in or passion for marketing to join.

title: American Medical Student Association - Pre-med
descriptionSnippet: Founded in 1996, AMSA pre-med represents the undergraduate branch of the American Medical Student Association, which has chapters in medical schools across the country. Feel free to visit our website or our Facebook page, which are linked to the right!
fullDescription: Founded in 1996, AMSA pre-med represents the undergraduate branch of the American Medical Students Association which has chapters in medical schools all across the country.

title: American Red Cross Club at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: The American Red Cross Club at The University of Texas at Austin's mission is to provide American Red Cross services to the University of Texas at Austin's community and surrounding areas. Members deliver these services acting in accordance with the Am...
fullDescription: The American Red Cross Club at The University of Texas at Austin's mission is to provide American Red Cross services to the University of Texas at Austin's community and surrounding areas. Members deliver these services acting in accordance with the American Red Cross Code of Conduct, under the guidelines of the Fundamental Principles of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement, and in collaboration with the American Red Cross of Central Texas.

title: American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology Student Chapter at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: The American Society of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology at UT is an organization for students interested in research in biochemistry, molecular biology, and all related fields.
fullDescription: The American Society of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology at UT is an organization for students interested in research in biochemistry, molecular biology, and all related fields. In ASBMB, we talk about research that is currently being conducted on campus, host guests that talk about their experiences in research, as well as conduct outreach for STEM to the public. ASBMB also runs the annual Fall Undergraduate Research Symposium, where undergraduates from around the nation come to present their research.

title: American Society for Microbiology at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of this organization shall be: (1) to promote student interest and further improve the quality of the Microbiology program at the University of Texas at Austin; (2) to promote high school student interest in microbiology.
fullDescription: As an organization, we seek to promote student and general public interest in the the field of microbiology. Through public outreach and informative meetings, we seek to educate students and people and to disprove the notion that all microbes are harmful to humans. Additionally, through primary and secondary school outreach, we seek to promote healthy sanitary practices and educate younger children on the importance of proper sanitation, all while showing younger students a potential career path in the event that our presentations peak their interest. Subscribe to mailing list at https://utlists.utexas.edu/sympa/subscribe/asm.

title: American Society of Civil Engineers
descriptionSnippet: Since 1921, the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) at the University of Texas has been a perfect compliment to and integral part of the educational experience and career preparation for civil engineering students here at the University.
fullDescription: Since 1921, the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) at the University of Texas has been a perfect compliment to and integral part of the educational experience and career preparation for civil engineering students here at the University. ASCE student members have a greater understanding of their career interests and opportunities by the council and advice they receive at our chapter meetings from industry professionals.

title: American Society of Mechanical Engineers
descriptionSnippet: The American Society of Mechanical Engineers is committed to aiding students in their personal and professional development, to building unity among students, and to contributing to the surrounding community.
fullDescription: Make sure to check out our website for the most updated information!

title: Amnesty International - UT Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Amnesty International is the world's largest human rights organization. Here at UT, we are student activists who work to promote awareness about human rights abuses at home and around the world.
fullDescription: Amnesty International is the world's largest human rights organization. Here at UT, we are student activists who work to promote awareness about human rights abuses at home and around the world. We engage in multiple activities ranging from letter writing campaigns to attending local protests to volunteering in the Austin community.

title: Animators Club
descriptionSnippet: Interested in 2D or 3D animation? Concept designs or storyboards? Do you enjoy animated films/TV? Then this is the club for you. The Animators Club will provide resources to all students interested in pursuing animation as a career or hobby.
fullDescription: Have you always been interested in 2D or 3D animation? Or maybe working on concept designs, storyboards and the like? Do you love animated films and TV shows? Wanna share that hobby and meet others interested in all of this? Then you're in the right place!

title: Anime Club
descriptionSnippet: A place for anime fans at UT to meet, interact, and enjoy anime together. We hope to see you at our next meeting!
fullDescription: For over 30 years, we’ve been providing anime fans at UT a place to meet, socialize, and watch anime. From rare titles and classics of the medium to the latest series from Japan, our weekly screenings have something for everyone!

title: Anonymous Dance Co.
descriptionSnippet: Dance Company on campus
fullDescription: Dance team on campus

title: Antioch College Ministry- Austin Chapter
descriptionSnippet: A community that's passionate about loving God, loving life, and living generously on our campus.
fullDescription: We believe that when college students put their passion into knowing Jesus and making Him known, they can change the world. We have student-led small group Bible studies that are an open environment for students of any background to explore what the Bible says. We're passionate about leadership development, discipleship, and sharing the love of God with others through missions.

title: Apricity Magazine
descriptionSnippet: Apricity Magazine (www.apricitymagazine.com) is the UT Austin's official literary and arts magazine.
fullDescription: Apricity Magazine (www.apricitymagazine.com) is the official literary and arts journal of The University of Texas at Austin. We are a nonprofit, international, multimedia literary and arts magazine run by undergraduate students. We also feature interviews of people who have significantly championed the humanities. Our submissions come from an all encompassing international and national base. We welcome poetry/prose submissions and visual/performing art submissions!

title: Arab Students Association
descriptionSnippet: The mission of ASA is to build a sense of community for the students on campus that identify as Arab/Middle-Eastern. Non-Arabs are welcome to join the organization however there will be an emphasis on serving the needs of Arab students on campus.
fullDescription: The mission of ASA is to build a sense of community for the students on campus that identify as Arab/Middle-Eastern. The organization will organize a combination of educational seminars, pan-Arab potlucks, outdoor activities, volunteering with an emphasis on serving the Arab-Austin community at large, and extracurricular Arab activities (i.e. Dabke) in order to fulfill its goal in creating a sense of community for Arab/Middle-Eastern students on campus.

title: Architectural Engineering Institute
descriptionSnippet: The Architectural Engineering Institute at UT is a nationally affiliated student organization devoted to providing architectural and civil engineering students with a link of communication to companies.
fullDescription: To enable architectural engineering students to exchange ideas about their future professions. Sociability is developed throughout the semester at meetings and activities allow members to meet and learn to interact effectively. Responsibility is developed through each project and commitment that is undertaken by the members involved. Professionalsim is developed as the student member becomes aware of his or her duties to all around him or her in their social and engineering encounters.

title: Armenian Students Association at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: Promote community and campus awareness of the Armenian culture and support fellowship among Armenians and their friends.
fullDescription: Promote community and campus awareness of the Armenian culture and support fellowship among Armenians and their friends.

title: Art Horror Cinema Club
descriptionSnippet: The Art Horror Cinema Club is dedicated to screening and dissecting films that exist in the fuzzy gray area between "arthouse" and "horror," followed by a short group discussion about the film. These screenings are free and open to non-disruptive people.
fullDescription: In between an "art" film and a "horror" film lies a sea of strange, frightening, and thought-provoking films that the Art Horror Cinema Club is tirelessly dedicated to screening, discussing, and celebrating. These films are unafraid to provoke, to experiment, and to push the boundaries of cinema itself, all while bring attention to issues in art, society, and human nature in often bold fashion. Art Horror Cinema comes from around the world, often from groups underrepresented in other genres of film. If it scares you and makes you think, it might be art horror.

title: Asha for Education at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: Asha for Education is a non-profit organization dedicated to support basic education in India. The aim of the group is to generate awareness among the local community in order to collectively support and provide financial assistance to students.

title: Asian American Campus Ministry
descriptionSnippet: Asian American Campus Ministry is a community of students striving to live as the body of Christ. We seek to be a safe place to discuss faith, know more about Jesus and learn what it means to follow Him....
fullDescription: Asian American Campus Ministry is a community of students striving to live as the body of Christ. We seek to be a safe place to discuss faith, know more about Jesus and learn what it means to follow Him.

title: Asian American Journalists Association at University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: The Asian American Journalists Association strives to prepare minority students for a career in journalism. Our goals are to provide support, encouragement and mentorship as well as networking and internship opportunities.

title: Asian Business Students Association
descriptionSnippet: The Asian Business Students Association serves to develop our members into multidimensional leaders in the business world.
fullDescription: The Asian Business Students Association shall serve as a center for educational and occupational opportunities within the business community, to foster a mechanism for effectively addressing to the College of Business Administration the needs of Asian business students, and to provide a medium conducive to the desires of Asian business students for higher achievement.

title: Asian Desi Pacific Islander American Collective
descriptionSnippet: The Asian Desi Pacific Islander American Collective (ADPAC) is an organization that serves, educates, and empowers the Asian Pacific Islander Desi American community at the University of Texas since 1995.
fullDescription: The Asian Desi Pacific Islander American Collective (ADPAC) is an organization that serves, educates, and empowers the Asian Pacific Islander Desi American community at the University of Texas since 1995. Additionally, our programming is open to all UT students who value diversity and cultural awareness. Through leadership workshops, co-sponsorships, and student activism, we work to encourage Asian American students to connect and learn more about the resources, programs, and upcoming events available to them at UT. We program several events throughout the year, such as You Bring Out the Asian American in Me (YBO), Asian American Leadership Institute (AALI), Breakthrough Conference, and Asian American Heritage Week.

title: Asian Pacific American Law Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The Asian Pacific American Law Student Association (APALSA) is dedicated to addressing the interests and concerns of the Asian American community at the Law School, and to promoting awareness of the Asian culture throughout the Law School.
fullDescription: The Asian Pacific American Law Student Association (APALSA) is dedicated to addressing the interests and concerns of the Asian American community at the Law School, and to promoting awareness of the Asian culture throughout the Law School.

title: Asian Pharmacy Students Association
descriptionSnippet: Asian Pharmacy Students Association is an organization that provides students with a well-rounded cultural awareness of integrative medicine and the vital role of pharmacists in the community through volunteering and leadership opportunities.
fullDescription: Asian Pharmacy Students Association is an organization that provides students with a well-rounded cultural awareness of integrative medicine and the vital role of pharmacists in the community.  Students will learn about complementary and alternative medicine from insightful speakers invited to APSA's meetings.  Membership in APSA means forming lasting friendships as well as having the opportunity to actively serve our community as student pharmacists. As a member of APSA, students, as future pharmacists, will engage in high level interactions with the community in events such as the annual Vietnamese Health Fair, Project Collaboration at UT with other pharmacy organizations, Explore UT, and various Pharmacy Month activities that promote the public’s awareness of how integral pharmacy is in the healthcare field.

title: Asian/Asian American Faculty and Staff Association
descriptionSnippet: The Asian/Asian American Faculty and Staff Association supports, celebrates, and empowers Asian and Asian American faculty and staff by fostering a community that provides opportunities for networking, communication, and personal & professional growth.
fullDescription: The mission of the Asian/Asian American Faculty and Staff Association (AAAFSA) at The University of Texas at Austin is to support, celebrate, and empower Asian and Asian American faculty and staff by fostering a community that provides opportunities for networking, communication, and growth -- both personal and professional.

title: Assault & Flattery
descriptionSnippet: A tradition begun in 1953, Assault & Flattery is the musical theater company at the University of Texas School of Law....
fullDescription: A tradition begun in 1953, Assault & Flattery is the musical theater company at the University of Texas School of Law.

title: Associated Students of Linguistics
descriptionSnippet: The Associated Students of Linguistics (ASOL) is the official organization of the graduate students in the Department of Linguistics at the University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: See http://linguistics.github.io/ASOL for more details.

title: Association for Computing Machinery
descriptionSnippet: To provide Computer Science students (and students interested in CS) an outlet to make like-minded friends; help students gain a better understanding of CS and excel in CS classes; help students make contacts in industry; and foster a sense of community.
fullDescription: To provide Computer Science (CS) students (and students interested in CS) an outlet to make like-minded friends; help students gain a better understanding of CS and excel in CS classes; help students make contacts in industry; encourage interactions between students, CS faculty, and the CS department; foster a sense of community in UTCS; provide various conveniences to CS students (e.g. lockers, a library, computer access).

title: Association for India's Development - Austin Chapter
descriptionSnippet: AID (Association for India's Development) works to find interconnected solutions to the interconnected problems of poverty, illiteracy, unemployment and injustice in India.
fullDescription: The Association for India's Development (AID) is a volunteer movement, committed to furthering sustainable, equitable and just development in India. AID supports grassroots organizations in India, initiating efforts in various interconnected spheres- such as education, livelihoods, protection of natural resources, agriculture, health, women's empowerment and social justice. AID was formed in 1991. The Austin chapter of AID was established in 1998.

title: Association for Women in Science at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: AWIS at UT Austin connects its members with professionals in STEM in Austin. Our goal is to increase exposure to careers in STEM, discuss issues important to women in STEM, build a STEM network at UT, and promote the participation of young women in STEM.
fullDescription: The Association for Women in Science at UT Austin (AWIS at UT) strives to connect its members with women in STEM careers in Austin, be those in academia or industry. We work closely with the Austin Association for Women in Science, and our goals are to (1) increase exposure to the wide variety of career options in STEM, (2) bring to light issues important to women in STEM, (3) build a broad cross-disciplinary network of people in STEM at UT Austin, and (4) promote the participation of young women in STEM. We aim to accomplish these goals through career panels, speakers, discussion groups, networking events, mentoring activities, and outreach events. We are open to anyone who wishes to take advantage of the opportunities we provide (including undergraduates, graduate students, postdocs, faculty members, and those who identify as any gender).

title: Association of Black Computer Scientists
descriptionSnippet: A student-led organization that provides community, mentorship, networking, and opportunities for underrepresented students seeking educational and professional success in Computer Science.
fullDescription: A student-led organization that provides community, mentorship, networking, and opportunities for underrepresented students seeking educational and professional success in Computer Science.

Students can also expect to make close friends, socialize in a fun environment, and have the opportunity to travel and compete at Collegiate DECA conferences nationally.

title: Beauties and the Beat
descriptionSnippet: The only all-female a cappella group at UT Austin that creates music that empowers women and brings it to campus, the Austin area, and around the country.
fullDescription: Beauties and the Beat is the only all female a cappella group at the University of Texas. We are a student led organization that was established in 2013, and since then we have performed all around Austin and have travelled to places ranging from Arkansas to Florida to compete in a cappella competitions, and we have opened for Anna Kendrick and performed at SXSW in the past. We are big believers in community involvement, and we perform at UT and around Austin as often as possible. As an all-female group, one of our main goals is to promote female empowerment through our music and our presence on campus.

title: Beekeeping Society
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas Beekeeping Society, also known as BEEVO, seeks to inform the student body about the importance of beekeeping. We hope to have a campus apiary where we students can teach/learn the art of beekeeping.
fullDescription: Bees provide an invaluable, though often overlooked service: pollination. Recently, Colony Collapse Disorder has pushed bees front and center, as agricultural ventures worldwide were faced with the loss of their most important pollinator. The Beekeeping Society, also known as BEEVO, seeks to reinvest beekeeping to individuals. If more people keep bees, there’s more pollination, and more environmental sustainability.We hope to have a campus apiary where we students can teach/learn the art of beekeeping.

title: Bengali Language Union
descriptionSnippet: BLU is intended to provide an inclusive and welcoming atmosphere where students can learn to converse, read, and write in Bengali. Our goal is to aid students who are interested in the Bengali language by providing study sessions and academic support.
fullDescription: Texas BLU is intended to provide an inclusive and welcoming atmosphere where students can learn to converse, read, and write in Bengali. Our goal is to aid students who are interested in the Bengali language by providing study sessions, academic support, and other activities relating to Bengali culture. All students (both native and non-native) are welcome!

title: Bengali Students Association
descriptionSnippet: Bengali Students Association (BSA) is a cultural organization that shares the rich Bengali culture at UT Austin.
fullDescription:
Bengali Students Association (BSA) is a cultural organization that has been bringing together all Bengali students since 2011. Since then, BSA has promoted, nurtured, and preserved the rich Bengali culture around campus and even within the greater Bangladeshi community in Austin. From philanthropy projects to celebrating genuinely traditional Bengali events, BSA serves as a platform to bring about a sense of unity and cultural awareness among its members.

Of note, BSA also contributes to charities and helps to fund important causes such as raising awareness of children literacy, a major issue of the country of which we are cullturally representing. In 2012, BSA raised $4,000 towards SpaandanB and sponsored a computer lab in Pirojpur, Bangladesh, "Smart Class Room" in Jessore, Bangladesh, and Swapnadhara Pathshala in Duaripara, Bangladesh. In 2013, BSA quickly raised over $1,000 in response to the garments factory collapse in Savar, Bangladesh to provide immediate relief for the victims. In being a part of this organization, BSA instills positive, culturally-rich values amongst its members, offers avenues for leadership, and promotes self-betterment. Come check us out and experience what samosas, events like "Pohela Boishakh," and the Bengali culture in general REALLY is all about!

title: Best Buddies
descriptionSnippet: Best Buddies strives to establish a global volunteer movement to create opportunities for one-to-one friendships, leadership development, and integrated employment for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities....
fullDescription: Best Buddies is a registered service organization that matches UT students with adults in the Austin community with Intellectual and Developmental Disabilities (IDD).  Through one-to-one friendships, fun events, leadership development, and self-advocay workshops, we strive to empower individuals with IDD to become fully included members of our society.

fullDescription: Beta Beta Beta (Tri-Beta) Biological Honor Society (Kappa Upsilon Chapter) is an honor and professional society for students of and interested in the biological sciences. Activities are designed to stimulate interest, scholarly attainment, investigation in the biological sciences, and to promote the dissemination of information and new interpretations among students for the life sciences.

fullDescription: BeVocal seeks to address multiple types of harm and enhance individual level self-efficacy to intervene as well as enhance collective responsibility and peer norms surrounding the importance of bystander intervention.  We seek to shift the culture of campus with the promotion of intervention as a norm of our community, beginning at orientation through graduation. BeVocal - that's what Longhorns do.

title: Black Health Professions Organization- MAPS Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Uplifting future health professionals and engaging with the community. Meetings every other Wednesday!
fullDescription: The purpose of the Black Health Professions Organization is to foster an environment that supports minority undergraduates in their efforts to enter into a healthcare related professional school. BHPO works to connect students with resources including networking, shadowing, volunteering, and test prep. Though we are not a social organization, members benefit from a close-knit group that uplifts one another beyond professional development and engages with the local community to improve health outcomes.

title: Black Homecoming Planning Committee
descriptionSnippet: The Black Homecoming Planning Committee (BHPC) is a student organization committed to uniting current and former members of the African American community at the University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: The Black Homecoming Planning Committee (BHPC) is a student organization committed to uniting current and former members of the African American community at UT Austin. This will be accomplished through a mini week event that highlights the diversity within our culture that has only served to unify African and African American students on campus. BHPC is not only a pivotal organization for undergraduates at the university, but also the African American community at large. Though our initial focus is on the ethnic student population, we embrace and welcome all other cultures present on campus to take part in our celebration.

title: Black Honors Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The Black Honors Student Association is a student-led organization that strives to create a community between black honors students at the University of Texas.
fullDescription: The Black Honors Student Association (BHSA) is a student-led organization that fosters a community between UT’s black honors students, a historically underrepresented population in honors programs at the University of Texas. BHSA provides a safe space where students of all majors and programs are welcome to have the opportunity to network with other honors students and faculty, gain helpful insight and advice on courses, careers, and opportunities, and serve the community. Furthermore, BHSA serves as an outlet for discussing and addressing the issues and needs of black honors students at the university—collectively giving this underrepresented community a voice.  The organization seeks to increase the number of black students in honors programs through community outreach and student mentorship.

title: Black Student Alliance

fullDescription: McCombs Board Fellows places selected MBA students on the boards of directors of local partner non-profit organizations as non-voting board members for one year. The purpose of the program is to give talented and committed business students the opportunity to work with and learn from non-profit leaders and experience what it's like to sit on a Board of Directors. Fellows contribute their time and business skills to benefit the partner organizations and help give back to the community.

The Niemann Cup established by Stanley P & Claudie P. Wilson in 1984, is awarded to the top advocate of each graduating class.

fullDescription: Bridging Texas fosters intergenerational relationships between students and seniors in the Austin community. Our volunteering activities range from engaging with residents in arts & crafts and technology classes to interviewing and documenting life stories. Our members strive to provide support and companionship for residents, especially those who experience limited social interaction due to their deteriorating health.

fullDescription: UT’s oldest publication and sole pictorial record, the Cactus yearbook is responsible for capturing the spirit of the University and documenting the Athletic, Student Life, Academic, and Student Organization events of the year. Don’t miss this opportunity to have your best college memories beautifully bound in a book meant to last a lifetime. Order a yearbook online at www.cactusyearbook.com.

title: Caduceus
descriptionSnippet: Caduceus is a Pre-Med organization aimed to provide its members with a community of people with the same goal, guidance and resources to be informed on the path to medical school, and chances to raise money for charity and volunteer in a group setting.

title: Camp Kesem at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: Camp Kesem is a nationwide community, driven by passionate college student leaders, that supports children through and beyond their parent’s cancer.
fullDescription: Camp Kesem is a nationwide community, driven by passionate college student leaders, that supports children through and beyond their parent’s cancer. A program of Kesem, Camp Kesem operates over 110 free summer camps in 42 states for children ages 6 to 18 who have been impacted by a parent’s cancer. This camping experience - as well as Kesem’s year-round support services - have a lasting impact on children by providing them a peer-support network that understands their unique needs, builds confidence and strengthens their communication skills. In 2018, Camp Kesem served over 8,000 children coast-to-coast, all funded by generous donations from individuals, foundations, and corporate partners.

title: Campus Bike Alliance
descriptionSnippet: Improving the UT-Austin experience for all who bike on campus. Advocating for cycling infrastructure and resources for the health and safety of the student body and as a means of addressing affordability and sustainability.
fullDescription:
The Campus Bike Alliance is a student-led group open to all who are affiliated with the University of Texas at Austin. Our goals are to make the UT campus more bikeable, to promote cycling as a means of addressing affordability and sustainability, and to represent the large proportion of the student body that uses a bicycle for transportation.

Reaching our goals requires partnerships with academic and administrative units within UT, reciprocal relationships with professional and non-profit organizations outside of UT, and the dedication and hard work of students who are passionate about bikes.

To get involved, send us an email at campusbikealliance@gmail.com or attend a general meeting. It is a great opportunity to develop real-world skills and network with professionals while making a positive and lasting difference at the University of Texas.

If you are a professional or academic who would like to speak at one of our meetings or participate in an upcoming panel, please email us!

title: Campus Environmental Center

Students of all years and majors are welcome to join!

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Distinguished Speakers
descriptionSnippet: Distinguished Speakers is the premier student-run speaker series at The University of Texas at Austin. Members have the opportunity to plan and manage forums, panels and speaking events around topics and speakers who are interesting and influential!
fullDescription: Distinguished Speakers is the premier student-run speaker series at The University of Texas at Austin. Members have the opportunity to plan and manage forums, panels and speaking events around topics and speakers who are interesting, relevant and influential.  We help broaden students’ horizons and educate them on issues that impact their lives.

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Events CoSponsorship Board
descriptionSnippet: The Events CoSponsorship Board provides a source of funding for registered student organizations (RSO) at The University of Texas at Austin. RSOs are required to submit an application for funding at least SIX (6) weeks prior to the date of the event.
fullDescription: About:

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Headliners
descriptionSnippet: Headliners, a committee of Campus Events + Entertainment, strives to bring large-scale, high profile concert, comedy, and entertainment events to UT students at no cost. Through its programs, Headliners hopes to bring valuable experiences to its members.
fullDescription:
Headliners is the major events wing of Campus Events + Entertainment. Headliners strives to bring large-scale, high profile concert, comedy, and entertainment events to UT students at no cost. Through its programs, Headliners hopes to bring students together in large numbers to foster a sense of shared community and school pride.

A member's experience in Headliners values a passion for music, friendship, event programing and leadership experience. Join our meetings at Monday 6pm in the Union Eastwoods Room to learn more about what we do!

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Mexican American Culture
descriptionSnippet: MACC promotes a diverse environment that celebrates the traditions and cultures of Latin America while offering leadership and growth opportunities through event planning, volunteerism and collaboration. We are a “familia” united though pride.
fullDescription: Campus Events + Entertainment Mexican American Culture Commitee (MACC) promotes a diverse environment that celebrates the traditions and cultures of Latin America while offering leadership and growth opportunities through event planning, volunteerism and collaboration. We are a “familia” united though pride in our heritage, respect for our history and vision for the future.

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Recreation
descriptionSnippet: Recreation strives to program a diverse array of events throughout the school year that focus on active student participation. At Recreation events, students do not sit on the sidelines; they are directly involved in and integral parts of our programs.

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Showtime
descriptionSnippet: Showtime programs events that center on media, pop culture, and student interests. In addition, Showtime oversees the Blockbuster and Late Night Film series and the Texas Union Film Festival(TUFF). Showtime screens films weekly and brings sneak previews.
fullDescription: Showtime programs events that center on media, pop culture, and student trends/interests. In addition, Showtime oversees the Blockbuster and Late Night Film series in the Texas Union Theatre and the Texas Union Film Festival (TUFF). Showtime seeks to bring students together through common interests in film, television, gaming, and current events. Past programming has included annual Outdoor movie screenings, Oscar Award winning films, showings of The Rocky Horror Picture Show, guest appearances by the Alamo Drafthouse's Master Pancake Theatre, and TV Marathons.

title: Campus Events + Entertainment Texas Traditions
descriptionSnippet: Texas Tradition hosts some of E+E's longstanding traditional programs: Texas Revue, Forty Acres Fest, & Longhorn Kickoff. Members have opportunities to learn how each unique event is put together and run, while building major event management skills.
fullDescription: Texas Tradition hosts some of E+E's longstanding traditional programs: Texas Revue, Forty Acres Fest, & Longhorn Kickoff. Members have opportunities to learn how each unique event is put together and run, while building major event management skills.

title: Campus Renewal Ministries
descriptionSnippet: Campus Renewal Ministries forges partnerships in prayer to build missional communities that transform college campuses with the gospel of Jesus.
fullDescription: Campus Renewal Ministries forges partnerships in prayer to build missional communities that transform college campuses with the gospel of Jesus.

title: Capital Community
descriptionSnippet: Capital Community is a 501c(3) nonprofit and student organization whose mission is to provide financial literacy education to children & local community members in underserved areas and to raise awareness of the effects of predatory lending on consumers.
fullDescription: The mission statement of Capital Community is to provide education about affordable credit options for people in under-served groups in the Austin community, to teach personal financial management course to K-12 students, and to raise awareness and interest in the subject of micro finance amongst students at the University of Texas at Austin.

title: Caribbean Students Association
descriptionSnippet: To bring Caribbean culture and diversity to campus by enhancing the knowledge of students, faculty and staff.
fullDescription: To bring together students, faculty and staff from or interested in the Caribbean.

title: Center for Asian American Studies
descriptionSnippet: The Center for Asian American Studies (CAAS) at The University of Texas at Austin is an interdisciplinary academic program promoting understanding and awareness of Asian Pacific American (APA) issues and communities.
fullDescription: Founded in 2000, the Center for Asian American Studies (CAAS) at The University of Texas at Austin is an interdisciplinary academic program promoting understanding and awareness of Asian Pacific American (APA) issues and communities. We house undergraduate major, minor, and honors programs and organize lectures, films, conferences, speakers' series, discussion forums, and collaborate partnerships with community and campus organizations. CAAS seeks to develop and highlight transnational and hemispheric perspectives and narratives of Asians in the Americas and the American South.

title: Central American Student Association at UT - Austin
descriptionSnippet: Central American Student Association (CASA) at UT - Austin promoting the understanding of history, culture, and important social issues.
fullDescription: Our mission is to support students of Central American descent and interested others to share aspects of these countries’ culture, history, and sociopolitical state. In this effort, we hope to bring awareness to the needs and strengths of Central Americans and raise funds to support humanitarian projects.

title: Central Texas Model United Nations
descriptionSnippet: Central Texas Model UN participates in and hosts Model United Nations Conferences. CTMUN hosts two conferences for high school students, sponsors a traveling MUN team, and fosters a sense of community for UT students engaged in international affairs.
fullDescription: Central Texas Model United Nations (CTMUN) is a certified 501(c)3 non-profit organization that hosts multiple events throughout the school year. We host the CTMUN conference for over 500 high school students from all over Texas; student delegates engage in UN and non-UN (crisis) committees. We also sponsor a traveling MUN team, where Texas students go to collegiate level conferences across the country and the globe. CTMUN members interact with the local UNA-USA chapter and other international affairs groups on campus.

title: Chemistry Student Safety Organization
descriptionSnippet: The goal of this organization is to improve the overall safety culture in chemistry research labs at UT by stimulating student involvement in safety activities and spreading awareness of good safety practices.
fullDescription: The Chemistry Student Safety Organization will be a registered student organization at the University of Texas at Austin, open to all undergraduate and graduate chemistry students. The goal of this organization is to improve the overall safety culture in chemistry research labs at UT by stimulating student involvement in safety activities and spreading awareness of good safety practices.

title: Chess Club
descriptionSnippet: Chess Club is organized to promote the game of chess in the UT community.
fullDescription: Chess Club is organized to promote the game of chess in the UT community. Come to our weekly meetings every Monday from 6-8pm in the Dobie Food Court (2nd Floor) to learn, play, and have fun!

title: Chi Beta Delta
descriptionSnippet: Chi Beta Delta is a service sorority whose mission is to promote leadership, guidance, and to strengthen the ties of friendship. The sorority aims to provide a sense of belonging to The University of Texas.
fullDescription: Chi Beta Delta was founded in 2002 by eight women at Texas State University who shared the vision of a sisterhood founded upon personal growth  through leadership and friendship, gained by positive involvement with the community.

title: Chi Epsilon - Civil Engineering
descriptionSnippet: Chi Epsilon (XE) is the national civil engineering honor society in the United States. It honors engineering students who have exemplified the "principles of scholarship, character, practicality, and sociability...in the civil engineering profession."
fullDescription: Chi Epsilon (XE) is the national civil engineering honor society in the United States. It honors engineering students who have exemplified the "principles of scholarship, character, practicality, and sociability...in the civil engineering profession."

title: Chi Kappa Phi Service Society
descriptionSnippet: The mission of Chi Kappa Phi is to inspire a lifelong dedication to philanthropic service by fostering friendships strengthened through a tradition of scholarship and leadership.
fullDescription: Chi Kappa Phi is a service society established to benefit our campus and surrounding city. We hope to inspire a lifelong dedication to philanthropic service by fostering friendships strengthened through a tradition of scholarship and leadership. By doing so, we seek to contribute to our community by facilitating each member’s journey to discover and develop unique philanthropic interests. We will do this by providing numerous service opportunities; one of our main philanthropies will be a partnership with Oak Springs Elementary School.

title: Chi Omega Sorority
descriptionSnippet: We are an organization with high standards of scholarship and personnel. We promote friendship, campus activities, vocational goals, and social and civil service....
fullDescription: We are an organization with high standards of scholarship and personnel. We promote friendship, campus activities, vocational goals, and social and civil service.

title: Chinese Corner
descriptionSnippet: Purpose of the Chinese conversational club: to make the Chinese language more accessible and approachable to members and to explore a more local culture

title: Chinese Student Association
descriptionSnippet: CSA is dedicated to promoting Chinese culture and creating a tight-knit community. We host social events, compete in intramural sports, and much more! Our largest events include Mid-Autumn Festival and Lantern Festival.
fullDescription: Chinese Student Association is one of the oldest cultural student organizations on campus at the University of Texas at Austin. Since 1947, we have been dedicated to promoting Chinese culture and helping members find their home on campus. We welcome anyone who is interested in Chinese culture or wants to meet new people.

title: Chinese Students and Scholars Association
descriptionSnippet: CSSA is a non-profit, non-political, and non-religious organization of, by, and for the Chinese students, scholars, and their spouses at Austin, Texas.
fullDescription: Chinese Students and Scholars Association is a non-profit, non-political, and non-religious organization of, by, and for the Chinese students, scholars, and their spouses at Austin, Texas. The goal of CSSA is to promote social, intellectual, and cultural activities for its members, to facilitate communication and academic exchange between its members and other students and scholars who are interested in Chinese culture in the United States, to provide help for its members, and to promote mutual understanding and friendship between the people of China and the United States.

title: Christian Legal Society
descriptionSnippet: A non-denominational organization whose purpose is to provide Christian law students with an alternative approach to the problems encountered during a legal education.
fullDescription: A non-demoninational organization whose purpose is to provide the Christian law student an alternative approach to the problems encountered during a legal education. Provides the Christian law student a source of fellowship, Bible Study, and mutual Christian support and prayer.

title: Christian Pharmacists Fellowship International - Student Chapter
descriptionSnippet: To support each other academically, emotionally and spiritually in our efforts to encourage and help other pharmacy students.
fullDescription: To support each other academically, emotionally and spiritually in our efforts to encourage and help other pharmacy students.

title: Christian Students on Campus
descriptionSnippet: Christian Students on Campus is a student organization at the University of Texas at Austin. We love the Lord Jesus and His word and aspire to know the truths of the Bible, experience the riches of Christ, and share the gospel with those around us.

title: Christians on Campus
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to enjoy and minister the unsearchable riches of Christ (Eph 3:8) for the building up of the Body of Christ (Eph 4:12). We hold the faith which is common to all the believers in the Lord Jesus Christ (Titus 1:4). Through daily prayer, Bi...
fullDescription: Our purpose is to enjoy and minister the unsearchable riches of Christ (Eph 3:8) for the building up of the Body of Christ (Eph 4:12). We hold the faith which is common to all the believers in the Lord Jesus Christ (Titus 1:4). Through daily prayer, Bible reading, and Christian fellowship we are growing in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To Him be the glory both now and unto the day of eternity. Amen (2Pet. 3:18).

title: CHYK West at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: To promote Hindu (Vedanta) philosophy and its application to our daily life
fullDescription: To promote Hindu (Vedanta) philosophy and its application to our daily life.

title: Circle K International
descriptionSnippet: Circle K International (CKI) is an international collegiate service organization that is a sponsored leadership program of Kiwanis International. It promotes service, leadership, and fellowship.
fullDescription: Today, as the largest student-led collegiate service organization, CKI boasts a membership of more than 13,000 collegians on more than 500 campuses worldwide. CKI is led by an International Board of Representatives elected by its membership each year. Embodied by its tenets of leadership, fellowship, and service at the club, district, and International levels, CKI continues to grow through service to the world's campuses and communities.

title: CleanTech Group
descriptionSnippet: The CleanTech Group supports MBA students’ efforts to address global energy and environmental challenges through educational, networking, and recruiting opportunities.
fullDescription: The CleanTech Group’s mission is to support McCombs MBA students’ efforts to address global energy and environmental challenges by facilitating educational, networking, and recruiting opportunities in a range of business functions across the energy and environmental sectors.

title: Climate and Meteorology Society at the University of Texas
descriptionSnippet: Hello! If you are interested in weather and how the climate is changing, then this organization is for you! CMS intends to provide opportunities for students at UT to learn about, discuss, and watch the weather as well as network in this field of study.
fullDescription: This organization will meet at least twice a month in addition to holding occasional events. There will be occasional guest speakers that inform students on weather hazards and safety precautions, as well as discuss the potential implications of climate change on severe weather. Events will also allow students to share their experiences and interests with others and provide networking opportunities for those that have career or research interests in related fields of study.

title: ClockTower Cultural Productions: Raas Rodeo
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the organization will be to spread Indian dance culture around the city of Austin.
fullDescription: The purpose of the organization will be to spread Indian dance culture around the city of Austin.

title: Club Golf
descriptionSnippet: To bring together Longhorn student golfers that are not pursuing collegiate golf for recreational and competitive play.

title: Club Tennis
descriptionSnippet: The goal of club tennis is to bring together players of different levels in order to practice, play tournaments, and make friends. We hope to support and spread the game of tennis throughout the UT campus.
fullDescription:
Texas Club Tennis at the University of Texas at Austin is a licensed recreational sports organization that promotes the sport of tennis throughout the UT community and brings together all levels of players to practice and compete against other University club teams around the state of Texas and across the nation.

We fall under the umbrella of the United States' Tennis Association's Tennis on Campus collegiate program. This division sprung from the need for a bridge between junior and adult tennis for those not playing varsity college tennis and has grown immensely since its inception over ten years ago. For more information visit http://www.tennisoncampus.com/

The Texas Club Tennis team has a rich history of participation and strong results at the sectional and national levels. Some of our accolades include:

title: Coders Across Disciplines
descriptionSnippet: We aim to teach and promote programming to all students on campus by hosting weekly workshops in different programming languages and hosting biweekly general meetings with tech companies.
fullDescription: Coders Across Disciplines (CAD) is a multi-disciplinary organization with over 400 undergraduate and graduate students across many schools, such as the Cockrell School of Engineering, the College of Natural Sciences, and the McCombs School of Business. Our mission is to teach and promote programming to all students on campus. We hope to provide a collaborative environment for our members to tackle various challenges while sharpening their problem solving skills. We also aim to encourage students to learn how to code and apply their knowledge in programming to various disciplines.

title: Collaborative Artists
descriptionSnippet: We are a group of art enthusiasts from all different majors at UT. Meetings are held weekly and involve art activities you can do with other members. Come collaborate with us!
fullDescription: We meet every Friday night from 7pm to 9:30pm in GAR 1.126! After meetings we get food together.

title: College at the Austin Stone
descriptionSnippet: To make the supremacy of the name and purpose of Jesus Christ known at the University of Texas....
fullDescription: To make the supremacy of the name and purpose of Jesus Christ known at the University of Texas.

title: College of Education Career Service
descriptionSnippet: Career Services at the College of Education

title: College Republicans at Texas
descriptionSnippet: To proactively advance principles and values of the Republican Party on campus, to coordinate and provide logistical support to the Republican Party of Texas, to engage and educate the larger student population on contemporary political issues to induc...
fullDescription: To proactively advance principles and values of the Republican Party on campus, to coordinate and provide logistical support to the Republican Party of Texas, to engage and educate the larger student population on contemporary political issues to induce interest in all levels of governmental affairs, and to cultivate a like-minded, center-right political family made up of primarily independents, conservatives, and libertarians.

title: Collegium Musicum
descriptionSnippet: Collegium Musicum is a mixed choral ensemble and student organization that focuses on performing a cappella repertoire and promoting merriment amongst individuals.
fullDescription: An independent and extracurricular student-run choral ensemble at the University of Texas, Collegium Musicum is committed to bringing outstanding choral music to audiences both on and beyond our campus. We offer one of the widest ranges of repertoire of any of the university's ensembles, spanning music from the Middle Ages to the twenty-first century, encompassing a multitude of styles. The ensemble consists of approximately 26-32 singers from a variety of backgrounds who pursue a wide array of majors on campus. This ensemble is completely student run. Collegium Musicum holds auditions each semester based on vacancy in the ensemble. We perform two concerts at the end of each semester and each consists of the same program. Collegium Musicum prides itself on collaborative growth for success between our officers, directors, and our members. For more information please email us at txcolmus@gmail.com, visit our website at www.txcolmus.org or like us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/txcolmus.

title: Communication and Leadership Club
descriptionSnippet: To empower UT students to be ethical and effective communicators and leaders in the community.
fullDescription: To empower UT students to be ethical and effective communicators and leaders in the community.

title: Communication Council
descriptionSnippet: Our council's main purpose is to address student concerns in the College of Communication by fostering and maintaining a strong relationship with our college's administration. Additionally, we facilitate interactions between students, faculty , and sta...
fullDescription: Council's main purpose is to address student concerns in the Moody College of Communication by fostering and maintaining a strong relationship with our college's administration. Additionally, we facilitate interactions between students, faculty, and staff in the college; represent the college at University-wide events, and serve the city of Austin through our volunteer and community service outreach.

title: Communication Studies Graduate Community
descriptionSnippet: The Communication Studies Graduate Community will provide networking and professional development activities as well as organize social activities for graduate students in the Department of Communication Studies....
fullDescription: The Communication Studies Graduate Community will provide networking and professional development activities as well as organize social activities for graduate students in the Department of Communication Studies.

title: Communications and Leadership Book Club
descriptionSnippet: We are a group of students who want to better ourselves intellectually, professionally, and interpersonally through the power of books.
fullDescription: Studies show that reading for just 6 minutes a day can reduce stress by up to 68 percent!

title: Community & Regional Planning Student Org.
descriptionSnippet: CRPSO is an at-large elected body that hosts a variety of academic and extracurricular activities and serves as a forum for broader University and program issues.
