fullDescription: The UTSoA Community & Regional Planning Student Organization (CRPSO) serves the student body through social events, professional development, community service, promoting diversity in the CRP program, and providing student feedback for the administration. All CRP students are considered members of CRPSO, but the executive board plays a more active leadership role.

title: Computer Science and Business Student Association
descriptionSnippet: A student organization for students majoring in both computer science and business. We provide a welcoming, safe environment for all CSB and BHP/Turing students to bond, relax, study, and grow together.
fullDescription: The Texas Computer Science and Business Student Association (CSBSA) is a student organization for all students jointly majoring in Computer Science and Business Honors.

title: Connect
descriptionSnippet: We are a group of eager collect students aimed at bridging the gap between the elderly and youth in our community.
fullDescription: CONNECT bridges the gap between the youth and the elderly by partnering with local Austin retirement homes. We host one-on-ones, bingo nights, field trips, and more. Today, we have over 50 active members, and we are always looking for more. Please reach out to one of the people below to be added to the GroupMe!

title: Consortium Fellows Business Association
descriptionSnippet: The McCombs Consortium seeks to cultivate academic, social, and professional successes by continuing to increase diversity of and to connect our community with current and prospective students and alumni who believe in the Consortium mission.
fullDescription: CFBA's purpose is to organize the collective efforts of Consortium fellows around maximizing their relationship with current and potential Consortium for Graduate Study in Management and corporate partners.

title: Consult Your Community - Texas Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Texas Consult Your Community is a non-profit student-led organization providing pro-bono consulting services to local small businesses around Austin.

title: Cooperative Pharmacy Student Association
descriptionSnippet: CPSA is a UT-COP Student Organization based out of Austin, but located at UTRGV. We participate in health-related community service events promoting a healthier community while promoting the pharmacy profession & our students professional growth.
fullDescription: The purpose of CPSA is to: 1. Participate in community services involving pharmacy health care, disease awareness, and educational programs geared toward the promotion of a healthier community at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (UTRGV) and in the Rio Grande Valley. 2. Assist in the recruitment and retention of qualified students into the Cooperative Pharmacy program and pharmacy profession. Strengthen the relationship between pharmacy students and all pre-pharmacy students. 3. Enrich the leadership skills, organizational involvement, and professional development of members. 4. Support the Cooperative Pharmacy program at UTRGV and The University of Texas at Austin by promoting academic excellence and development of the profession of pharmacy.

title: Council of Graduate Chemists
descriptionSnippet: The Council of Graduate Chemists serves on behalf of graduate students in the Department of Chemistry by means of fostering professional and community relationships, informing about school-wide policies, and advocating for our peers needs.
fullDescription: The Council of Graduate Chemists will serve to take ownership of what shapes our experience as graduate students in the Department of Chemistry at the University of Texas-Austin.  This group seeks to benefit all graduate students in chemistry by fostering professional and community relationships, informing about school-wide policies, and advocating for the needs of our peers.

title: Crafter's Circle
descriptionSnippet: We are a crafting club dedicated to crafts of any sort. We hold workshops but we also have supplies for people to try out crafts of any kind and do their own thing. Crafters of all skills are welcome! Come craft with us!
fullDescription: We are an organization dedicated to crafting of any sort. Our general meetings are very laid back and act as a time set apart from your week to focus on your craft and meet and chat with others also interested in crafting. Think of it like a knitting circle except knitting isn't the only craft we do!

title: Creative 40 Acres
descriptionSnippet: Creative 40 Acres celebrates extracurricular creative art-making and cultural expression by UT students wherever it flourishes on our campus.
fullDescription: Sponsored by the College of Fine Arts and the Dean of Students, the Creative 40 Acres encourages originality and creativity, fosters student initiative and leadership, celebrates the cultural diversity of the campus community and cultivates the cultural and commercial value of students’ original artistic work.

title: Creative Art Collective
descriptionSnippet: Whether you're an art major or not, if you love do draw, paint or sculpt this is the club for you. All levels of experience welcome! Our mission is to create a comfortable space for you to create, relax and meet fellow artists.
fullDescription: Who: Whether you’re an expert in art or have never laid hand on a paintbrush in your life, the Creative Art Collective welcomes all who desire to relax, meet new people and have fun while exploring their creative side.

title: Crossroads
descriptionSnippet: We are a student-led campus ministry at the University of Texas at Austin. Our vision is to minister to our classmates at UT and also the surrounding Austin community through campus events, volunteering opportunities, and our many college house churches.

title: Cru Grads
descriptionSnippet: We are a community of graduate students at UT connecting deeply with God, one another, our calling, and the mission of helping others do the same.
fullDescription: Invite. Invest. Thrive.

title: CS Roadshow
descriptionSnippet: We are an outreach organization that aims to increase awareness and interest in computer science among K-12 students.
fullDescription: The CS Roadshow is an organization of students who are passionate about K-12 computer science outreach. We are committed to inspiring and encouraging students to pursue a future in the challenging and exciting field of computer science. The majority of our activities take place at local Austin schools, after-school groups, or at the University of Texas at Austin. Our organization develops interactive exercises that introduce students to elementary computer science concepts and delivers engaging presentations that describe some of the many opportunities students can pursue with a career in computing, including resources available at The University of Texas at Austin.

title: CSD Doctoral Student Group
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of this group is to provide a support system and social outlet for the doctoral students in the Communication Sciences & Disorders Department and related disciplines and to act as a liaison between doctoral students and department faculty.
fullDescription: The purpose of the CSD Doctoral Students Group is to provide a support system and social outlet for the doctoral students in the Communication Sciences & Disorders Department and related disciplines and to act as a liaison between doctoral students and department faculty.

title: Cultural Interests Association
descriptionSnippet: An organization devoted to raising cultural awareness and providing a forum for discussion on all things culture. Please feel free to contact contact us for additional information. Facebook is our primary website.

title: CultureX Texas
descriptionSnippet: CultureX Texas is a family of students gathered to help each other succeed during there time at UT. Members will have opportunities to volunteer with underprivileged communities in Austin, become apart of a family and immerse themselves in black culture.
fullDescription: CultureX Texas is a family of Black students gathered together to help each other succeed during there time at UT. Many African American students upon entering UT have a culture shook at the diversity that is UT. Through this organization we want to help students fell as comfortable  as possible here at UT by providing a safe space for students to thrive here on UT’s campus. Members will have opportunities to volunteer with underprivileged communities in Austin, become apart of a family that will be a home away from home, and educate themselves and other about black culture.

title: Dance Action
descriptionSnippet: Dance Action hopes to create an inclusive dance community that unites artists and dancers and provides a space for exploration and creation. There are two opportunities a year for students to create work and perform.
fullDescription: Dance Action aims to create an inclusive dance community that unities artists and dancers. We provide space for exploration and creation by holding master classes and having at least two opportunities for students to create work and perform for an audience. ANY and ALL majors are welcome to join the Dance Action family.

title: Dancing For a Cause Austin
descriptionSnippet: Dancing for a Cause Austin is a community that creates an open space for dancers to grow and express themselves through freestyle or choreography. DFC strives to facilitate each member's experience by connecting them to the dance scene in Austin.
fullDescription: Dancing for a Cause Austin (Name soon to be changed to The Space) is a community that creates an open space for dancers to grow and express themselves through freestyle or choreography. By offering classes, workshops, and sessions, dancer's will have the resources needed to flourish. DFC strives to facilitate each member's experience by connecting them to the dance scene in Austin.

title: Dean's Scholars Student Association
descriptionSnippet: To promote undergraduate research to the campus at large while ensuring the best undergraduate experience for members of the Dean's Scholars Honors Program in the College of Natural Sciences.
fullDescription: To promote undergraduate research to the campus at large while ensuring the best undergraduate experience for members of the Dean's Scholars Honors Program in the College of Natural Sciences.

title: Dean's Squad
descriptionSnippet: To perform outreach initiatives for the Office of the Dean of Students.
fullDescription: The Dean’s Squad serves the Office of the Dean of Students and UT Austin community in various capacities, including but not limited to representing DoS at activities/functions and supporting registered student organization leaders in their freedom of speech, expression and assembly.

title: Delight Ministries - Texas
descriptionSnippet: A college women’s community that grows together, serves together, learns together, and does life together while chasing the heart of God.

title: Dell Medical School Disaster Response Student Interest Group
descriptionSnippet: The Disaster Response Student Interest Group provides opportunities for students to participate in disaster response training and service opportunities.
fullDescription: The Disaster Response Student Interest Group is an acknowledged Specialty Interest Group of the Specialty Oversight Committee of the Student Senate at Dell Medical School at The University of Texas at Austin.  It works closely with the Department of Population Health.  The goals of the group are to:

title: Dell Medical School Public Health Interest Group
descriptionSnippet: The Dell Medical School Public Health Interest Group provides opportunities for medical students to participate in educational activities, service opportunities, and research projects that aim to improve health in the city of Austin and Travis County.
fullDescription: The Public Health Interest Group is an acknowledged Specialty Interest Group of the Specialty Oversight Committee of the Student Senate at Dell Medical School at The University of Texas at Austin.  It works closely with the Department of Population Health and the UTHealth School of Public Health.  The goals of the group are to:

title: Delta Delta Delta
descriptionSnippet: To develop womanly character through leadership and scholarship....
fullDescription: To develop womanly character through leadership and scholarship.

title: Delta Epsilon Mu-Sigma Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to unite students interested in a career in health services while exposing them to various health professionals.
fullDescription: Delta Epsilon Mu is the first pre-health co-ed professional national fraternity. Our purpose is to unite students interested in a career in health services while exposing them to various health professionals. We want to encourage our members to stay informed of the current events in medicine and to instill in them a sense of responsibility to pursue excellence. Members are given the opportunity to volunteer for outreach programs in a dynamic and cohesive group environment.

title: Delta Epsilon Psi Fraternity, Inc
descriptionSnippet: To instill brotherhood, discipline, and commitment within its members through various social and service driven endeavors

title: Delta Gamma
descriptionSnippet: NPC - Delta Gamma is a women's organization built on a foundation of fostering high ideals of friendship, promoting educational and cultural interests, a true sense of social responsibility and developing the best qualities of character in it's members.
fullDescription: Delta Gamma became a part of the University of Texas in 1939. We strive to bring exceptional young women into a meaningful sisterhood that serves as a home away from home.

title: Delta Kappa Delta Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Delta Kappa Delta commits itself to sisterhood among the many women of the Indian subcontinental culture, to the development of the indomitable spirit, and the betterment of the community through humanitarian services. Furthermore, we dedicate ourselves.
fullDescription: Delta Kappa Delta commits itself to sisterhood among the many women of the Indian subcontinental culture, to the development of the indomitable spirit, and the betterment of the community through humanitarian services. Furthermore, we dedicate ourselves to personal cultural enrichment through awareness and preservation of traditions and morals.

title: Delta Kappa Epsilon Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Originally founded at Yale in 1844 and in 1912 at The University of Texas. Gentlemen, Scholars, and Jolly-Goodfellows. http://omegachidke.dekeunited.org/
fullDescription: Delta Kappa Epsilon is the only fraternity who can boast having five presidents of the United States as alumni (Rutherford B. Hayes, Theodore Roosevelt, Gerald Ford, George H. W. Bush, and George W.Bush). The Omega Chi chapter alone has brother Alan Bean, who brought our flag to the moon with him on the Apollo 12 mission, and brother Tom Landry who brought twenty consecutive wins to the Dallas Cowboys. This fraternity turns men into leaders. Come out and join in our rush events!

title: Delta Sigma Phi Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Delta Sigma Phi Fraternity is a non-hazing organization devoted to the cultivation of a cohesive brotherhood organized around ideals designed to promote leadership, scholarship, and loyalty.
fullDescription: Delta Sigma Phi Fraternity is a non-hazing organization devoted to the cultivation of a cohesive brotherhood organized around ideals designed to promote leadership scholarship, and loyalty.

title: Delta Sigma Pi
descriptionSnippet: Delta Sigma Pi is a professional fraternity organized to foster the study of business in universities; to encourage scholarship, social activity and the association of students for their mutual advancement by research and practice; to promote closer af..
fullDescription: Delta Sigma Pi is a professional fraternity organized to foster the study of business in universities; to encourage scholarship, social activity and the association of students for their mutual advancement by research and practice; to promote closer affiliation between the commercial world and students of commerce, and to further a higher standard of commercial ethics and culture and the civic and commercial welfare of the community.

title: Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of our sisterhood is to impact communities and transform lives through our commitment to public service. While sisterhood is the core of our sorority, we also strive to attain the highest levels of scholastic excellence. The major programs ...
fullDescription: The purpose of our sisterhood is to impact communities and transform lives through our commitment to public service. While sisterhood is the core of our sorority, we also strive to attain the highest levels of scholastic excellence. The major programs of the sorority are based upon our organizations Five Point Programmatic Thrust; which consists of Economic Development, Educational Development, International Awareness and Involvement, Physical and Mental Health, Political Awareness and Involvement. Ultimately, we are a sisterhood called to serve.

title: Delta Tau Delta Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Delt represents a living-learning experience which presents one with challenges and opportunities. It gives a person the chance to meet people, share his talents, and take advantage of the talents of others. Its programs reflect the interests of its me.
fullDescription: Delt represents a living-learning experience which presents one with challenges and opportunities. It gives a person the chance to meet people, share his talents, and take advantage of the talents of others. Its programs reflect the interests of its members and also bring about companionship meant to last a lifetime.

title: Delta Theta Phi International Law Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: To foster lifelong friendships and professional affiliations through legal education, international networking, and mutual respect.
fullDescription: To foster lifelong friendships and professional affiliations through legal education, international networking, and mutual respect.

title: Delta Upsilon
descriptionSnippet: Men's Fraternity - Building Better Men by focusing on our non-secret heritage and Four Founding Principles: The Promotion of Friendship, Diffusion of Liberal Culture, The Development of Character, and The Advancement of Justice.

title: Design for America at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: DFA at Texas is part of a national network of interdisciplinary students who use human-centered design to create social impact. We are committed to working with members of the the community to tackle issues in Austin.

title: Dialogue Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The goal of the DSA is to make a basis for people of different faiths to come together in a group environment and help find solutions and present these solutions and help reach a common conclusion in a united effort. Through the use of team work, problem
fullDescription: The goal of the DSA is to make a basis for people of different faiths and cultures to come together in a group environment and help find solutions and present these solutions and help reach a common conclusion in a united effort. Through the use of team work, problem solving, learning and working together for a common goal we believe that prejudice and social tension can be eased with dialogue and greater understanding of different groups.

title: Direct Democracy Society
descriptionSnippet: Advancing the goals of worker ownership of private property and a society in which every citizen has a vote that matters.
fullDescription: The Direct Democracy Society is created with the purpose of advancing the goal of worker ownership of the means of production and a government under which each citizen has the right to vote directly on every issue impacting them. In pursuit of this, the Society shall hold joint discussions with other political groups and monthly meetings to discuss the Society’s political stance. The guiding principles of the Society are openness, inclusiveness, and collective effort.

title: Disability Advocacy Student Coalition
descriptionSnippet: The Disability Advocacy Student Coalition (DASC) is a student organization with the purpose of promoting awareness, advocacy and education about disabilities!
fullDescription: The Disability Advocacy Student Coalition (DASC) is a student organization with the purpose of promoting awareness, advocacy and education about disabilities on campus and in the surrounding community. Our pillars include advocacy and awareness, professionalism, friendship, and philanthropy. We are a disability hub for UT Austin. Meetings are held every Monday from 6-7 in SAC 1.118. Join us!

title: Disneyy Club Texas
descriptionSnippet: Disneyy Club Texas is a social organization that aims to support students interested in animation and media in a fun, creative environment!
fullDescription: Do you love animation, media, and everything in between? Do you wish you had a place on campus to express yourself creatively and network with open-minded people? We are a group of fun, active college students looking to provide just that!

title: Diversity in Advertising & PR
descriptionSnippet: Our goal is to increase knowledge of advertising & public relations opportunities available for minority students, create a community to foster networking relationships, as well as promote diversity in the advertising and public relations field.
fullDescription: Diversity in Advertising and Public Relations was founded as Minorities in Advertising in 2013 at The University of Texas at Austin. A small group of female, multicultural woman looked around and realized that the industry lacked diversity and decided to try and change that. MIA would then go on to become Diversity in Advertising and PR (DA&PR), in order to become a more inclusive organization and to create an empowering space for like-minded individuals. We stand on the three pillars of diversity, networking, and professionalism.

title: Division of Diversity and Community Engagement
descriptionSnippet: Our division embraces and encourages diversity in all its forms. We strive for an inclusive community that fosters an open, enlightened, robust learning environment. A free exchange of ideas requires mutual respect and consideration for our differences.
fullDescription: Our division embraces and encourages diversity in all its forms. We strive for an inclusive community that fosters an open, enlightened and robust learning environment. A free exchange of ideas requires mutual respect and consideration for our differences. It is important to think of diversity not as a path toward uniformity, but as a way to acknowledge and value everyone’s varied experiences. This is especially vital in the increasingly multicultural state of Texas and global marketplace. All students, regardless of their backgrounds, benefit from a diverse learning environment.

title: Division of Student Affairs
descriptionSnippet: As educators, Division of Student Affairs at The University of Texas at Austin supports students throughout their university experience by providing the best and most innovative programs, facilities and services.
fullDescription: With nine departments, 37 units and 38 facilities, the Division of Student Affairs provides a cutting-edge student experience by working with academic partners, staff, parents and student leaders. From orientation through graduation, the Division offers students access to first-class programs, facilities and services. They include 14 on-campus residence halls, dining facilities, medical and mental health services, new student orientation, recreational sports and two university unions. The Division employs 2,000 students annually and supports more than 1,100 student organizations, student emergency and veteran services, and leadership programs.

title: DKA Professional Cinematic Society
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of DKA is to foster lifelong character, collaborative and creative storytelling, ethical and productive business practices, philanthropic action, and serve as a resource for students of the cinematic arts.

title: DKMS Texas
descriptionSnippet: Our mission is to raise awareness about blood cancers and bone marrow donation throughout the UT Austin community, as well as host bone marrow registry drives throughout the year. Reach out to us if you would like to help and support our cause.
fullDescription: The purpose of this organization is to raise awareness and educate the public about blood cancers and bone marrow donation, as well as host several bone marrow donor registry drives each semester.

title: Doctors Without Borders at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: Doctors Without Borders at UT Austin seeks to open doors for students to get involved in medicine and public service while fundraising for and supporting the efforts of Médecins Sans Frontières both here in Austin and abroad.
fullDescription: Doctors Without Borders at UT Austin seeks to open doors for students to get involved in medicine and community service while fundraising for and supporting the efforts of Médecins Sans Frontières both here in Austin and abroad. DWB at UT Austin focuses on healthcare-related community service, refugee outreach, and global humanitarianism involving medical service.

title: Dr. Qadri's Cancer Heroes
descriptionSnippet: Dr. Qadri's Cancer Heroes is a charity founded in memory of Dr.Ahmad Qadri to help raise money for those currently battling cancer. Questions? Email us at dqcancerheroes@gmail.com. Keep updated with our fb page @Dr. Qadri's Cancer Heroes.
fullDescription: Dr. Ahmad Qadri was a respected Oncologist and Hematologist who spent his life treating people in their fight against cancer.Dr. Qadri's Cancer Heroes is a charity founded in his honor to help continue this fight by raising money for those currently battling Pediatric cancer, as well as those who are struggling with the financial costs of treatment. This Dr. Qadri Cancer Heroes chapter is a student organization that will help raise money for this charity.

title: Dream Corps at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: Dream Corps at UT works closely with students, educators, and communities to raise awareness for children in rural China. Indicated by its slogan “Let Reading Inspire”, Dream Corps at UT is dedicated to promoting reading among children.

title: e-NABLE at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: 3D printing prosthetic upper limbs and distributing them to Central Texas amputees at no cost.
fullDescription: e-NABLE at UT Austin encourages students to take advantage of the 3D printing resources on the UT Austin. The members will first learn how to print the prosthetics. Then, members will interact with amputees in order to get hand measurements and thus work on an individualized hand. Each recipient gets his or her hand for free! In a couple years, e-NABLE at UT Austin will be working on improving the designs themselves. Hopefully this organization will reduce the financial and logistic burden amputation places on tens to hundreds of families.

title: EERI (Earthquake Engineering Research Institute)
descriptionSnippet: Our goal is to expose students to state-of-the-art earthquake engineering research and design practices, as well as to provide an additional means of communicating UT research findings to other students and to the industry.
fullDescription: To expose students to state-of-the-art earthquake engineering research and design practices, as well as to provide an additional means of communicating UT research findings to other students and to the industry.

title: Election Supervisory Board
descriptionSnippet: The Election Supervisory Board (ESB) is tasked with conducting and overseeing all campus-wide student elections.
fullDescription: The Election Supervisory Board (ESB) is tasked with conducting and overseeing all campus-wide student elections. The entities that defer to the ESB for election processes are: Graduate Student Assembly, Texas Student Media, University Co-op, University Unions, and Student Government. It is the exclusive prerogative of the ESB to hear complaints, conduct hearings, and release decisions and advisory opinions regarding election activities. These and all other powers granted to the ESB fall strictly within the purview of the election Code, which is adopted by each aforementioned entities, revised annually, and approved by the Office of the Dean of Students.

title: Electronic Game Developers Society
descriptionSnippet: To allow students opportunities to network with the gaming industry and to provide a forum where they may learn about game development and improve their skills.
fullDescription: https://www.facebook.com/groups/egadsaustin/

title: ELPSA Student Organization
descriptionSnippet: The Higher Education Leadership and Policy Student Association (HELPSA) exists to support the pursuits of graduate students at UT Austin.
fullDescription: The Higher Education Leadership and Policy Student Association (HELPSA) exists to support the pursuits of graduate students at UT Austin, both at the Masters and Doctoral level, who are interested in the advancement of higher education administration through professional development, leadership, community building and networking, service, and mentorship.

title: Emancipet on Campus
descriptionSnippet: We provide animal-related volunteer opportunities and activities for the betterment of animal welfare in the city of Austin.
fullDescription: Welcome to Emancipet on Campus, a student organization at The University of Texas at Austin! Our mission is to provide an outlet for members to actively serve the animal-welfare oriented community of Austin and to continuously represent the interests of and raise awareness for the non-profit veterinary cause of the Emancipet clinic of Austin.

title: embrACE
descriptionSnippet: embrACE is an organization where UT students who fall under the asexual or aromantic umbrella of sexual orientations can connect with other ace/aro students. We’re a social org and a safe space for ace/aro students to be openly ace/aro.
fullDescription: embrACE is an opportunity for ace/aro people to meet other ace/aro people. We meet every Thursday evening at 5pm in the GSC (SAC 2.112). During these meetings, we have discussions about asexuality and aromanticism, hold viewings of asexual-centric media (including documentaries), and spread awareness of what asexuality and aromanticism actually are. We also just generally goof around and provide a support network for our members and a place to exist and be ace!

title: Embrace Relief at the University of Texas
descriptionSnippet: At Embrace Relief at the University of Texas, we unify and encourage constructive thought and action towards solving current issues on the local and international scale.
fullDescription: At Embrace Relief at the University of Texas, we unify and encourage constructive thought and action towards solving current issues on the international landscape. We are an organization centered around increasing awareness of and delivering assistance to survivors of natural disasters and social injustice. Members will make noticeable changes in their local sphere and even internationally by engaging in local Austin community service, international disaster relief, and advocating for social justice in foreign nations where human rights abuses occur regularly. By bringing our club into close contact with real, human issues, be they near or far, we want to develop our members into people who can empower others to keep paying it forward.

title: Engineering Chamber Orchestra
descriptionSnippet: To create a college-wide musical society that provides flexible opportunities for students to enjoy making music together. The Orchestra ultimately envisions to establish a unique musical culture within the Cockrell School of Engineering and beyond.
fullDescription:
The Engineering Chamber Orchestra (EChO) is an organization open to all musically inclined students, faculty, and staff throughout The University of Texas at Austin. Its mission is to preserve musical interest and appreciation by encouraging its members to promote music in the community. Our organization offers members the opportunity to participate in unique chamber ensemble experiences not found anywhere else on campus.

EChO members rehearse a variety of music in ensembles of two to five members. At the end of each semester, they have the opportunity to showcase their efforts in a public concert series. Members also have opportunities to promote music music by teaching kids about the science behind music and performing at nursing homes.

Founded in the fall of 2009, EChO was immensely popular from its inception, with 70 new members grouped into small ensembles. In the spring of 2013, EChO started its first ever orchestra with only 13 string players. Now in its sixth year of existence, EChO boasts 157 members in 45 ensembles and one full orchestra with 38 performers.

title: Engineers for a Sustainable World
descriptionSnippet: ESW mobilizes students through education, technical projects, and collaborative action to impact local and global sustainability challenges. Instagram @ESWUT --- Twitter @ESW_UTEXAS --- Facebook @ESWUTEXAS
fullDescription:
Our chapter pursues many activities focused on the promotion of sustainability. Our members run multiple technical projects at any given time, like our aquaponics team or our solar power smoothie cart. We regularly attend various events around campus where we educate others on the benefits of sustainability, and we volunteer for activities like the Girl Day and Explore UT. We provide our members with a frame work to pursue their sustainable goals!

VISION
A world in which engineering fosters environmental, social, and economic sustainability
​to ​improve both the quality of life and the condition of our planet.

MISSION
ESW mobilizes engineers and non-engineers through education, training, and action. 
​We build collaborative partnerships to meet the needs of current and future generations.

title: English Council
descriptionSnippet: English Council's primary goal is to create a closer knit community within the English Department by hosting social, volunteer, and academic events.
fullDescription: The English Council is a student organization under the Department of English devoted to representing the interests of English students. Our purpose is to serve as a student voice to the department by working with the English administration to ensure that the opinions and concerns of the students are heard. We are also committed to encouraging a sense of community among students and promoting student life within the department by sponsoring various social and academic events. Members participate in hosting social, volunteer, and academic events for the English community.

title: Envirnomental Justice and Eco-Therapy Student Organization
descriptionSnippet: Mission: To expand education and awareness, and to promote engagement and action around eco-therapy practices and environmental justice issues within the field of social work, our school, and our broader communities.
fullDescription: Started by social work students at UT Austin, the Environmental Justice and Eco-Therapy Student Organization seeks to expand education and awareness, and to promote engagement and action around ecotherapy practices and environmental justice issues within the field of social work, our school, and our broader communities. The organization will host speakers on the topics, facilitate workshops, and attend relevant events in the community.

title: Environmental Law Society
descriptionSnippet: To promote awareness of issues in environmental law.
fullDescription: The Environmental Law Society is a social and professional student organization at The University of Texas School of Law that coordinates and brings together environmentally-minded students for educational, volunteer, career-oriented and social events. ELS provides UT students with networking events, an environmental job database, and its members' various experiences in order to assist fellow members in pursuing environmental career opportunities both during and after law school. ELS also sponsors hiking and camping trips, happy hours, and speakers in an effort to provide a better Law School experience for its members.

title: Epic Movement
descriptionSnippet: We are a missional movement that desires to know Jesus & to make His name known. We are committed to provide an environment and community that allows for the exploration, experience, & commitment to Christianity, especially in the Asian American context.
fullDescription: We are a missional movement that desires to know Jesus and to make His name known. We are committed to provide an environment and community that allows for the exploration, application, communication of the Christian faith, especially in the context of the Asian American culture.

title: Episcopal Campus Ministry
descriptionSnippet: Students inviting other students to fellowship within the Episcopal church. Come as you are, all are welcome.
fullDescription: Students inviting other students to fellowship within the Episcopal church. Come as you are, all are welcome.

title: eQual MBAs
descriptionSnippet: Engaged Queer and Ally MBAs make up eQual MBAs at McCombs, is a student organization dedicated to promoting diversity and inclusion within the Texas McCombs MBA program and the business community at large.
fullDescription: Engaged Queer and Ally MBAs make up eQual MBAs at McCombs, is a student organization dedicated to promoting diversity and inclusion within the Texas McCombs MBA program and the business community at large. eQual strives to sponsor and promote mission-supporting events, training, and content that’s inclusive of the student wide audience. We are also the primary connection point between McCombs MBAs and LGBTQ+ student, alumni, local, and professional communities and organizations.

title: Eta Kappa Nu: Electrical Engineering
descriptionSnippet: To honor outstanding electrical engineering students who have excelled in scholarship, character and leadership.
fullDescription: Eta Kappa Nu (HKN), Psi Chapter, is the Electrical and Computer Engineering Honor Society at the University of Texas at Austin. We provide a venue for upper-division ECE honor students to meet each other, interact with the corporate world, and serve the Department, the University, and the community. Like all chapters of HKN, we are dedicated to encouraging and recognizing excellence in the fields of Electrical and Computer Engineering.

title: Euphoria ATX
descriptionSnippet: Euphoria ATX connects students with the Austin music scene by allowing members to gain real-world experience in event coordination, hosting interviews with local music industry professionals, and cultivating a close-knit community of music enthusiasts.

title: Evading A Rest: Texas Law Running Club
descriptionSnippet: A running club for law students.
fullDescription: Evading A Rest: Texas Law Running Club is a recreational social running club for law students.

title: Every Nation Campus
descriptionSnippet: Every Nation Campus (ENC) is a community of college students, centered on the Gospel, and set on impacting the culture. We desire to know and follow Jesus, making disciples that walk in the fear of the Lord and the power of the Spirit.
fullDescription: To teach from the Bible the message of Jesus Christ, and to provide an ethnically and racially diverse environment where students can grow and discover Christ with other students. Through leadership training and development, we hope to instill into students the desire for spiritual growth, self-improvement, scholastic and moral excellence, and civic responsibility.

title: Excellence Mentorship Club
descriptionSnippet: We are an inclusive mentorship group for underserved or minority pre-medical students with an aim to aid in the pursuit of becoming a physician in the future.

title: Falun Dafa
descriptionSnippet: Falun Dafa Association provides opportunities to students, staff and faculty members to learn Falun Dafa, an ancient Chinese meditation exercise, to know the truth of Falun Dafa, and to have a better understanding of traditional Chinese Divine Culture.
fullDescription: The purpose of UT Falun Dafa Student Association is to offer opportunities to students, staff and faculty members, to have access to and learn Falun Dafa, so as to know the truth of Falun Dafa, and to have a better understanding of traditional Chinese Divine Culture.

title: Fashion Anonymous
descriptionSnippet: All people's coming together to creatively recover from Fast Fashion. Did you know that the fashion industry is the largest employer in the world, and the second most polluting? It's time to make a change.
fullDescription: There are many ways to participate in Fashion Anonymous. The first level is by coming to a meeting and learning about the fashion industry and how we can make small changes in our lives to have a big impact. We are hosting a movie screening each semester that you can come to and possibly win one of our sustainable items. In addition there are fun events to inspire you to take a creative approach to your wardrobe (up-cycling, over dying, and maybe even creating something new). Lastly we are all activists and plan to have campaigns to get our fellow Longhorns talking about what we and the university can do to truly be World Changers.

title: Fearless Leadership Institute Student Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Fearless Leadership Institute is an initiative for academic and personal development for students. Recognizing the importance of both personal and professional growth for undergraduates, FLI has two programmatic areas: personal & professional development
fullDescription: The Fearless Leadership Institute (FLI) is designed to advance Black Women through academic excellence, professional development, and personal growth. Several campus programs are organized throughout the semester that focus on all aspects of personal and professional development. We hold weekly workshops to address topics ranging from financial responsibility to networking to healthy relationships. Our mission is to cultivate empowered and innovative women as they prepare to graduate from The University of Texas at Austin and move into the next stages of their lives.

title: Feminist Action Project
descriptionSnippet: The Feminist Action Project is a student group at the University of Texas at Austin that organizes activist programs, conversations and events for gender justice with the collaboration of the Gender and Sexuality Center.
fullDescription: Our values as feminists include the intentional intersectional gender justice framework that strives to combat oppression and promote equity with awareness. We aim to exemplify these values by focusing on moving beyond binaries, valuing individual experiences, deconstructing privileges, and learning from history. We hope to accomplish these goals through openness and discussion, collective learning and engagement with other social justice communities, self-education and collaboration.

title: Feminist Policy Alliance
descriptionSnippet: The Feminist Policy Alliance is an inclusive community for LBJ School students focusing on policy issues affecting women and increasing the presence of women in policymaking.
fullDescription:
The Feminist Policy Alliance is an inclusive community for LBJ School students focusing on policy issues affecting women and increasing the presence of women in policy making. We strive to bring a feminist perspective to the LBJ School, the University of Texas community, and the Austin community. We host events, do volunteer work, provide networking opportunities for members, and conduct feminist advocacy.

The Feminist Policy Alliance is a nonpartisan organization. We have taken stances on pieces of legislation that affect women in past legislative sessions, and have always done so by a vote of the membership. We do not endorse candidates, but we do strive to increase the number of women running for office.


Organizational goals:
• Foster dialogue and raise awareness
• Advocacy and community service
• Collaboration
• Provide a supportive community
• Increase membership
• Democratic decision making
• Networking and providing resources

title: Filipino Students Association
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the organization shall be to serve as a social group for Filipinos, their friends, and anyone interested in the Philippines; to represent the Filipino culture at The University of Texas; and to educate and inform the University communit...
fullDescription: The purpose of the organization shall be to serve as a social group for Filipinos, their friends, and anyone interested in the Philippines; to represent the Filipino culture at The University of Texas; and to educate and inform the University community of the Philippines.

title: Fine Arts Council
descriptionSnippet: The Fine Arts Council serves as the official voice of the College of Fine Arts alongside the Senate of College Councils and Student Government to address academic affairs, student life, and university wide concerns.
fullDescription: The Fine Arts Council continually seeks to raise the standard of education for College of Fine Arts students at the University of Texas at Austin by facilitating student-faculty interaction, promoting academic excellence, encouraging collaboration between departments, and representing students in matters of college and university-wide concerns.

title: First Generation Law Students
descriptionSnippet: Our mission is to help guide first generation law students by building a community that gives them the tools to succeed at Texas Law and throughout their careers.

title: Flow Conference Committee
descriptionSnippet: The committee, composed of current RTF graduate students is in charge of planning and executing a media studies conference to be held on the University campus.
fullDescription: The committee, composed of current RTF graduate students is in charge of planning and executing a media studies conference to be held on the University campus.

title: Food Recovery Network-Longhorn Chapter
descriptionSnippet: We recover surplus food from restaurants and donate it to food banks, the Salvation Army, Caritas of Austin, and Street Youth Ministry. We pickup food from O's Cafe on campus. We also pickup bread from Mandalas, Upper Crust, and other local restaurants.
fullDescription: Recover Surplus food from UT Austin dining halls and local food stands and donate it to local Austin food banks.

title: Foot in the Door Theatre
descriptionSnippet: Foot in the Door is a student-run theatre group affiliated with the Liberal Arts Honors Program at UT Austin. We put on four shows a year, with students involved/leading all aspects of the productions. All students are welcome to audition!
fullDescription: **LOOKING FOR DIRECTORS**

title: Forever Texas
descriptionSnippet: To instill the values of sisterhood, leadership, scholarship, and service in each and every one of our members through a variety of self and community improvement activities...

title: Foundation for International Medical Relief of Children Chapter at The Univeristy of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: This chapters goal will be to fundraise for the national organization through various small events held through the semester (BBQ's, bake sales, ect). We will also help raise awareness for Children in developing countries by spreading the word of FIMRC.

title: Friar Society
descriptionSnippet: To recognize students for outstanding contribution to The University.
fullDescription: Since 1911, the Friar Society has recognized students who have made significant contributions to The University of Texas, and is the oldest honor society at the University.

title: Friends of Street Youth
descriptionSnippet: Friends of Street Youth is dedicated to meeting the needs of street dependent youth and promoting safe and healthy relationships between members of the student body and street youth around campus.
fullDescription:
The purpose of this organization is:

*To promote safe and healthy relationships between street-dependent youth in the campus area and the student body 
*To raise awareness about existence and needs of street youth
*To re-purpose and redirect surplus or unwanted material to help meet some needs of street youth in the UT Austin area

title: Front and Center
descriptionSnippet: Provide performance opportunities for performance artists around campus....
fullDescription: Provide performance opportunities for performance artists around campus.

title: Fuse A Cappella
descriptionSnippet: Fuse A Cappella is a co-ed a cappella group at UT that performs on campus, in the community, and in competition. Join Fuse, and join a family of close friends that loves singing as much as you do!
fullDescription: Founded in the spring of 2014, Fuse A Cappella is an official a cappella group on campus that competes, serves its community, and performs on and off campus. It was founded to unite a focused group of students across all majors, hometowns, and backgrounds, by their love of singing. If you would like to continue making music during college, contribute a new cultural perspective, or make a close group of friends, Fuse A Cappella is for you!

title: Fusion Belly Dance
descriptionSnippet: We practice dances centered around belly dancing together weekly. Any skill level and major are welcome!
fullDescription:
We're a new and inclusive dance club practicing stylized dances centered around belly dancing.
Any skill level and major are welcome. We're beginner friendly!

title: Future Doctors of America
descriptionSnippet: To provide premedical UT students with opportunities and resources including but not limited to: physician speakers, volunteering, a social environment, scholarships, and a place to meet and make friends.
fullDescription: Future Doctors of America is a organization focused on aiding UT students on their pre-med journey. We encourage a family atmosphere with other students on similar paths through family nights, off campus socials, and other group activities. We also focus on professional resources and service, this includes but is not limited to: physician speakers, volunteering, scholarships, and mentorship.

title: Gamma Beta Fraternity, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: The official purpose of the Gamma Beta Fraternity is to better each member, as an individual and as a whole, and all those in contact with Gamma Beta through a brotherhood promoting and enforcing morality, discipline, responsibility, an unprecedented s...
fullDescription: Gamma Beta is one of the premier Asian-interest fraternities established at The University of Texas at Austin. We proudly enter our 13th year of excellence, leadership, lifelong friendships, and service to our community. Even after a decade, our ideals remain firm: Brotherhood, Morality, Discipline, Responsibility, and High Academic Standards. Termed the “Gentlemen” amongst the Asian Greeks, GBs excel academically, socially, culturally, and professionally. The experience of being a part of Gamma Beta is unlike anything that you can imagine. If you decide to become a part of our family, you will grow to become a Gamma Beta Gentleman; one who is mature, confident, and excels at all aspects of life.

title: Gamma Beta Phi Society
descriptionSnippet: Gamma Beta Phi Texas chapter honors more than 450 undergrad to doctoral UT students who have demonstrated a history of academic excellence as well as an initiative to make a difference, professionally and personally.
fullDescription: The organization of Gamma Beta Phi was charted on March 22, 1964 in Spartanburg, South Carolina. Today, the National headquarters are in Oak Ridge, Tennessee and Gamma Beta Phi has grown into a nation-wide network of over 85 chapters representing 16 different states. The University of Texas chapter is one of 139 chapters across the United States collegiate population. Thousands of new members are inducted into Gamma Beta Phi each year. Currently, there are 40,000 active student members dedicating their time to service, scholastics, and social bonds.

title: Gamma Iota Sigma @ UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: Gamma Iota Sigma (GIS) - Gamma Zeta Chapter is a national business fraternity with focus in Data Science, Risk Management, Insurance, and Actuarial Science. GIS accepts students from all academic disciplines.

title: Gamma Rho Lambda
descriptionSnippet: We are UT's only LGBTQ+/progressive all-inclusive Greek organization! If you are in need of an accepting and fun family on the 40 acres, check us out, we would love to have you!
fullDescription: Gamma Rho Lambda is a Greek organization, a social safe space, and a family. We welcome everyone regardless of identity and would love to have you join us! We hold a series of rush events at the beginning of each semester, reach out to us and find us on Facebook for more info!

title: Gen U
descriptionSnippet: Organization for UT undergraduate students who identify as first generation
fullDescription: Gen U is intended to create a space for first-generation students, meaning that they are the first in their family to attend a post-secondary institution in the United States with the goal of graduating (it is acceptable by our standards that a student may identify as first generation even if one parent or guardian attended a post-secondary institution in a country outside of the United States as the education systems differ between countries and/or possible language barriers), to navigate school with the support of other first generation students. The mission of Gen U is  to maximize their potential abilities and make use of any and all applicable resources to lessen obstacles that may present themselves for students in their pursuit of achieving academic goals. Our aim is to expand the knowledge of first generation students in social, academic, and professional settings.

title: Gender & Sexuality Center: Serving Women and LGBTQA Communities
descriptionSnippet: The Gender and Sexuality Center provides opportunities for all members of the UT Austin community to explore, organize, and promote learning around issues of gender and sexuality.
fullDescription: The center facilitates a greater responsiveness to the needs of women and the lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, questioning, and ally (LGBTQA) communities through education, outreach and advocacy. For an overview of what we do, see our Gender and Sexuality Center General Brochure (PDF). Hours: Monday – Thursday, 9 am – 7 pm and Friday, 9 am – 5 pm. Summer Hours: Monday- Friday 9am-5pm E-Mail: gsc@austin.utexas.edu Phone: 512-232-1831 Visit: SAC 2.112

title: Generation Citizen Texas
descriptionSnippet: Generation Citizen Texas aims to educate the citizens of tomorrow about actively participating in local government and becoming active citizens. We work with middle and high schools to go into classrooms and teach an "active civics" curriculum.
fullDescription: Generation Citizen Texas works to educate middle and high school students to become engaged and active citizens though an in-school "action civics" curriculum.  Students take action on very local issues that affect them (gang violence, teen jobs, public transit) and learn about politics and government by making real change.  GCT partners our members with classrooms so they may take on the role of "Democracy Coach" who helps facilitate the 10 week curriculum. Our members will learn about local government processes and issues in order to prepare to help younger students throughout the semester.

title: Generation United Nations at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: Our goal will be to work on sustainable development in the Austin community through philanthropic events and volunteering.
fullDescription: Generation United Nations at the University of Texas at Austin is a chapter of the national organization GEN-U.N. which is the student branch of the United Nations-U.S.A.Generation United Nations at the University of Texas at Austin is an organization working to raise awareness for the 17 U.N. sustainable development initiatives. This organization seeks to create philanthropic events targeting disadvantaged communities and social causes. Furthermore, the organization seeks to foster a community of members aspiring to be global citizens, and provides an academic and social experience to expose college students to cultural diversity and worldwide issues. The pillars which agents stand for are global thinking, community development, and cultural activities. The goal of the organization is to produce students with a global perspective regardless of their chosen career pathway, and to make a sustainable impact in the Austin community targeting the 17 U.N. initiatives.

title: Geo-Institute
descriptionSnippet: Student chapter of ASCE's Geo-Institute.
fullDescription: The objective of our Geo-Institute student organization is to enhance experience of geotechnical engineering graduate students at UT Austin.  We achieve our objective by planning a weekly seminar series featuring visiting professors and industry professionals, organizing and subsidizing conferences attendance, routinely tapping into our extensive alumni network for job opportunities, and providing a cohesive social community on campus.  Our members are primarily graduate students studying geotechnical engineering, but membership and events are almost always open to any interested individuals.

title: GeoFORCE Longhorn
descriptionSnippet: GeoFORCE Longhorn is a social and service group committed to encouraging graduate members of GeoFORCE Texas to give back to the GeoFORCE Program and the community of Austin.
fullDescription: Official Purpose

title: Geography Society
descriptionSnippet: The Geography Society is an undergraduate student group dedicated to providing a social, educational, and philanthropic outlet for students interested in geography, urban studies, sustainability studies, and environmental science.
fullDescription: The Geography Society is an undergraduate student group dedicated to providing a platform and social outlet for students interested in geography. They provide support for participation in undergraduate research, professional development through speaker series, workshops, internship info, volunteer opportunities, and social outings.

title: Getting Radical In The South
descriptionSnippet: GRITS is a group housed in Texas Law that brings together the UT community to explore radical legal advocacy in the South. The primary focus is community lawyering, meaning that we partner with social justice advocates working outside of the law.
fullDescription: Getting Radical in the South (GRITS) is intended to foster an environment on the University of Texas campus, specifically within Texas Law, that explores and promotes radical advocacy in the South. Each year we host a multi-day conference that brings together members of the entire University of Texas community, students throughout the South, and professionals working in advocacy spaces. Our conference consists of various speakers and workshops that are aimed at helping students around the country learn about various social justice issues affecting the South, while also equipping them with the tools and skills that will help them to become more impactful advocates.

title: GHealth Austin
descriptionSnippet: A health science tutoring/teaching organization working with Dell Medical School, LifeWorks Austin, and the American Heart Association to enhance GED programs to improve health and education for at-risk students and their communities.
fullDescription: GHealth Austin is a health science education organization. Our mission is to help prepare students for High School Equivalency tests (like the GED exam) and increase their health literacy through innovative teaching and tutoring, equipping them to achieve their educational goals and to improve their health and the health of their communities.

title: Gigglepants Improv Comedy Troupe
descriptionSnippet: Gigglepants is a short-form improv comedy troupe on the UT Campus Every show is made up on the spot and this never-been-done-before comedy is all based off of audience suggestions! We believe in good, clean, fun and we do it all for free!
fullDescription: Shortly after being founded in the harsh Austin winter of 2003, Gigglepants ascended to greatness to become UT's best (and only) short-form improv comedy troupe. We perform free shows to packed crowds on every other Friday night. Each show is completely made up on the spot, making each one a completely unique (and hilarious) experience.

title: Girl Up at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas at Austin chapter of Girl Up aims to foster empowerment, leadership, philanthropy and outreach for girls around the world.
fullDescription:
Girl Up is a United Nations Foundation campaign aimed at empowering young girls in developing countries. It utilizes the energy and passion of girls and boys to raise funds and spread awareness of the campaign. 

The UT chapter of Girl Up seeks to put on at least one fundraiser and advocacy activity per semester for the United Nations. 

All funds raised will go to girls in developing countries like Ethiopia, Guatemala, Liberia and Malawi to help with education, health, safety and leadership to empower young girls.

title: GirlAdvocates!
descriptionSnippet: Join us for meetings, biweekly! To empower adolescent girls through philanthropy, service, and mentorship
fullDescription: Girl Advocates! seeks to empower women at UT and beyond through philanthropy, service, and mentorship.

title: GirlForward @UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: We are an organization dedicated to helping educate displaced girls who have resettled in the Austin community.

title: GLBTQA+ Business Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender, Questioning, and Ally Business Student Association is a professional organization that provides GLBTQA+ students with networking opportunities through corporate interaction and community-building events.
fullDescription: The Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender, Questioning, and Ally Business Student Association is a professional organization that provides GLBTQA students of any major and identity with networking opportunities through corporate interaction and community-building events. Students will learn about career opportunities within varying industries, gain experience talking to professional recruiters and ultimately work towards ending discrimination in the workplace.

title: Global Media
descriptionSnippet: Share, create and collaborate with academic scholarship on global media or international communication. Organize and promote interdisciplinary collaborations among UT undergraduates and graduate students of international media.
fullDescription: Global Media is a student organization created with the purpose of sharing, creating and collaborating with academic scholarship on global media or international communication. The organization also aims to organize and promote interdisciplinary collaborations among UT undergraduates and graduate students of international media. Foster an inviting environment for new and current students interested in global media and international communications, and guide them through university resources and policies for research.

title: Global Medical Brigades
descriptionSnippet: Global Medical Brigades provides pre-professional students with the opportunity to gain experience in the medical field through the study and application of hands-on training in Honduras, Panama, Nicaragua and Ghana through service to rural communities.
fullDescription: Global Brigades in the world's largest student-led movement for global health and holistic development. Global Medical Brigades aims to provide pre-professional students with the opportunity to gain real life experience in the medical field through the study and application of hands-on training in rural Latin America, while offering their services to the community at large. GMB is UT Austin's leading volunteer-based international medicine organization, with a dedication to both providing care to underserved populations, and sustainable public health development. Students work in pop-up medical clinics, provide public health education workshops, while also serving the Austin community as well.

title: Global Medical Missions Alliance
descriptionSnippet: Global Medical Missions Alliance is to create networking and mentorship through Christ. We have a passion to cultivate pre-health students to live for a greater purpose, and to desire His Kingdom to come down on our campus and overseas.

title: Global Medical Training
descriptionSnippet: GMT UT is a non-profit organization that empowers students with the knowledge and awareness of the humanitarian need of medical assistance in underserved areas abroad. Meetings are from 6-7pm every other Wednesday. Webpage: www.gmtlonghorn.com
fullDescription: To offer healthcare students the opportunity to obtain first hand medical experience while providing free basic medical services to communities in Central America.

title: Global Nutrition in Medicine
descriptionSnippet: Our organization focuses on improving global health, with an emphasis on nutrition. Our hope is to provide healthcare, education, and support to those in need.
fullDescription: Our organization focuses on improving global health, with an emphasis on nutrition. Our hope is to provide healthcare, education, and support to those in need through spreading local awareness, fundraising, and opportunities to provide direct medical care.

title: Global Surgery Student Alliance at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: To serve as a welcoming group for students with an interest in global surgery and to provide them with resources that promote the awareness of worldwide surgical care, especially focusing on medically under-resourced and disadvantaged populations.
fullDescription: The GSSA undergraduate chapter provides resources for students who want to learn more about global surgery, including:

title: GlobeMed at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: GlobeMed aims to strengthen the movement for global health equity by empowering students and communities to work together to improve the health of the impoverished around the world....
fullDescription: GlobeMed aims to strengthen the movement for global health equity by empowering students and communities to work together to improve the health of the impoverished around the world.

title: Golden Key Longhorn Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Golden Key is the world's largest collegiate honor society. Membership into the Society is by invitation only and applies to the top 15% of college and university sophomores, juniors and seniors, as well as top-performing graduate students in all fields

title: Graduate Associations of Germanic Language Students
descriptionSnippet: GAGLS will be a platform for intellectual exchange among UT graduate students interested in Germanic languages, literatures, linguistics and cultures.
fullDescription: GAGLS will be a platform for intellectual exchange among UT graduate students interested in Germanic languages, literatures, linguistics and cultures.

title: Graduate Business Council
descriptionSnippet: To promote social and intellectual interaction among members, faculty and student body. To encourage teaching excellence, recommend means for improving facilities, and provide a viable means for student expression. To provide a vehicle for the informal...
fullDescription: To promote social and intellectual interaction among members, faculty and student body. To encourage teaching excellence, recommend means for improving facilities, and provide a viable means for student expression. To provide a vehicle for the informal aspects of graduate education. Conduct other activities in support of the overall welfare of the Graduate School of Business of The University of Texas at Austin.

title: Graduate Chemical Engineering Leadership Council
descriptionSnippet: This council is responsible for the management of professional enrichment, social, financial, and recruitment activities as it pertains to chemical engineering graduate students at UT. The council consists of no less than two elected positions ..
fullDescription: This unified council is responsible for the management of professional enrichment, service, social, financial, and recruitment activities as it pertains to chemical engineering graduate students at UT. The council consists of no less than two elected positions as well as an elected council Chair. All ChE graduate students at UT are invited to run for a position on the council and attend open meetings of the council.

title: Graduate Communications Council
descriptionSnippet: The Graduate student governing body in Moody College of Communication

title: GRADUATE COORDINATOR NETWORK
descriptionSnippet: Forum for graduate coordinators & university administrators to exchange information, develop & implement new ideas, learn new skills.

title: Graduate Early Childhood Organization
descriptionSnippet: This is an organization for students with an interest in Early Childhood Education.
fullDescription: GECO is an official registered student organization at the University of Texas. Acting as both an information repository on topics of interest to current, future and past UT graduate students with an interest in early childhood education as well as providing bimonthly meetings for networking opportunities, professional development activities, as well as information on working, studying, and researching at UT. The organization hosts an annual conference, providing space for graduate students and community teachers/practitioners to share their research. The web site provides general information for early childhood graduate students about a variety of topics including: Links and information on ECE Conferences, Organizations, Job Positions, Student Life FAQ, Events of interest, Research Tips and Contact Information for Current and Past Graduate Students. In addition, there is an active alumni membership that fosters collaboration, networking and connection beyond graduation.

title: Graduate ECE
descriptionSnippet: A social and academic group for graduate ECE students
fullDescription: The mission of Graduate ECE (GREECE) is to represent and further the interests of ECE graduate students and organize track-wide events to foster a sense of community within the ECE department.

title: Graduate Engineering Council
descriptionSnippet: The primary purpose of the GEC is to represent the interests of the graduate engineers at The University of Texas at Austin. The GEC fulfills this purpose, serving as a liaison between the Office of the Dean of Engineering, the Office of the Dean of Gr...
fullDescription: The primary purpose of the GEC is to represent the interests of the graduate engineers at The University of Texas at Austin. The GEC fulfills this purpose, serving as a liaison between the Office of the Dean of Engineering, the Office of the Dean of Graduate Studies and graduate engineers in the College of Engineering.

title: Graduate Indian Students Association
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to serve Indian graduate students (alumni, current, & incoming) at UT Austin. The organization aims to foster a spirit of community and Indian culture and achieve the role of a catalyst for interaction among the members of this community.
fullDescription: Our purpose is to serve Indian graduate students (alumni, current, & incoming) at UT Austin. The organization aims to foster a spirit of community and Indian culture and achieve the role of a catalyst for interaction among the members of this community. It will act as a forum for the Indian grad students to meet and present their views, Organize get-together and fun events for graduate student holidays; arrange information sessions regarding academics/jobs; and welcome and guide the new graduate students.  The organization also intends to conduct cult fests for Indian festivals to showcase Indian culture to students from various nations.

title: Graduate Operations Group
descriptionSnippet: GOG is dedicated to promoting and creating awareness of the Supply Chain and Operations Management concentration at McCombs.
fullDescription: GOG is dedicated to promoting and creating awareness of the Supply Chain and Operations Management concentration at McCombs. The organization works to assists those who want to balance out their MBA with knowledge of project management, supply chain, quality initiatives and process improvement. The goal of the organization is to help members gain a greater exposure to the operations field through a series of factory tours, speakers and the annual Tech-Ops Challenge. It also assists its members in their internship and full-time employment searches.

title: Graduate Organization for Comparative Literature Students
descriptionSnippet: The mission of GRACLS (the Graduate Organization for Comparative Literature Students) is to foster a collegial and supportive Comparative Literature community that embraces the diversity of our scholarship.
fullDescription: Our purpose is to be a resource for new and continuing students, with our mentor program helping orient our new cohorts to life in Austin both on and off campus. GRACLS meetings are open to the community and an opportunity to create and maintain connections. The annual GRACLS conference fosters interdisciplinarity by engaging with our colleagues in COLA and at other universities. The GRACLS service program, Reading World Literature, allows students to give back to the community through teaching. By this fall, we hope to integrate the program into Comparative Literature curriculum and to make it an official COLA program. GRACLS is constantly working to improve our organization’s efforts, be they related to roundtables on the Qualifying exams, our conference, or social events. Since Comparative Literature is so diverse, the work of the GRACLS organization is imperative to keeping the community together.

title: Graduate Representative Association of Computer Science
descriptionSnippet: Represents graduate students in computer science and fosters a sense of community within the Computer Sciences department
fullDescription: The purposes of GRACS are:

title: Graduate Student Affiliates of the Rapoport Center for Human Rights and Justice
descriptionSnippet: The Graduate Student Affiliates of the Bernard and Audre Rapoport Center for Human Rights and Justice share a common interest in promoting human-rights scholarship through interdisciplinary dialogue.
fullDescription: The Graduate Student Affiliates of the Bernard and Audre Rapoport Center for Human Rights and Justice represent many disciplines across campus and all disciplinary perspectives are welcome. Our primary goals are to foster interdisciplinary analysis of key human rights issues and to develop key skills that will allow graduate students to succeed in academic, professional, or advocacy settings.

title: Graduate Student Assembly
descriptionSnippet: The Graduate Student Assembly (GSA) is the principal legislative student organization representing graduate students to the University's administration. The GSA meets bi-weekly to discuss items of interest and concern to graduate students.
fullDescription: The Graduate Student Assembly provides a range of programming and events for the graduate student community including professional development, academic and departmental preparation workshops, social events. Our activities are meant to create a stronger graduate student community while also working to prepare them for their professional endeavors. Below you will find our platform for the upcoming year that focuses on five main areas: cost, climate, collaboration, communication, and civic engagement.

title: Graduate Student Executive Committee
descriptionSnippet: To represent the interests of the graduate students in the department of geological sciences.
fullDescription: To foster a community and represent the interests of the graduate students in the department of geological sciences.

title: Graduate Women in Business
descriptionSnippet: Graduate Women in Business strives to provide an atmosphere conducive to the professional and personal development of its members. GWiB also offers career development resources and opportunities for members to network with companies and industry leaders.
fullDescription: Graduate Women in Business (GWiB) strives to provide an atmosphere conducive to the professional and personal development of its members. GWiB also offers career development resources and opportunities for members to network with companies and industry leaders.

title: Graduate Women in Computing
descriptionSnippet: Our organization exists to encourage and support women involved in computing research at The University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription:
Our organization exists to encourage and support women involved in computing research at The University of Texas at Austin. We
welcome membership by both women and men in any computing related field. All women enrolled in graduate programs at UT in
Computer Science, Computer Engineering, and Software Engineering are automatically members. Anyone else is welcome to join.

title: Grammy University Network - Texas Chapter
descriptionSnippet: GRAMMY U is a unique and fast-growing community of college students, primarily between the ages of 17 and 25, who are pursuing a career in the recording industry.
fullDescription: GRAMMY U is a unique and fast-growing community of college students, primarily between the ages of 17 and 25, who are pursuing a career in the recording industry. GRAMMY U events and special programs touch on all aspects of the music industry, from the technology to the tracks themselves. Events are scheduled throughout the semester to give GRAMMY U members a wide variety of experiences and professional development. Because we are part of The Recording Academy, members have extraordinary access to the industry and its artists.

title: GSC Student Leadership Committee
descriptionSnippet: The Student Leadership Committee's mission is to spread the word about the GSC on campus, to be a student voice of the GSC, spread awareness of the GSC as a women's center, and promote intersectionality and awareness in the space.
fullDescription: The Student Leadership Committee's mission is to spread the word about the GSC on campus, to be a student voice of the GSC, spread awareness of the GSC as a women's center, and promote intersectionality and awareness in the space.

title: Habitat for Humanity Campus Chapter
descriptionSnippet: To provide housing for low income families. Help fund these projects and accomodate subcommittees in family selection and building construction....
fullDescription: Interested in joining? Send a message to uthabitatforhumanity@gmail.com and we can put you on the list to receive our email newsletter!

title: HangOut!
descriptionSnippet: Inclusive social group aimed towards LGBTQA+ people and allies.
fullDescription:
HangOut is a student organization at UT Austin that strives to provide a weekly space for LGBTQA+ students to meet and network!

Come make new friends, and hang out with us!
