The aim of HangOut is to provide a welcoming social environment for all incoming and current LGBTQA+ students and their allies. Weekly gatherings and occasional extra events on-campus and around Austin foster community, friendship, and acceptance.

title: Har-D-Har Improv
descriptionSnippet: UT's newest improv team! Players compete for laughs in a free show made up entirely of audience suggestions! Each show is new and each joke has never been performed before. Warning: Shows may contain adult material
fullDescription: Har-D-Har Improv is UT Austin's newest improv troupe! Improvisers go out there and compete for YOUR laughs based on YOUR suggestions, making a fool of themselves in the process! Har-D-Har is short-form improv, meaning our shows comprise of several smaller comes and scenes, each one with it's own unique gimmick or twist. Shows are 100% free and open to anyone who wants to watch, although there may be adult subject matter present. We hold tryouts EVERY SEMESTER!!!

title: Harmony Longhorn Association
descriptionSnippet: Focused on connecting students from Harmony ISD who are currently attending the University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: Our primary goal is to help freshman feel at home in the University. There are certainly other organizations like ours out there. The key difference is that we link Harmony alumni. These students graduated in class sizes that rarely exceed 80 students. As such, they are used to a much smaller community. This org hopes to smooth out the transition.

title: Haven Student Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: Haven Student Fellowship is a Christian org dedicated to bringing people to Christ. We want to create an atmosphere where students can be transparent about their daily struggles as young Christans. Haven meets on Sundays at 6pm and on Wednesdays at 8pm

title: Healing with Harmonies
descriptionSnippet: Healing with Harmonies is an organization of socially dedicated students who are inspired to touch the world through music therapy. We perform at nursing homes and children's medical centers to improve the happiness and health of patients.
fullDescription: Healing with Harmonies is an organization of socially dedicated students who are inspired to touch the world through music therapy. We perform at venues such as nursing homes, respite care centers, and children's hospitals to improve the happiness and health of our audience.

title: Health Careers Mentorship Program
descriptionSnippet: HCMP is a 100% student-led organization dedicated to teaching mature, motivated pre-medical students about both the clinical and non-clinical aspects of health care.
fullDescription: HCMP is a 100% student-led organization dedicated to teaching mature, motivated pre-medical students about both the clinical and non-clinical aspects of health care. In addition to gaining valuable leadership experiences, selected individuals will develop relationships with health professionals within the Austin community. We provide an environment that fosters intellectual and personal growth, peer support and friendship, and ethical values.

title: Health Innovation Fellows
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Health Innovation Fellows is to promote the McCombs School of Business as a place that produces leaders with the capability to impact the health care industry through innovation and leadership.
fullDescription: The purpose of the Health Innovation Fellows is to promote the business school as a place that produces leaders with the capability to impact the health care industry through innovation and leadership. When people think of innovation and healthcare, we want them to think innovation + healthcare = McCombs.

title: Health Occupations Students of America
descriptionSnippet: TX HOSA is a pre-health organization that offers shadowing, volunteer events, socials, guest speakers from a variety of healthcare professionals, and state and international competitions.
fullDescription: Our mission is to provide a forum for the discussion of health issues, aid students in preparing for professional health school, provide a social environment in which pre-health students can meet other pre-health students, and give our members the opportunity to give back to the community in the form of volunteer activities. TX HOSA offers shadowing, volunteer events, socials, guest speakers from a variety of healthcare professionals, and state and international competitions.

title: Health Science Honors Council
descriptionSnippet: To represent the interests of and create opportunities for all members of the Health Science Scholars Program at the University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: The University of Texas at Austin Health Science Scholars Program (HSS) recognizes an elite group of applicants who have applied to the College of Natural Sciences who have future goals and aspirations somewhere in the health care field.

title: Heartfulness Meditation Group
descriptionSnippet: "To promote and to provide training in the heartfulness system of Meditation, a spiritual path based on heart-centered meditation. Heartfulness is a modified form of the ancient Raja Yoga, better suited for modern lifestyle"
fullDescription: "To promote and to provide training in the heartfulness system of Meditation, a spiritual path based on heart-centered meditation. Heartfulness is a modified form of the ancient Raja Yoga, better suited for modern lifestyle."

title: Hearts for the Homeless Austin
descriptionSnippet: Hearts for the Homeless Austin offers to contribute to the health and well-being of one of the most vulnerable populations in our nation through free blood pressure screenings, education, and outreach opportunities.
fullDescription: Hearts for the Homeless (H4H) Austin serves to provide The University of Texas at Austin students with a unique volunteering experience. Its mission aims to enlighten and impassion students that volunteer their help and skills for a greater cause. Furthermore, it works to help the homeless community in Austin, TX by providing free blood pressure screenings and creating caring interactions between volunteers, homeless individuals, and all of those in the community. Hearts for the Homeless Austin plans to work with other non-profit organizations, veterans’ organizations, health care clinics, and medical professionals to enhance the effectiveness of this registered student organization. This organization aspires to help shape and mold the minds of our members into knowledgeable, compassionate leaders.

title: Helping Hornz
descriptionSnippet: We exist to provide Longhorns an opportunity to give back to the community around them. Partnered with Ridgetop Elementary, our org focuses on putting on a musical for the elementary students to provide funding for their fine arts program.
fullDescription: We exist to provide Longhorns an opportunity to give back to the community around them. We are a service-based organization dedicated to making the world a better place, with members who are role models and passionate servant leaders. We are a family on a mission "to create positive change" in our local community and beyond. Our motto is "changing community, one at a time."

title: HERE
descriptionSnippet: Healing. Expressing. Resisting. Existing. We focus on amplifying the intersectional voices of the most censored and silenced identities on campus. We center the experiences of transgender and non-binary students while welcoming any marginalized identity.

title: Hill House Students
descriptionSnippet: We seek to recover a tradition of Christian living and scholarship that takes both the Bible and contemporary culture seriously.
fullDescription: Our purpose is to equip Christians to serve Christ, to defend and apply their faith, and to proclaim the gospel on campus and in our culture.

title: Hindu Students Association
descriptionSnippet: The Hindu Students Association aims to cultivate and foster cross-cultural dialogue and interaction on issues that pertain to Hindus domestically and globally, empower young Hindu adults through education, improve the level of representation at colleg...

title: Hindu YUVA
descriptionSnippet: Hindu YUVA is a non-sectarian forum to preserve, practice, and create awareness about Hindu cultural and spiritual heritage.
fullDescription: Hindu YUVA is a non-sectarian forum to preserve, practice, and create awareness about Hindu cultural and spiritual heritage.

title: Hispanic Association of Computer Scientists
descriptionSnippet: Hispanic Association of Computer Scientists (HACS) seeks to empower Hispanic students by providing opportunities to engage in leadership, networking and mentoring with peers, faculty and professionals in the area of computer science.
fullDescription: Hispanic Association of Computer Scientists (HACS) seeks to empower Hispanic students by providing opportunities to engage in leadership, networking and mentoring with peers, faculty and professionals in the area of computer science.

title: Hispanic Association of Pharmacists
descriptionSnippet: Our organization strives to promote unity among pharmacy students with a common interest. Though we hold the Hispanic culture at our core, we invite all who are interested to join us as we serve our community and promote the practice of pharmacy.
fullDescription:
The purpose of the student chapters of HAP is to encourage and promote unity among pharmacy students with common interests, values, and backgrounds. HAP provides a student support network on a social level aimed at achieving academic excellence while balancing a friendly, relaxed, and entertaining atmosphere outside of the classroom. HAP will focus on service projects throughout the year to educate, assist, and support Hispanic culture through health care and community development.

The organization at large strives to promote education services for the Hispanic community. It also provides a network of Hispanic pharmacy professional mentors for students. The organization will develop research methods and maintain documentation to better understand Hispanic use of medicines.

title: Hispanic Business Student Association
descriptionSnippet: HBSA is dedicated to promoting professionalism, integrity, academic excellence, and charity. Our mission is to provide a medium to enhance ourselves academically and culturally & serve as an information center for scholastic and occupational opportunity
fullDescription: Established in 1976, The Hispanic Business Student Association is committed to bringing out the best in its members and preparing them for success in the corporate world. Long regarded as one of the top organizations at The University of Texas at Austin, HBSA continues to provide its 180+ members with unparalleled professional and leadership opportunities. Through the numerous programs HBSA hosts throughout the year, including our signature events, Company Night and Scoring Careers, HBSA has helped increased the number of Hispanic professionals entering the work force. Our consistent hard work has led to many accolades. The most recent accolades include Swing Out's Best Recreational Organization award and The Most Outstanding Organization in McCombs School of Business. Our four pillars include Academics, Community Service, Professionalism, and Family.

title: HISPANIC FACULTY STAFF ASSOCIATION (HFSA)
descriptionSnippet: Create a welcoming environment for all members, improve the universities work environment, involve members is leadership roles at UT, & promote a better understanding and appreciation of Latino cultures

title: Hispanic Student Association
descriptionSnippet: To preserve, promote, and produce awareness and understanding of Hispanic culture and customs for all University students through community service, our most effective and direct way to improve society for all..
fullDescription: To preserve, promote, and produce awareness and understanding of Hispanic culture and customs for all University students through community service, our most effective and direct way to improve society for all.

title: Honors Business Association
descriptionSnippet: To promote interaction between honor students as a group, provide a forum for discussion about the Honors Program and the college in general and represent the honor students in all appropriate functions....
fullDescription: To promote interaction between honor students as a group, provide a forum for discussion about the Honors Program and the college in general and represent the honor students in all appropriate functions.

title: Horns Against Tobacco
descriptionSnippet: We are an organization that is dedicated to ending tobacco-product usage on campus through initiatives and outreach efforts in the community.
fullDescription: Horns Against Tobacco is an organization that is dedicated to the anti-tobacco policy that exists on campus. The mission of the organization is to end tobacco usage on campus and find ways to help students who may be suffering from addiction to tobacco products. The organization also serves to create awareness for the issue and keep students informed on the negative impacts of using tobacco products.

title: Horns for Liberty
descriptionSnippet: Horns for Liberty is a libertarian/classical liberal organization which focuses on the philosophy of liberty and liberalism and its applications in various fields.
fullDescription: From science and law to economics and ethics, it is our belief that in all facets of our world, more freedom is always better. We believe in the right of every individual to live their life completely as they choose, free from all regulation, taxation, or law outside of natural law. We support free market capitalism, limited government, decentralization of money, legalization of recreational drugs, gay marriage, freedom of speech, and abolition of the income tax, to give a few examples. Our goal is to spread the ideas of liberalism and liberty among the students and faculty of UT by educating each of our members in the foundations of the classical liberal philosophy. We discuss influential literature, film, philosophy, poetry, economics and politics in the development of liberalism, as well as relevant current events, all with the hope of elucidating to each member the value of personal freedom and the implications it has in other aspects of our world.

title: Horns for Life
descriptionSnippet: We are a consistent life organization working to spread a culture of life on campus through outreach, volunteering, and awareness.
fullDescription: Horns for Life is the non-sectarian student group at the University of Texas dedicated to promoting a consistent life ethic on campus and around the community. We are devoted to affirming the fundamental dignity and equal value of all human lives, at all stages and in all circumstances. We lovingly serve our community by educating ourselves and our peers on many life-threatening issues. We oppose and work to bring an end to abortion, capital punishment, euthanasia, embryonic stem cell research, and unjust war. We provide opportunities for meaningful, respectful discussion of these topics. Through volunteering and our Pregnant on Campus initiative, we support the most vulnerable people in our community.

title: Hum A Cappella
descriptionSnippet: Hum A Cappella is a fusion singing group that arranges and performs a blend of South Asian and Western music. Hum performs on and off campus at various cultural events, competitions, and charity events....
fullDescription: Hum A Cappella is a fusion singing group that arranges and performs a blend of South Asian and Western music. Hum performs on and off campus at various cultural events, competitions, and charity events.

title: Humanities Student Council
descriptionSnippet: Student Council of the Humanities Honors Program.
fullDescription: Organization comprising of Humanities students in a council that takes leadership in sharing students' ideas, interests, and concerns. These activities may include raising funds, organizing activities, and social events.

title: Humanity First - Texas Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Humanity First - TX Chapter is a student branch of Humanity First, an international relief organization focused on human development and disaster relief for all communities and peoples, whether through volunteering, community engagement, or fundraising.
fullDescription: As a student branch of Humanity First USA, our student organization will serve to provide non-discriminatory humanitarian relief and service to mankind, both in the local community as well as abroad. Our projects will focus on improving our community at the University and of Greater Austin, through volunteering, service projects, and fundraising activities. We will also assist our international programs such as Water for Life and Our Kids, Our Future through community education, awareness, and fundraising. In all, the purpose of the organization is to provide the maximum amount of service to all those in need.

title: Hunger and Homelessness Outreach
descriptionSnippet: Hunger and Homelessness Outreach focuses on volunteerism and service learning at The University of Texas at Austin, to assist the homeless population in Austin, and to encourage an open-minded and welcoming attitude towards people from all backgrounds.
fullDescription: As of January 31, 2016, the last documented homeless point-in time count, it was estimated that there were over 2,197 homeless individuals in the Austin/Travis County area on any given night. Additionally, Austin Independent School District estimated that somewhere between 3,000 to 5,000 of their students are homeless. In disbelief of the plight of homeless individuals in Austin, Hunger and Homelessness Outreach is a student led organization at UT Austin which centralizes on serving the homeless and less fortunate community in Austin. We aim to not only help those afflicted individuals through volunteer opportunities but to also help them by shedding light on their struggles. It is increasingly important to bring awareness about the longstanding issue which affects our community today.

title: Hyperloop Engineering at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: We are currently working to design and build a prototype of a pod to compete in SpaceX's Hyperloop Pod competition in August 2019.
fullDescription: Hyperloop Engineering at the University of Texas is the official name of the Texas Guadaloop and 512 Hyperloop teams from the University of Texas at Austin. In September of 2017, the two formerly rival teams from UT decided to merge together under the name Texas Guadaloop, retaining the best talent and resources from both teams.

title: IEEE Communications Society
descriptionSnippet: To spread knowledge and enthusiasm in computer communications, and foster technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of mankind....
fullDescription: To spread knowledge and enthusiasm in computer communications, and foster technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of mankind.

title: IEEE Computer Society
descriptionSnippet: Dissemination of information via IEEE academic journals, workshops with topics relating to ECE courses, exposure to industry through a guest speaker program, to promote and assist with real world computer engineering projects among engineering students.
fullDescription: Visit our website!

title: IEEE Power and Energy Society
descriptionSnippet: IEEE-PES provides networking opportunities and technical project involvement for students interested in power and energy. http://sites.utexas.edu/ieeepes/
fullDescription: For anyone interested in the power and energy industry, we provide opportunities for members to explore career pathways, apply engineering concepts in projects, network with industry professionals, and connect with fellow students who have similar interests.

title: IEEE Robotics and Automation Society
descriptionSnippet: Check out our website at ras.ece.utexas.edu and text @ut-ras to 81010 to receive text message updates from RAS!
fullDescription: inspires robotics research and aspires to make robotics more accessible to persons of all backgrounds. Since 1997, from our primary residence in UT's Electrical and Computer Engineering department, we have connected undergraduate students from mechanical, electrical, aerospace, computer, and other engineering (and non-engineering) fields. We help students gain practical multi-disciplinary experience in the lab, then demonstrate our abilities at various robotics competitions while promoting robotics via community outreach.

title: IEEE TEMS Graduate Student Chapter - Central Texas Section
descriptionSnippet: The IEEE TEMS Graduate Student Chapter is run and managed by IEEE/ECE graduate students and its main goals are to organize technical, social and networking events focusing on the soft-skills and professional development of our student community.

title: If/When/How Texas Law
descriptionSnippet: If/When/How is a national network of law students and lawyers who are committed to reproductive justice. We believe all people should have the ability to decide if, when, and how to create and sustain a family.
fullDescription: If/When/How is a national network of law students and lawyers who are committed to reproductive justice. We believe all people should have the ability to decide if, when, and how to create and sustain a family. Our chapter engages in activism, advocacy, and volunteer projects around reproductive health, rights, and justice.

title: IfNotNow at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: IfNotNow is a movement of young Jews working to end the American Jewish community’s support for the occupation and transform it into a call for freedom and dignity for all Israelis and Palestinians. IfNotNow Austin was founded in January 2017.
fullDescription: IfNotNow at UT Austin is a part of a national movement of young Jews transforming the American Jewish community’s support for the occupation into a call for freedom and dignity for all Israelis and Palestinians.

title: IFORTY Administrative Professional Network
descriptionSnippet: A network that supports and promotes innovative administrative professionals on the University of Texas at Austin campus who demonstrate the power of the individual in providing daily support to the mission of the University and the Forty Acres.

title: Ignite
descriptionSnippet: IGNITE Chapter at UT Austin is a peer network dedicated to advancing professional development of women interested in politics through discussion, mentorship, and unique event opportunities.
fullDescription: IGNITE Chapter at UT Austin is a peer network dedicated to advancing professional development of women interested in politics through discussion, mentorship, and unique event opportunities.

title: Ignite Texas
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of Ignite Texas is to provide a weekend of spiritual growth to incoming freshmen through the unity of the body of Christ established on campus at UT. The retreat provides outreach and resources to establish their faith in college.
fullDescription: Ignite Texas is a four-day retreat for incoming freshmen and transfer students who are looking to find Christian community at the University of Texas. With a band and speaker, small group time, and fun camp traditions, the retreat not only provides students with friends and community before arriving to campus, but also gives them the tools they need to seek spiritual growth during their time at UT.

title: Il Circolo Italiano
descriptionSnippet: To promote and encourage the intercultural exchange of ideas through the medium of Italian language.
fullDescription: To promote and encourage the intercultural exchange of ideas through the Italian language.

title: In Between the Lines
descriptionSnippet: Read fun books!
fullDescription: The aim of this book club (or literary society if you prefer) is to provide a structured setting in which literature can be read, discussed, and enjoyed. This includes designated discussions and recreational meetings related to current topics and events.

title: Indian Cultural Association
descriptionSnippet: With various events and meetings, our ultimate mission is to foster a strong appreciation for diversity and the preservation of the Indian culture on the campus and in the community as a whole.
fullDescription: UT Indian Cultural Association seeks to increase awareness about the South Asian heritage at The University of Texas at Austin. Founded on the three tenets of culture, community, and camaraderie, the Indian Cultural Association serves UT Austin as a cultural liaison to spread influence of the Indian ethnic identity. With various social, service, cultural, and professional events, our ultimate mission is to foster a strong appreciation for diversity and the preservation of the Indian culture on the campus and in the community as a whole.

title: Indian Graduate Business Association
descriptionSnippet: IGBA was formed to nurture a community of people interested in India and is committed to raising India's profile at the McCombs School of Business.
fullDescription: The IGBA was formed to nurture a community of people interested in India and is committed to raising India's profile at the McCombs School of Business. It seeks to be a source of knowledge on India and a forum for lively interaction between students, alumni and business professionals. The IGBA strongly believes that India has a leading role to play in the world economy and works towards advancing that goal through events such as the India Business Forum, panel workshops and speaker series. IGBA also helps incoming Indian MBA students transition into life in Austin, (for example, arranging to pick them up from the Austin airport when they arrive in the Fall Semester). In addition, it facilitates recruiting opportunities for its members through its links with the Ford Career Center and The Indus Entrepreneurs (TiE) - Austin Chapter.

title: Indian Students Association
descriptionSnippet: Established in 1954, the Indian Students Association (ISA) is currently one of the largest student organizations on campus with over 150 paid members. We are an umbrella organization that aims to connect all South Asian organizations on campus and cont...
fullDescription: Established in 1954, the Indian Students Association (ISA) is currently one of the largest student organizations on campus with over 150 paid members. We are an umbrella organization that aims to connect all South Asian organizations on campus and continue to spread awareness of our philanthropic ventures. Over the past year we have donated more than $10,000 to charities all over the globe. In the Fall, we hold events such as Jeena which is a national south asian A Capella competition. In the Spring, we hold our annual talent competition, TAAL, which showcases UT Talent to a crowd of over 2,000 people.

title: Indigenous Danza Ollinyollotl
descriptionSnippet: Indigenous Danza Ollinyollotl is a student led Aztec Dance circle. Ollinyollotl translates to "Movement of the Heart" in the Nahuatl language. Together, we practice Danza Azteca and teach each other songs that are in indigenous languages of this land.
fullDescription: Danza Ollinyollotl is a student led Indigenous Aztec dance group that is held weekly. We are a culturally responsible group caring for and sharing the Indigenous cultural traditions that our communities hold. Ollinyollotl translates to "Movement of the Heart" in Nahuatl, the language of the Aztecs. With instruments such as drums and rattles, we are able to practice the numerous traditional dances indigenous to Mesoamerica. These dances are a mixture of footwork, somatic practices and martial arts, which have been practiced for centuries in present-day Mexico and Central America and have been passed down through generations and communities. With this group we strive to build an inclusive space, for people of all abilities, to learn and to help strengthen each other holistically.

title: Indigent Defense Group
descriptionSnippet: IDG is a student-led organization that promotes public defender careers at Texas Law and advocates for community- and data-driven improvements to "indigent" defense in Texas and beyond.

title: Indonesian Student Association (PERMIAS)
descriptionSnippet: The aim of PERMIAS Austin is to promote Indonesian culture in Austin and also to build, maintain and reinforce the cultural identity and relationships between Indonesian students across the city of Austin.
fullDescription: The aim of PERMIAS Austin is to promote Indonesian culture in Austin and also to build, maintain and reinforce the cultural identity and relationships between Indonesian students across the city of Austin.

title: Information and Systems Security Society (ISSS)
descriptionSnippet: ***Please use our Facebook group or our website (isss.io) for information and updates about our organization *** Spread computer security knowledge and provide hands on experience with topics regrading network, computer, social security
fullDescription: *** Please use our Facebook group or our website (isss.io) for information and updates about our organization. *** We do not manage our members through HornsLink.

title: INFORMS Student Chapter at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: Encourage interest in Operations Research (OR) and the Management Sciences (MS); provide an informal forum for people interested in the educational programs, opportunities, methods, and techniques of ORIMS; sponsor colloquia whose speakers address ORIMS.

title: Innervisions Gospel Choir
descriptionSnippet: Innervisions Gospel Choir was founded with the purpose of spreading and ministering the Gospel according to Jesus Christ.
fullDescription: Innervisions Gospel Choir was founded with the purpose to spread and minister the Gospel according to Jesus Christ; to reach out to our fellow man, by introducing to some and presenting to others that there is a reality in serving a true and living God.

title: Institute of Electrical & Electronics Engineers
descriptionSnippet: Provide professional services for the students of electrical engineering to include social, educational, and informational presentations....
fullDescription: Provide professional development opportunities and enrich the ECE community at UT.

title: Institute of Transportation Engineers
descriptionSnippet: ITE seeks to inform students about current events in Transportation Engineering and connect with leaders in the field in both consulting and research through speaker events, conferences, and various social activities.
fullDescription: ITE's objective is: Promote the advancement of transportation and traffic engineering by fostering the close association of students with transportation and traffic engineering through the medium of addresses by competent speakers and of Chapter sponsored trips; foster the development of professional spirit; promote common interests among chapter members; encourage the expansion of facilities for transportation and traffic engineering study.

title: Intelligent Transportation Society of America
descriptionSnippet: ITSA is a forum in which industry, government and academia meet to build a consensus on fostering, developing, and deploying intelligent vehicle highway systems.
fullDescription: The Intelligent Transportation Society of America, better known as ITS America, is a forum in which industry, government, and academia meet to build consensus on fostering, developing, and deploying Intelligent Vehicle-Highway Systems. The society's mission is to help evolve a significantly safer, cleaner, more productive, and more competitive U.S. transportation system. To this end, the Society promotes public-private-academic partnerships and co-operations in the ITS community. According to the Intelligent Transportation Society of Texas, better known as ITS Texas, their mission is to "enhance the safety and mobility of the state’s transportation system through knowledge sharing on industry innovation, technologies, and deployments, and by providing education opportunities for the next generation."

title: Intercooperative Council Organization
descriptionSnippet: We're a nonprofit co-op organization owned and operated by our student members, and our houses are run cooperatively by the students who live there.
fullDescription: The Intercooperative Council Organization is intended to support and unite members of the ICC Austin Student Co-ops who are also students at the University of Texas at Austin. ICC Austin is a non-profit organization that owns and operates low-cost housing for college students in Austin, Texas. We have nine large houses, each serving 15-31 members. We've been doing this since 1970, although ICC goes back to 1932.

title: Interfraternity Council
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Interfraternity Council (IFC) is to act as the governing body for all IFC fraternities. In conjunction with this purpose the IFC also operates as the liaison for the fraternities and provides services to its member fraternities.
fullDescription: The purpose of the IFC is to act as the governing body for all Greek Letter Social Fraternities. In conjunction with this purpose the IFC also operates as the liason for the fraternities and provides services to its member fraternities.

title: International Affairs Society
descriptionSnippet: The International Affairs Society (IAS) is a professional and social organization catering to students in with an interest in international relations, global affairs, cultural interaction, and travel.
fullDescription: The International Affairs Society (IAS) is a professional and social organization at the University of Texas at Austin whose mission is to cater to students interested in international relations, global affairs, cultural interaction, and travel. We foster both professional and social relationships between students, academic faculty, and professionals from various fields. Whatever each member’s unique reason is for joining the organization, the International Affairs Society provides opportunities to fit each member's interest. Whether it be through a current events discussion, career development workshop, diplomatic etiquette, distinguished speaker, or community service, IAS creates a society in which students can thrive and become global citizens. Every meeting includes a guest speaker with a different internationally themed topic, ranging from study programs and internships abroad, to presentations by international non-governmental organizations. IAS also hosts a number of signature events throughout the year, including the International Affairs Roundtable and the Global Feast.

title: International Business Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of International Business Student Association is to expand member’s knowledge of global issues that affect the way we do business. We are committed to international and cultural awareness, professional and social development, and leadership.
fullDescription: The purpose of International Business Student Association (IBSA) at The University of Texas at Austin is to expand member’s knowledge of global issues that affect the way we do business. We are an organization committed to learning about foreign business practices, culture, and customs in ways that will provide us with better global understanding of our international economy. For this reason, we advocate international and cultural awareness because we believe that as business professionals, global leaders, and members of society, it is important to understand international issues that affect business practices. We promote interaction with international and exchange students while also advocating professional and social development because we believe it is a gateway to building a network of exceptional connections.

title: International Graduate Student Ministry - at Austin
descriptionSnippet: International Graduate Student Ministry (IGSM) is a campus Christian fellowship open to international graduate students who are interested in investigating, learning about, or growing in the Christian faith.
fullDescription: International Graduate Student Ministry (IGSM) is a campus Christian fellowship open to international graduate students who are interested in investigating, learning about, or growing in the Christian faith.

title: International Justice Mission - Longhorn Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Raise awareness about the reality of modern day slavery; raise funds for the work of IJM, a human rights, faith based organization; raise our voice on behalf of victims of injustice through advocacy, most notably through Stand for Freedom.
fullDescription: We are a campus chapter of International Justice Mission, a large, human rights, faith founded nonprofit based out of Washington, D.C. that works around the world with local governments to bring justice to people who are oppressed. Our goals as International Justice Mission - Longhorn Chapter are to raise awareness on UT's campus and the Austin community about the reality of modern day slavery, raise funds for the work of IJM, and raise our voice on behalf of victims of injustice through advocacy.

title: International Office
descriptionSnippet: The International Office at The University of Texas at Austin is home to Study Abroad, International Student & Scholar Services, ESL Services and more.
fullDescription:
As one of the nation’s leading public universities, The University of Texas at Austin prepares its students to become competent global citizens. The International Office advances the critical priorities of the University by creating access to international and cultural exchange. As the institutional home for Study Abroad, International Student & Scholar Services, English as a Second Language instruction, Global Risk & Safety, and Global Initiatives, the International Office provides opportunities to learn about the world through education.

The University is host to almost 5,000 matriculated international students, 800 English as a Second Language students, and 1,500 international faculty and scholars from more than 120 countries. The diversity that these talented students and scholars bring to the campus, provide critical cross-cultural experiences that enrich lives, instill global competency, and strengthen the university community, state and nation.

title: International Relations and Global Studies Council
descriptionSnippet: UT IRGC aims to assist IRG students in professional development, academic advancement, and social experience. Through peer and faculty engagement, IRGC will enhance a community and consolidate resources within IRG to best serve members of the major.

title: International Undergraduate Student Ministry-Austin
descriptionSnippet: IUSM is a UT student organization focusing on undergraduates of any and all backgrounds who are interested in learning about God, Jesus, the Bible and Christianity.
fullDescription: Built on the motto, “For Everyone From Everywhere”, IUSM at Austin is a fellowship of undergraduate international students from all over the world.  Our vision is to create a place where people from many cultures and diverse backgrounds can come together to experience God and journey alongside each other.  By the way, you don’t have to be a Christian to join us – you just need to be one of everyone from somewhere in everywhere to join us! And if you are already a Christian, we’d love to get to know you and help you grow as a disciple of Jesus Christ.

title: InterVarsity Christian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: We are a multi-ethnic ministry focused on three things. To see students and faculty transformed, campuses renewed, and World-changers developed. We strive to be a community of understanding, as we take steps together in navigating our current world.
fullDescription: Intervarsity Christian Fellowship (Multiethnic Chapter) is intended to respond to God's love, grace and truth: The Purpose of the Chapter is to establish and advance, at the University of Texas, witnessing communities of students who follow Jesus as Savior, people of every ethnicity and culture. Join us every Tuesday at 6:30pm for Large group and contact us for more info connecting with a small group.

title: Investment Banking Scholars Club at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: The Investment Banking Scholars Club at UT Austin will sharpen the networking, interviewing, and investing skills of students interested in finance to help secure their placement in investment banking firms.
fullDescription: The purpose of the IBSC shall be to hone and develop the networking, interview, and work skills of interviewed and handpicked individuals in the McCombs Business School who meet the minimum requirements for membership. The organization will allow for a high level of networking and specialization. With the increasing amount of Investment Banking business growth in Texas, these scholars will learn how to exploit this geographical advantage. The main objective of the organization is to secure the placement of members in investment banking firms as a job or internship.

title: Iranian Students Academic and Cultural Organization
descriptionSnippet: The Iranian Students Academic and Cultural Organization is non-profit, independent from any specific political and religious beliefs with emphasis on academic and cultural orientation of students of The University of Texas at Austin....
fullDescription: The Iranian Students Academic and Cultural Organization is non-profit, independent from any specific political and religious beliefs with emphasis on academic and cultural orientation of students of The University of Texas at Austin. The organization celebrates the Iranian (Persian) culture.

title: Ismaili Muslim Students Association
descriptionSnippet: The Ismaili Muslim Students Association serves to build bridges in the community by integrating the cosmopolitan ethics of the Ismaili faith in each of our community service, health and fitness, social, and outreach events.
fullDescription: Founded in 2010, the Ismaili Muslim Students Association is dedicated to championing pluralism and uplifting quality of life for all students at The University of Texas at Austin, regardless of personal belief or affiliation, by integrating the cosmopolitan ethics of the Ismaili faith in each of our community service, health and fitness, social, and outreach events.

title: ISPOR
descriptionSnippet: We provide a platform to participate and develop skills in Health Economics, Health Services and Outcomes Research.
fullDescription: ISPOR is the student chapter of the International Society for Pharmacoeconomics and Outcomes Research (ISPOR). ISPOR was established in July 1998 with the mission to "facilitate and support the professional, educational and research needs of persons in pursuit of careers in pharmacoeconomics and health outcomes research." The organization is composed of students who share a passion for the study of pharmacoeconomics and outcomes research.

title: It's On Us at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: It's On Us at UT Austin works to educate students and prevent sexual assault on the 40 acres by hosting events, speakers, and campaigns. We strive to assist UT students in understanding that stopping sexual assault is on us.
fullDescription: It's On Us was created by the Obama Administration to combat the rising statistics of sexual assault on college campuses. As an official student lead chapter, It's On Us at UT Austin hopes to reach out to all students on campus to hear their stories, to educate them, and to work with them. We will reach these goals by hosting events such as the Fall and Spring Weeks of Action, hosting advocates against sexual assault to speak on campus, and changing the culture that allows sexual assault to transpire.

title: J. Reuben Clark Law Society
descriptionSnippet: We affirm the strength brought to the law by a lawyer's personal religious conviction. We strive through public service and professional excellence to promote fairness and virtue founded upon the rule of law.
fullDescription: We affirm the strength brought to the law by a lawyer's personal religious conviction. We strive through public service and professional excellence to promote fairness and virtue founded upon the rule of law.

title: Jackson School of Geosciences
descriptionSnippet: The JSG includes the University’s Department of Geological Sciences - one of the country's oldest geoscience departments - and two world-renowned research units -- the Institute for Geophysics and the Bureau of Economic Geology.

title: Japanese Association

fullDescription: To create such opportunities for all on campus who are interested in Japanese culture to come together through various social activities in order to teach, spread, and increase awareness of Japanese Culture.

title: Jewish Pre-health Student Association
descriptionSnippet: JPSA supports Jewish life, scholarship, leadership, global health, and service for pre-health students at UT Austin. It also promotes the study of Jewish values and its contributions to the field of healthcare, science, and medicine.
fullDescription: JPSA supports Jewish life, scholarship, leadership, global health, and service for pre-health students at UT Austin. It also promotes the study of Jewish values and its contributions to the field of healthcare, science, and medicine.

title: Jolt at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: Jolt at UT Austin is a multi-issue organization that builds the political power and influence of Latinos in our democracy. Our purpose is to build student leadership, connect students to the Austin community and build Latino civic participation.

title: Joshua Church at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: Joshua Church at UT Austin is a Christian organization of UT students seeking God. Additionally, Joshua Church at UT Austin is established to teach university students how to live in pursuit of Jesus and apply the Bible to their daily lives.
fullDescription: Joshua Church at UT Austin is a Christian organization of UT students seeking God. This organization will consist of regularly enrolled UT undergraduates and graduate students. Our organization shall meet weekly off campus on Wednesday and or Thursday nights from 7-9pm. Meetings will be held year-round, through the summer. Meetings will be advertised at previous meetings and on Hornslink. Club parties will be held once a month at the same time, and additional advertising may be done for these events.

title: Journal of Law and Technology at Texas
descriptionSnippet: An organization dedicated to scholarly research and publication on technology law and policy.
fullDescription: The Journal of Law and Technology at Texas (JOLTT) is committed to exploring the vast impact technology has on the policies and practice of law. Our goal is to gather articles, host events, and bring speakers which serve to illuminate the changing legal landscape.

title: Journalism Graduate Student Council
descriptionSnippet: The Journalism Graduate Student Council serves as a liaison for students, faculty, and staff within the department. We represent student voices and offer a space to share concerns as well as to foster connection and professional development.

title: K-pop Beat
descriptionSnippet: K-pop Beat is an open workshop and cover based dance group open to all levels hoping to help others improve on their individual dance skills and build community for a diverse group of kpop fans.

title: Kairos Christian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: Kairos is a Christian student group at UT. Kairos is the Greek word for the “opportune time” - to us, that means an opportune time to make friends & memories, and to consider what life is all about through a Biblical perspective.

title: Kappa Alpha Order
descriptionSnippet: The oldest fraternity at UT Austin.

title: Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: To inspire service in the public interest, to assist in the aims and purposes of colleges and universities, to promote the spiritual, moral and intellectual welfare of members....
fullDescription: To inspire service in the public interest, to assist in the aims and purposes of colleges and universities, to promote the spiritual, moral and intellectual welfare of members.

title: Kappa Alpha Theta
descriptionSnippet: In 1904, Alpha Theta Chapter at the University of Texas became the second Theta chapter in the South. We stand for sisterhood, philanthropy, character, and academic excellence.
fullDescription:
Founded in 1870 at Indiana Asbury (now DePauw University) in Greencastle, Indiana, Kappa Alpha Theta is the first Greek-letter Fraternity known among women. In 1904, Alpha Theta Chapter at the University of Texas became the second Theta chapter in the South. We stand for sisterhood, philanthropy, character and academic excellence.

Since 1989, Kappa Alpha Theta has supported the advocacy work of CASA for Children, our international philanthropy. We share CASA’s belief that all children have the fundamental right to be safe, and to be treated with dignity and respect. Court Appointed Special Advocates—CASA volunteers—work with children who have been removed from the home due to abuse or neglect. A CASA volunteer provides a voice for the child in the courtroom and the community.

title: Kappa Beta Gamma--Alpha Psi
descriptionSnippet: International Sorority
fullDescription: Kappa Beta Gamma is an international sorority built on the foundation of character, culture, and courage. In the Alpha Psi colony, we seek out a fun, positive, easygoing, and lively group of girls who uphold the spirits of friendship and honesty. We uphold the high achievement status of the university academically and socially, and from the community through volunteer work. We encourage girls to strive in achieving their goals individually and along-side their sisters.

title: Kappa Delta
descriptionSnippet: Here at Sigma Epsilon, we pride ourselves in sisterhood, philanthropy, leadership, and academics. We are currently recognized by Kappa Delta Nationals as a Merit Chapter, which means that we are in the top 10% of all 162 Kappa Delta chapters nationally.
fullDescription: Hi!
