descriptionSnippet: The Purpose of Kappa Delta Chi is to promote the values of Unity, Honesty, Integrity and Leadership among women at colleges and universities....
fullDescription: Kappa Delta Chi Sorority, Inc. is a national sorority that fosters professional development, academics and lifelong learning, and higher education degree attainment; an organization dedicated to community service for institutions of higher education and the community with an emphasis on the Hispanic/Latino population.

title: Kappa Epsilon - Pharmacy
descriptionSnippet: Students in College of Pharmacy. KE strives to promote professional as well as individual achievement; establish lines of cooperation and communication between faculty and students; promotes professional consciousness and a bond of lasting fellowship.
fullDescription: Students in College of Pharmacy. Strives to promote professional as well as individual achievement; establish lines of cooperation and communication between faculty and students; promotes professional consciousness and a bond of lasting fellowship between its members.

title: Kappa Kappa Gamma
descriptionSnippet: Kappa Kappa Gamma is an all women's sorority organization located at 2001 University Avenue and founded in 1902. Our goals are to promote leadership, scholarship and friendship to women who attend the University of Texas.
fullDescription: To promote leadership, scholarship and friendship to women who attend the University.

title: Kappa Kappa Psi
descriptionSnippet: To serve and promote the Texas Longhorn Band, to honor outstanding bandmembers, to stimulate campus leadership, to foster a close relationship between college bands, and to provide fellowship for all engaged in college band work....
fullDescription: To serve and promote the Texas Longhorn Band, to honor outstanding band members, to stimulate campus leadership, to foster a close relationship between college bands, and to provide fellowship for all engaged in college band work.

title: Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: In 1998, Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc. became America's first women's Greek-letter organization to promote a South Asian interest.
fullDescription: We, the Sisters of Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc., shall create a Sisterhood directed towards the advancement of women. Kappa Phi Gamma aims to instill integrity of character and trust as components of personality. The Sorority shall encourage bonding of women in order to strengthen Sisterhood. We shall render service to the community and the university, thus supporting the betterment and unification of society. The Sisterhood shall develop leadership skills and high academic standards that follow into the professional world. Kappa Phi Gamma shall promote pride of culture, womanhood, and self.​

title: Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc. provides an opportunity for young women to be involved on campus through service and cultural events while joining a sisterhood that develops strong bonds and leadership skills.
fullDescription: “We, the sisters of the Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Incorporated, strive to strengthen Sisterhood amongst women by providing Service and promoting Cultural Diversity to our members and our community, thus securing the bond of kinship for posterity. Kappa Phi Lambda exists to further educate individuals about Pan-Asian culture, while keeping our own identities. We aim for academic excellence, keeping in mind the importance of education and learning as the key to strength, awareness, and fulfillment.”

title: Kappa Rho Pre-Medical Honors Society
descriptionSnippet: Kappa Rho was founded in 2010 to bring women together who are interested in medicine and to give them the opportunity to explore that interest while meeting and making friends with people who have the same goals. Find out more at: www.utkapparho.org
fullDescription: Kappa Rho was founded in 2010 to bring women who are interested in medicine together and to give them the opportunity to explore that interest while meeting and making friends with people who have the same goals. Our goal is to create a medical society built upon the principles of leadership, academic excellence, service, community involvement, and a profound interest in the sciences. Find out more at: www.utkapparho.org

title: Kappa Sigma Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: To promote fellowship, leadership, scholarship, and service among the members.
fullDescription: To promote fellowship, leadership, scholarship, and service among the members.

title: Kappa Theta Epsilon
descriptionSnippet: Provide for networking among co-op students, promote career opportunities through industry, provide inside information to the general student body about the co-op program and create programs to educate students on professional matters.
fullDescription:
Provide for networking among co-op students, promote career opportunities through industry, provide inside information to the general student body about the co-op program and create programs to keep students academically sharp while on leave. Personal qualities of members of our society are distinguished scholarship, integrity, breadth of interest, and adaptability.

Our Website: https://texaskte.wordpress.com/

title: Keep Austin Wizard
descriptionSnippet: We hold meetings every other week. Our org gives UT students the opportunity to get involved with the international non-profit organization, the Harry Potter Alliance, and work on social justice projects on a local and global scale.
fullDescription: UT Austin's chapter of the Harry Potter Alliance! The HPA is an international, nonprofit organization that fights for literacy, equality, and social justice on a global scale.

title: Kidney Disease Screening and Awareness Program at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: UT Austin KDSAP is a chapter of the national Kidney Disease Screening and Awareness Program that directly serves the community in Austin, Texas by providing free kidney screenings and raising public awareness about the prevalence of renal diseases.
fullDescription: Kidney Disease Screening and Awareness Program (KDSAP) was founded in 2008 and has university chapters across the nation. Our UT Austin KDSAP chapter aims to improve the renal health of low-income minority populations in the Austin community by providing free health screenings to identify individuals who have developed or are at risk for developing chronic kidney disease, advocating for preventative medicine and raising public awareness about the prevalence of kidney disease and other renal diseases through community-based education. We also strive to develop students' career interests in healthcare by offering students the opportunity to interact with nephrologists and other healthcare providers, build leadership skills, and give back to the community. Texas has a higher chronic kidney disease rate than the national average, and we hope to help change this unfortunate reality one step, one screening, and one educational event at a time.

title: Kinesiology Club
descriptionSnippet: To provide a network for our professional development by facilitating interaction between kinesiology related majors, the faculty, and the community.
fullDescription: To provide a network for our professional development by facilitating interaction between kinesiology related majors, the faculty, and the community.

title: Koinonia
descriptionSnippet: Koinonia is a Christian student group on campus group where students can come to study the Bible and find answers to their questions about God, Jesus, and Christianity.
fullDescription: Oh, Koinonia? Koinonia is a Christian Fellowship at the University of Texas at Austin. "Koinonia" is the Greek word for "fellowship," and we definitely try to live up to our name!

title: Korean Dance Crew
descriptionSnippet: Organization that showcases the different mixture of Korean pop culture and American hip hop culture through dance.

title: Korean Engineering Student Association
descriptionSnippet: KESA is a Korean Engineering student organization at The University of Texas at Austin. KESA's mission is to provide various opportunities to Korean Engineering students by sharing career-related information and networking.
fullDescription: Korean Engineering Student Association was founded in 2019 to exchange career-related information between Korean students studying STEM at UT Austin. KESA offers mentoring program for first-year students to get career advice from the seniors that are studying the same engineering majors. The organization also has tutoring sessions to provide help with coursework. On top of that, KESA organizes semester-long technical projects. All members are encouraged to join a group and gain practical experience on developing their own personal projects every semester.

title: Korean Music Association
descriptionSnippet: To discuss and debate the various aspects of Korean pop culture trends and events, with a focus on the music entertainment industry.
fullDescription: To discuss and debate the various aspects of Korean pop culture trends and events, with a focus on the music entertainment industry. We will have biweekly meetings where we show newly released music and engage in pertinent discussion with fellow members. We also host socials to further explore Korean culture through major Korean entertainment events and regional cuisine.

title: Korean Student Association
descriptionSnippet: Promotion of friendship and cooperation between Koreans on campus.
fullDescription: Promotion of friendship and cooperation between Koreans on campus.

title: Korean Students Organization
descriptionSnippet: KSO is a social organization that focuses on forming connections and providing a welcoming community under the Korean culture.
fullDescription: KSO is a social organization that focuses on forming connections and providing a welcoming community under the Korean culture. We achieve this by having weekly socials and family groups to ensure that its members feel welcomed at UT and make great memories during their college years.

title: Krishna West Austin
descriptionSnippet: Krishna West Austin is dedicated to teaching and sharing bhakti-yoga, and facilitating dialogue and debate which explores metaphysical issues that directly impact the social, political and economic aspects of human life.
fullDescription: Krishna West Austin is dedicated to teaching and sharing bhakti-yoga, and facilitating dialogue and debate which explores metaphysical issues that directly impact the social, political and economic aspects of human life.

title: KVRX Student Radio
descriptionSnippet: KVRX, the student radio station at UT, broadcasts at night on 91.7FM and streams online 24/7. Students can learn about music, production, recording, and do a show ranging from specialty genres to talk shows. We also host and sponsor concerts and review...
fullDescription: KVRX, the student radio station at UT, broadcasts at night on 91.7FM and streams online 24/7. Students can learn about music, production, recording, and do a show ranging from specialty genres to talk shows. We also host and sponsor concerts and review shows.

title: Labyrinth Progressive Student Ministry
descriptionSnippet: Labyrinth is a progressive Christian community that is LGBTQ-friendly, racially inclusive, and open to all students, whether atheist, questioning, or devout. Labyrinth members are an open, diverse group and a true community.
fullDescription: "Labyrinth" functions as an ecumenical campus ministry for students of all races, genders, orientations, faiths, denominations and those who are looking to seek a greater understanding about ancient Christianity and how it applies to our modern age. Whether you’re a long-time believer, or hopeful skeptic at best, spirituality in college is a journey with twists, turns, and dead ends. You have questions and beliefs, doubts and dreams, and school work to go along with it. Here at Labyrinth, we welcome and encourage you on your journey by providing a safe place to ask questions about God, explore and grow in your spirituality, and connect with other students. College can feel like a maze — we can help you find your way.

title: Lambda Chi Alpha Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: To offer the best fraternal experience, focusing on personal character development through leadership, scholarship, community service, and positive social experiences....
fullDescription: To offer the best fraternal experience, focusing on personal character development through leadership, scholarship, community service, and positive social experiences.

title: Lambda Omega Alpha Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Lambda Omega Alpha is a fellowship of Catholic men brought together by faith. We engage in social, service, and spiritual activities often during the school year. Please contact us at loa@utcatholic.org for more information.
fullDescription: Lambda Omega Alpha is a Catholic Men's Fraternity founded in 1990 by a group of five young men at a retreat called Longhorn Awakening. They were so moved at this retreat that they wanted to bring that experience back to UT. They created a brotherhood rooted in the pillars of loyalty, spirituality, and chivalry. Based out of the University Catholic Center at the University of Texas at Austin, the Alpha Chapter of Lambda Omega Alpha serves as a means by which college-aged men, united in fellowship by their faith, are able to grow together guided by these pillars.

title: Lambda Phi Epsilon Fraternity, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Lambda Phi Epsilon's vision is to become the preeminent international Asian interest fraternal organization, providing outstanding leadership, philanthropy, and advocacy in the community.
fullDescription: Lambda Phi Epsilon's vision is to become the preeminent international Asian interest fraternal organization, providing outstanding leadership, philanthropy, and advocacy in the community.

title: Lang Stuttering Institute Student Leadership Organization
descriptionSnippet: The Lang Stuttering Institute Student Leadership Organization seeks to unite university students from diverse backgrounds and majors in order to educate, to advocate, and to spread awareness about stuttering.
fullDescription: The Lang Stuttering Institute Student Leadership Organization strives to unite university students from diverse backgrounds, interests, and majors in order to educate, advocate, and spread awareness about stuttering. Stuttering is a very stigmatized disorder and is often misrepresented in society. The Lang Stuttering Institute is a place on campus where individuals of all ages can receive services for stuttering free of cost. Our organization holds events on and off campus to support the individuals in the institute through fundraising and advocacy. Through our fundraising and volunteer efforts we strive to make the world a better place for people who stutter. Everyone deserves a voice!

title: Latin American and Hispanic Master of Business Association
descriptionSnippet: LAHMBA is a graduate student-run organization at the McCombs School of Business whose mission is to develop McCombs' Latin-American and Hispanic-American MBA community and empower its members to achieve their full potential as future leaders in business.
fullDescription: The Latin American & Hispanic MBA Association (LAHMBA) at the McCombs School of Business strives to enhance the experience of Latin American and Hispanic students through the organization of professional, cultural, and social events. LAHMBA creates an inclusive community of prospective students, current students, alumni, partners, faculty, and staff. LAHMBA works to promote awareness of the Hispanic and Latin American culture at McCombs.

title: Latin Americanist Linguists and Anthropologists LALA
descriptionSnippet: LALA meets regularly to discuss the linguistics of indigenous languages of Latin America. LALA also will help organize events dedicated to this topic....
fullDescription: LALA meets regularly to discuss the linguistics of indigenous languages of Latin America. LALA also will help organize events dedicated to this topic.

title: Latin Economics and Business Association
descriptionSnippet: We recruit passionate and driven students who wish to expand their knowledge, develop professional skills and establish life-long relationships among Latin American cultures through talks from leading experts in business, social gatherings & philanthropy
fullDescription: The Latin Economics and Business Association is a prominent student organization in the McCombs School of Business. Our mission is to recruit passionate students who are driven and committed to expand their knowledge, foster relationships across Latin American cultures, and develop their professional skills. We do this by offering a range of opportunities of growth through community service, social gatherings, athletic activities, expert led talks, and recruiting events. Our vision is to help shape well-rounded individuals and leaders of tomorrow.

title: Latinx Community Affairs
descriptionSnippet: The Latinx Community Affairs (LCA) serves to unite and empower Latinx students and student organizations through communication, leadership, action and education for the advancement of our community.
fullDescription: Purpose:

title: Latinx Health Professions Organization
descriptionSnippet: 1) Provides Hispanic pre-med, allied health, and pre-dent students with academic information, peer support, and cultural camaraderie. 2) Disseminates information concerning various health professions and programs and their application procedures. 3) Sa...
fullDescription: 1) Provides Hispanic pre-med, allied health, and pre-dent students with academic information, peer support, and cultural camaraderie. 2) Disseminates information concerning various health professions and programs and their application procedures. 3) Salient aspect of NCHO is the academic and personal support that lower-division students receive from upper-division and medical students.

title: Latinx Honors Student Association at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: LHSA serves to provide a community for Latinx students in honors programs, including but not limited to: The Plan II Honors Program, Liberal Arts Honors, Business Honors Program, and all other departmental honors programs.
fullDescription: LHSA serves to provide a community for Latinx students in honors programs, including but not limited to: The Plan II Honors Program, Liberal Arts Honors, Business Honors Program, and all other departmental honors programs. We will also offer service opportunities for members to engage in, such as mentor ship programs, ambassador-like activities, and other programs. LHSA wants Latinx students to feel a sense of community and belonging in UT's large campus and honors programs.

title: Latter Day Saints Student Association (LDSSA)
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to promote and encourage Christian values on campus.
fullDescription: The purposes of LDSSA are to help college and university students stay closely affiliated with the Church, succeed in their studies, and achieve a balanced educational-social life while on campus; to motivate LDS students to become a powerful influence for good on the campus; to provide meaningful activities that are consistent with Church standards; and to coordinate Church-related activities for college students.

title: Law Yoga Club
descriptionSnippet: To advocate health and well-being through yoga.
fullDescription:
The Law Yoga Club holds yoga classes per week in the law school. While each teacher has their own style, all classes are beginner-friendly and set to music!

Dues:
Semester dues are donation-based, which provides a low-cost alternative to main campus and off campus yoga classes. While the dues are used to pay our yoga teachers and to buy supplies such as mat cleaner and new equipment, we believe that yoga should be accessible to everyone. If you can't make a donation, let us know and we will work it out!

title: Legislative Student Organizations
descriptionSnippet: Legislative Student Organizations is an area within The Office of the Dean of Students. We assist with administrative, financial and programatic support of the Graduate Student Assembly, Senate of College Councils, and Student Government.
fullDescription: Legislative Student Organizations is an area within The Office of the Dean of Students.  We assist with administrative, financial and programatic support of the Graduate Student Assembly, Senate of College Councils, and Student Government at The University of Texas at Austin.

title: LGBTQ+ Engineers
descriptionSnippet: We provide a safe space for LGBTQ+ engineering students to connect with other LGBTQ+ students, create community, build relationships, and celebrate being LGBTQ+.

title: Liberal Arts Council
descriptionSnippet: Liberal Arts Council serves as the official voice of the students in the College of Liberal Arts.
fullDescription: Council shall devote itself to the mission of the Liberal Arts by: providing a means of communication between faculty and students; assisting in the improvement of academic standards; investigating student issues in the college; improving student awareness of the college across the campus.

title: Liberal Arts Honors Music Ensemble
descriptionSnippet: An organization that promotes the practice and performance of many styles of music; consists of both vocalists and instrumentalists.
fullDescription: An academic organization that promotes the practice and performance of many styles of music; consists of both vocalists and instrumentalists.

title: Liberal Arts Honors Student Council
descriptionSnippet: We plan social events, provide academic help, and offer volunteering opportunities to engage the LAH community.

title: Liberal Arts Pre-Med Society
descriptionSnippet: A place for non-traditional pre-med majors to flourish.
fullDescription: LAPMS is a student-run organization that was founded in 2008 to fulfill the university's need for an organization that welcomed students from all colleges embarking on a non-traditional route to medicine. Whether our passions lie in government, psychology or biochemistry, we all share the common aspiration of helping others via the field of medicine. Through volunteer opportunities, social events, and peer counsel, the Liberal Arts Pre-Medical Society aims to support and encourage all those on the journey to medical school. Join our family!

title: Liberal Arts Refugee Alliance
descriptionSnippet: The Liberal Arts Refugee Alliance is a student organization at the University of Texas at Austin that provides students with volunteer and educational opportunities relating to Austin's refugee population.

title: Liberation Coalition UT Austin Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Our goal is to create an atmosphere of leftist political activism and discourse on campus.
fullDescription: Liberation Coalition is designed to be a space for leftists at UT Austin to organize and engage in political activism and discourse on campus. We want to partake in events based around direct action. Aside from a heavy focus on activism, we also want to hold discussions focusing on leftist theory and discuss how we can help socialism gain more mainstream traction both in electoral and local community circles. If you are interested or curious about leftist politics and would like to be part of an organization that focuses on education and activism, we'd love to have you.

title: Liberty in North Korea - Texas
descriptionSnippet: Liberty in North Korea at The University of Texas aims to spread awareness of the North Korean humanitarian crisis to all UT students and to raise funds to support and rescue North Korean refugees.
fullDescription: LiNK Texas was founded in August of 2004 and has since consistently been one of LiNK's leading rescue team. We are a nonprofit and nonpolitical organization that focuses on the humanitarian crisis that is currently going on within North Korea. LiNK Texas aims to raise funds, spread awareness, and change the narrative on this issue that is often ignored due to the current political climate. All funds raised go directly to helping a North Korean refugee be rescued, relocated, and reeducated.

title: Lion's Heart Project
descriptionSnippet: The Lion's Heart Project aims to spark service in the community by connecting those willing to give with those in need; fostering easy, yet impactful ways to help others; and by encouraging people to take the time to love the human beings around them.
fullDescription: Lion's Heart is a service organization that assembles bags with heartfelt notes to the homeless Austin community. Our objectives include connecting those willing to give with those in need; fostering easy, yet impactful ways to help others; and encouraging people to take the time to love the people around them.

title: Lions Club at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: We are Lions. We are a group of like-minded men and women aimed towards the betterment of our community, for our campus, and for our world.
fullDescription: We are Lions. We are a group of like-minded men and women aimed towards the betterment of our community, for our campus, and for our world. Directly involved with the charter of the United Nations, Lions focus on international as well as local relief and are just about everywhere. Whether it is to eradicate blindness as Helen Keller personally requested, or to provide emergency relief to our neighbors effected by disaster, or even to help mentor children and teens, we are there. As part of the Largest Service Organization in the WORLD with around 13.8 million members in virtually every nation, we strive to meet our motto of "We Serve" with the highest regard.

title: Little Cause-Players
descriptionSnippet: The Little Cause-Players sets out to bring joy to kids with pediatric and mental illnesses, while simultaneously providing a creative outlet to volunteers. Our goal is to spread happiness by bringing children’s dreams to life.
fullDescription: Cause Play sets out to bring joy to kids with pediatric and mental illnesses, while simultaneously providing a creative outlet to volunteers by dressing up as iconic characters and visiting pediatric hospitals.. Our goal is to spread happiness by bringing children’s dreams to life.

title: Lofi Dojo
descriptionSnippet: Lofi Dojo's a combat and dexterity athletics training student group at UT Austin. We cross train various martial arts disciplines, with muay thai, calisthenics, and non combat sports (primarily soccer).
fullDescription: Lofi Dojo's a combat and dexterity athletics training group at UT Austin. We cross train various martial arts disciplines, with muay thai, calisthenics, and non combat sports (primarily soccer) to promote fight specialty development, multifaceted self defense, body control, and general dexterity. For those experienced in fighting, we offer an environment to share knowledge, test yourself, and help train beginners, and for those new to it all, it's an easygoing and collaborative place to learn in.

title: Lone Star Student Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of Lone Star Student Fellowship is to provide a place for students to fellowship, study the Bible, and be a part of various social events.
fullDescription: Lonestar Student Fellowship is a non-denominational organization here at University of Texas. We get together in groups of all sizes for everything from cooking out to studying the Bible and worshiping God. At Lonestar Student Fellowship we are committed to worshiping God as a lifestyle and sharing the good news about Jesus Christ. We believe the key to living victoriously for Jesus, especially in college, is found in fellowship and a solid group of Christian friends. At LSSF you will find a great place to grow in your faith, discover God's purpose for your life, and use your gifts to serve others.

title: Longhorn 3D Printing
descriptionSnippet: A place to learn more about 3D printing and how it works.

title: Longhorn American Association of Petroleum Geologists Student Chapter
descriptionSnippet: An association dedicated to the advancement of the science of geology, especially as it relates to petroleum, natural gas. We foster scientific spirit and professional advancement and training for our members.
fullDescription: The purposes for this Association are:

title: Longhorn Athletic Training Student Association
descriptionSnippet: To provide students with a preview of the Athletic Training profession, and to examine current issues of this profession. We also provide an environment of relief and understanding for those who work with Athletics.
fullDescription: To provide students with a preview of the Athletic Training profession, and to examine current issues of this profession. We also provide an environment of relief and understanding for those who work with Athletics.

title: Longhorn Band Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The Longhorn Band Student Association forms the social structure of the Longhorn Band and organizes the band's largest student events and activities.
fullDescription: The Longhorn Band Student Association (LHBSA) is responsible for organizing student activities within the Longhorn Band, enhancing the overall band experience for all involved. LHBSA programming welcomes new members, sponsors social events throughout the year, hosts the annual Holiday Party and Longhorn Band Banquet, provides opportunities to participate in intramural sports, celebrates members' impact in the Austin community, and encourages the development of life-long friendships within LHB. Invitation to membership is extended to every member of the UT Longhorn Band.

title: Longhorn Baseball Club
descriptionSnippet: To provide an outlet for university students who are not able to play on the varsity baseball team for any reason. We will play any other university or organized baseball team that is not restricted by NCAA rules....
fullDescription: To provide an outlet for university students who are not able to play on the varsity baseball team for any reason. We will play any other university or organized baseball team that is not restricted by NCAA rules.

title: Longhorn Boxing
descriptionSnippet: To practice the sport of boxing at UT and to pursue a high standard of fitness. We aim to build a sense of community via an inclusive atmosphere and peer-to-peer coaching. Newcomers welcome! Join at https://www.facebook.com/UniversityBoxing
fullDescription: To practice the sport of boxing at UT and to pursue a high standard of fitness. We aim to build a sense of community via an inclusive atmosphere and peer-to-peer coaching. Newcomers welcome!

title: Longhorn Brain Bee
descriptionSnippet: UT Brian Bee is focused on providing a conducive competitive atmosphere where highschool and college students can foster a love and excitement for neuroscience, competition, public speaking, and build a mentorship relationship.
fullDescription: Longhorn Brian Bee is focused on providing a conducive competitive atmosphere where highschool and college students can foster a love and excitement for neuroscience, competition, public speaking, and build a mentorship relationship. The Brain Bee is a hive of fostered knowledge and skill, excited and dedicated highschool students are the intelligent bees, and we UT Brain Bee are the beekeepers.

title: Longhorn Car Club
descriptionSnippet: To be an avenue where car enthusiasts can meet, socialize, and partake in various automobile activities on a regular basis with other people who love cars. We hope to create a welcoming environment for people to learn about cars and share our passion.
fullDescription: Welcome to UT's Student Org for everyone who loves cars!

title: Longhorn Catholic Council
descriptionSnippet: The LCC is the organi of all Catholic students on campus and those interested in the Catholic faith. The LCC seeks to promote Catholic activities on campus and provide opportunities for spiritual growth for any interested member of the UT community.
fullDescription: The Longhorn Catholic Council is a community of students who represent Catholics on campus and those interested in the Catholic faith. The LCC seeks to promote Catholic activities and provide events and opportunities for spiritual growth for any interested member of the UT community. Through prayer and activity, the LCC strives to help UT in its mission to transform lives for the benefit of society. The LCC serves as the student council for the University Catholic Center which is located directly south of Little Field Fountain.

title: Longhorn Center for Academic Excellence
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn Center for Academic Excellence creates avenues facilitating the capacity of all students to take charge of their learning and their lives.
fullDescription: Longhorn Center for Academic Excellence creates avenues facilitating the capacity of all students to take charge of their learning and their lives. Through programs and services students become engaged members of the University community, exemplifying academic and personal excellence from their first semester at UT to graduation.

title: Longhorn Center for Community Engagement
descriptionSnippet: Learn Here, Serve Here! You'll find thousands of opportunities to volunteer and to give back to the Austin community through the Longhorn Center for Community Engagement. Volunteer on your own, with your group, or join one of our LCCE-sponsored programs.
fullDescription: The Longhorn Center for Community Engagement serves as The University of Texas at Austin’s central resource for those interested in volunteerism and service-learning throughout the UT and Austin communities.

title: Longhorn Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: We exist to Know God, Love People, and Change the World. If you have been a strong Christian for many years or are interested in knowing about Jesus for the first time this is a safe place for you to find a 2nd family that will love and encourage you n...
fullDescription: We exist to Know God, Love People, and Change the World. If you have been a strong Christian for many years or are interested in knowing about Jesus for the first time this is a safe place for you to find a 2nd family that will love and encourage you no matter what you ultimately believe about God. We desire to be authentic and genuine in the way we live and share the love of Jesus with those around us through finding needs to serve both our university and others around the world.

title: Longhorn Christian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn Christian Fellowship desires to glorify God by walking with individuals and helping them dive deeper into their understanding and love for Jesus Christ. We aim to help all people grow in their faith.
fullDescription: Longhorn Christian Fellowship desires to glorify God by walking with individuals and helping them dive deeper into their understanding and love for Jesus Christ. We aim to help all people grow in their faith through Christian community, biblical teaching, and loving accountability. Weekly LCF activities include one-on-one discipleship, small group Bible studies, and corporate worship.

title: Longhorn Cosplay
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn Cosplay provides members an environment where they can learn, share, and discuss cosplay, costuming, and makeup techniques, elements, and community.
fullDescription: Longhorn Cosplay holds weekly meetings on Tuesdays in JES A203A from 7pm-8pm.

title: Longhorn Curling
descriptionSnippet: A club designed to provide a place for those interested in the sport of curling to learn, play, participate and compete on a friendly level. The club may also at times compete with other nearby curling clubs and college teams.
fullDescription: A club designed to provide a place for those interested in the sport of curling to learn, play, participate and compete on a friendly level. The club may also at times compete with other nearby curling clubs and college teams.

title: Longhorn Cyber Crew
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn Cyber Crew is an elderly outreach organization with the primary goal of making both technology and companionship more accessible for the elderly community by volunteering in the Austin area and offering basic technology seminars for retirees.
fullDescription: Longhorn Cyber Crew is an elderly outreach organization with the primary goal of making both technology and companionship more accessible for the elderly community by volunteering in the Austin area and offering basic technology seminars for retirees. We hope to improve access to technology and communication for the retired community by showing ways they can keep in touch with family members, and to provide companionship for those in the area who may not have much of it. Our organization will volunteer in nursing and retirement homes in the Austin area and hold technology seminars where available to improve the skills of residents and give them access to an entirely new world of connections.

title: Longhorn Dance Company
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn Dance Companyis a friendly and welcoming organization geared towards various types of dance. All skill levels and majors are welcome to attend any meeting. This is a great opportunity to relieve stress and meet an energetic group of dancers.
fullDescription: Longhorn Dance Club is a friendly and welcoming organization geared toward Contemporary, Modern, Jazz, and Hip-Hop dance. All skill levels and majors are welcome to attend any meeting. This is a great opportunity to relieve stress and meet an energetic group of dancers. We meet once a week to learn a short piece of choreography and practice various technique. This Spring 2019 semester we will be meeting every Tuesday from 5-7pm in SAC 2.310. Our meetings will began on January 30th. If you have any questions feel free to contact any officer, email us at longhorndancecompany@gmail.com, or visit our Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1068561246511420/

title: Longhorn EMS
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn EMS is an agency of Student Government with a mission to provide excellence in emergency response and education. Every active member in this volunteer medical response organization is a certified EMT, committed to serving the UT community.
fullDescription: Longhorn EMS is an agency of student government composed of certified EMTs. Our past activities have included serving as medical standby at UT football games, 5K runs across Austin, and other special events. We have spent many years volunteering with the Special Olympics of Texas and the Boy Scouts of America to provide emergency care and education. You can find us at UT events, organization meetings, and pursuing community outreach to educate the Austin public in innovative and life-saving techniques.

title: Longhorn Energy Club
descriptionSnippet: A university-wide graduate student organization that supports interdisciplinary energy-related professional development; promotes interdisciplinary energy entrepreneurship, and inspires interdisciplinary energy research at UT Austin
fullDescription: Longhorn Energy is a university-wide graduate student organization that supports interdisciplinary professional development; promotes interdisciplinary energy entrepreneurship, and inspires interdisciplinary energy research at the University of Texas at Austin. We believe that the multifaceted nature of our global energy challenges demands cooperation across disciplines and technologies, and we operate in close partnership with the major stakeholders at the university, in government and in industry to facilitate these opportunities for collaboration.

title: Longhorn Entrepreneurship Agency
descriptionSnippet: LEA is the center of mass for student-run entrepreneurship at UT. We foster and promote student entrepreneurship through programs such as Freshman Founders, UT's first student coworking space, annual Entrepreneurship Weeks and Startup Job Fairs, and more.
fullDescription: The Longhorn Entrepreneurship Agency is an agency of Student Government that strives to connect, educate, and support student entrepreneurs while developing and fostering an innovative startup culture on campus. Formed in September 2012, we were charged with the mission of making student entrepreneurs as celebrated as student athletes. Soon after, we began to move past simply promoting student entrepreneurs to actively supporting and providing a home for student-run entrepreneurship.

title: Longhorn Environmental Outreach
descriptionSnippet: A philanthropy organization looking to make a difference in the community with emphasis in protecting and preserving the environment.
fullDescription: Longhorn Environmental Outreach is open to all students dedicated and determined to take part in preserving the environment. This includes participating in different service events with an emphasis on sustainability and preservation.

title: Longhorn Fellowship of Christian Athletes
descriptionSnippet: The core value of FCA at the University of Texas is the advancement of the gospel of Jesus Christ throughout the world through coaches and athletes. We want nothing more than for all students athletes, coaches, and UT students to know Jesus Christ.
fullDescription: Our motto as an organization is to spread the gospel to and through student athletes. We live from the word, Matthew 24:14 says "This gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in the whole world as a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come". For our Texas chapter, we do this through meeting every week when school is session, inviting all athletes, coaches, staff, and students. We often throughout the semester support sports teams by attending a sport's competition and cheering them on as a huddle. As a huddle, it's all about Jesus and our huddle past and present have kept it that way.

title: Longhorn Fulbrighters
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn Fulbrighters is the community of Fulbrighters at UT dedicated to support each other, provide personal and professional growth opportunities and serves as a platform to promote the values of the Fulbright program on campus.

title: Longhorn Gaming
descriptionSnippet: Longhorn Gaming is the central gaming community at UT. No matter your background, what game you play, or your skill level, LG is the club for you. We host LAN parties, compete in tournaments, and love to just hang out and play video games together.
fullDescription:
Welcome to Longhorn Gaming, where casual meets competitive.

We bring people together on campus to create a community at UT for gamers from all different backgrounds and skill levels. Whether you play casually or competitively, multiplayer or single player, Longhorn Gaming is the place for you!

We host LANs, watch parties, compete in collegiate esports leagues, and provide opportunities for UT gamers to hang out together.

title: Longhorn Hellraisers
descriptionSnippet: The Longhorn Hellraisers is Loudest and Proudest student org on campus, dedicated to supporting UT Athletics by creating an exciting and winning environment at sporting events.
fullDescription: To raise spirit at The University of Texas by attending sporting events with our faces painted orange and white and participating in cheers.

title: Longhorn Investment Team
descriptionSnippet: We build more than resumes. Longhorn Investment Team is redefining the way students learn about business with an integrative approach that spans beyond the typical investment team.
fullDescription: https://longhorninvestmentteam.com/

title: Longhorn KIVA
descriptionSnippet: KIVA is a global organization that works with microfinance institutions to provide loans to people who lack access to traditional banking systems. This organization will bring students together to raise money for those in need in our global community.
fullDescription: Students will have the opportunity to learn how to evaluate risk and appropriately allocate funds, while simultaneously impacting the lives of those in need around the world. Our organization focuses on establishing a strong connection between philanthropy and entrepreneurialism. Whether you're primarily business oriented or passionate about helping people, Longhorn Kiva requires a diverse array of team members to accomplish the greater goal of giving back to our global community.

title: Longhorn League of United Latin American Citizens
descriptionSnippet: Being a member of LULAC is an exceptional beginning, providing opportunities for leadership, responsibility, perseverance, commitment, education, community involvement, and so much more. Welcome to the family and our team of dedicated advocates!
fullDescription: Our mission is to advance the economic condition, educational attainment, political influence, health, housing and civil rights of the Hispanic population in the United States.

title: Longhorn Legislative Aides
descriptionSnippet: Internship within Student Government that works with the Executive Board, Assembly, and other agencies in order to deal with issues on campus. Mentors, Friends, and memories come with being an LLA. LLA will mature each intern in the professional world.
fullDescription: Longhorn Legislative Aide is a first-year leadership agency within student government designed to develop the University of Texas's future leaders. LLAs are an active group of twenty interns that provide feedback and help author resolutions to issues across campus while working closely with the Student Government Executive Board, Assembly, and other agencies. LLAs will understand what it means to be a longhorn by focusing on the UT core values of Learning, Leadership, and Responsibility.

fullDescription: The Longhorn Link Program – Student Support Services – is a federally funded TRiO program. This program is funded under Title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965. The University of Texas at Austin was awarded initial funding in the Fall of 2001.

fullDescription: To unite student volunteers of Austin Pets Alive through service and social engagement in order to promote the mission of helping Austin become a no-kill city. We host profit share events, fundraisers, and take groups of students to volunteer at APA, among other activities.

title: Longhorn Quiz Bowl
descriptionSnippet: UT college quizbowl competes in academic tournaments locally and across the nation. In 2019, UT quizbowl won Texas' ACF Regional, Texas' NAQT Sectional, and tied for 17th at ACF Nationals at UPenn. Newcomers, undergrad and graduate, are always welcomed.
fullDescription: The University of Texas Quiz Bowl team competes in quiz bowl tournaments across the nation. Competitions involve teams of students answering primarily academic questions across all disciplines, including history, literature, science, and fine arts. Competitors play in teams of four students, answering tossup questions individually to give the team the opportunity to work together on bonuses.

title: Longhorn Racing
descriptionSnippet: UT Austin Chapter of Formula SAE and Solar Vehicle Teams
fullDescription: Longhorn Racing provides students with the opportunity to explore different engineering fields and grow their tangible skills through a collaborative and innovative environment.  Each year we design, build and test two formula style vehicles (electric and internal combustion) from scratch.  Every 3-4 years, we design, build and test a solar-powered vehicle as well.  All of our vehicles compete every summer in locations across the nation.

title: Longhorn Singers
descriptionSnippet: A co-educational show choir providing UT Austin with entertainment and UT Spirit.
fullDescription: Providing “Entertainment in the Finest College Tradition,” Longhorn Singers was founded in 1958 by Dr. Morris Beachy by joining together the men’s and women’s glee clubs of the school of music into one ensemble. He envisioned new group for the university, one that joined singers from all educational backgrounds to promote a sense of Texas pride—both for our school and our state. Now, half a century later, the group has evolved into who we are today: the premier show choir of The University of Texas at Austin.

title: Longhorn Smash
descriptionSnippet: The CGC is an organization aimed at providing a place for competitive gamers at UT to grow and thrive while learning how to balance their gaming habits with academic success. Super Smash Bros Ultimate is our primary competitive game at the moment.
fullDescription: The Competitive Gaming Club aims to provide a place for competitive Esports gamers at UT to thrive while learning to balance their gaming with academic success. It hosts tournaments or get-togethers weekly, allowing for players to test their skill in fighting games like Super Smash Bros. Ultimate, Street Fighter V, and many others. The CGC is free to join and encourages participation from all levels of skill. Be sure to contact one of our members on Facebook for more information, or join our active Discord group at https://discord.gg/DMcrFVa

title: Longhorn Stream Team
descriptionSnippet: The Longhorn Stream Team (LST) both trains and teaches citizen scientists to paddle Texas rivers, collect water quality data and promote conservation in order to ensure the longevity of Texas waterways.
fullDescription: The Longhorn Stream Team was created by Mr. Chris Burnett and has developed to encompass four main pillars of purpose: science, service, environmental leadership and river readiness. Science is fostered through the training of citizen scientists and the collection of water samples on each trip. Service is achieved through outreach activities in which members use their river skills and resources for the benefit of the Austin community. Environmental Leadership is developed through outreach initiatives that draw community attention to issues of water conservation and watershed protection. River Readiness is built over time through paddling and swift water rescue trainings, gear, trip planning, safety instruction and trip execution. The LST believes in experiental education and seeks to make river health and water quality part of the conversation at the University of Texas and the surrounding community.

title: Longhorn Students For Smiles
descriptionSnippet: "Longhorn Students For Smiles" plans to host arts and crafts day and fundraisers at UT for pediatric patients at local hospitals. Our organization tries to put a smile on the faces of children by fulfilling their needs during treatment.
fullDescription: I recently started a volunteer program in which many of my peers and I spend time at Dell Children’s Medical Center in Austin. The patients and their families enjoy doing arts and crafts projects, playing board games, and reading children’s books with us every other week. Now after several weeks, we realize how meaningful spending time there is to the children and their parents.  As we expand this project, we hope to host events at UT such as toy drives and bake sales.

title: Longhorn Swim Club
descriptionSnippet: For all swimmers (old and new) who want to train with a group of people and engage in the sport of swimming
fullDescription: Longhorn Swim Club, or LSC, is an up-and-coming recreational sports organization that swimmers and hydrophillic humans at UT can embrace. Founded to provide an active swim group on campus with land-based opportunities abound, Longhorn Swim Club offers group swims, dryland sessions, swim meets and more! We welcome swimmers of all experience levels. Come check us out, and dive into a program that is anything but dry.

title: Longhorn Tabletop Gaymers
descriptionSnippet: We are an inclusive group of tabletop gaming enthusiasts, with a primary focus on Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition, but we play anything. Interested in joining our campaign? Looking for people to play an obscure tabletop with? Contact us to learn more!
fullDescription: We are an inclusive group of tabletop gaming enthusiasts, with a primary focus on Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition, but we play anything. Interested in joining our campaign? Looking for people to play an obscure tabletop with? Contact us to learn more!

title: Longhorn Tech Association
descriptionSnippet: LTA creates a virtuous cycle for tech career paths through mentorship, application coaching, alumni engagement, and awareness. LTA was founded by students who survived and eventually conquered the recruiting gauntlet, achieving a variety of job offers.
fullDescription: “Tech recruiting” is now an industry onto itself - as the stereotypes go, while finance majors line up in suits to learn how to make DCF’s for investment banking, tech-focused students now are in a frenzy to “crack the coding interview”. The need for greater awareness and specialized support for recruiting for these roles is especially pressing now that opportunities previously reserved for individuals with more degrees and/or experience, such as MBA’s for product managers and PHD’s for data science, are accessible in the form of internships and undergraduate recruiting.

title: Longhorn Westies
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of Austin Westies is to promote interests and expand knowledge of West Coast Swing dancing to the community at the The University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: Longhorn Westies is a student organization dedicated to West Coast Swing at University of Texas at Austin. Our goal is to promote and expand West Coast swing dance, music, and culture within the UT Austin community, while connecting to the greater Austin West Coast Swing community and beyond. Our club offers weekly classes, practice sessions, and few social events each semester.

title: Longhorn Wrestling
descriptionSnippet: Men's and Women's collegiate Wrestling team at the University of Texas.
fullDescription: Longhorn Wrestling is a co-ed, student-run sports team on the Forty Acres that focuses on leadership, discipline, and perseverance. We train wrestlers of all skills levels by practicing for two hours Monday through Thursday each week. Our season starts in October and we compete in National Collegiate Wrestling Association (NCWA) tournaments across Texas until March. The NCWA National Championships are hosted in Allen, TX at the beginning of March each year. We have both competitive and non-competitive memberships, both of which enjoy access to all of our practices, workouts, training & dieting routines.

title: Longhorn Yoga
descriptionSnippet: An organization offering free yoga courses every week throughout the year!
fullDescription: We offer free yoga courses every week through both main semesters and the summer. Appropriate for beginners or experienced practitioners alike, and led by a licensed instructor with no ties to outside studios.

fullDescription: LuMin is a member of the Lutheran Campus Ministry Network of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA). LuMin is an open, non-fundamentalist Christian community. fullDescription:
Magic Club is a group of young magicians who are passionate about sharing and teaching the art of magic. The club welcomes all who are eager to pursue magic no matter the experience. Composed of magicians of all different levels of experience, UT Austin Magic Club will train magicians to develop a skill set to perform magic around campus and Austin.

We aim to develop magicians who will be comfortable with performing for friends, family, and strangers on the street, on stage, or walk around. Our foremost goal is to spread the art of magic around campus.

title: Management Information Systems Association
descriptionSnippet: The Management Information Systems Association unites a diverse community of individuals who have a passion for combining technology with business and often pursue careers in Information Technology.
fullDescription:
The Management Information Systems Association is a professional, academic, philanthropic and social organization. MISA unites a diverse community of individuals who have a passion for combining technology with business and often pursue careers in Information Technology. Each semester MISA holds various activities that are designed to expose students to professional opportunities, expand their technological skills, and meet other like-minded individuals.
​
Originally founded in 1982, MISA was re-established in 2009 and has experienced rapid growth. In the past few years, MISA membership grew by 250% and attracted majors from MIS, Computer Science, Engineering, and Natural Sciences.

title: Native American & Indigenous Collective
descriptionSnippet: NAIC is a student led organization with the principles of native empowerment, research, transnational and intertribal unity, scholarship and community.
fullDescription: The Native American and Indigenous Collective (NAIC) arises from the merging of the Longhorn American Indian Council (LAIC) and the Native American & Indigenous Student Assembly (NAISA.) NAIC is a student led organization with the principles of native empowerment, research, transnational and intertribal unity, scholarship and community. The merging of these two groups celebrates the different indigenous identities across the four directions and seeks to create consciousness about our indigenous roots as we continue to fight for the survival of our cultures.

title: Natural Sciences Council
descriptionSnippet: Natural Sciences Council was founded in 1972 to serve as a liaison between the students and the faculty in the College of Natural Sciences (CNS). We work with the college and its students to create resources and improve the CNS student experience.
fullDescription: Natural Sciences Council was founded in 1972 to serve as a liaison between the students and the faculty in the College of Natural Sciences (CNS). We help direct feedback of programs in the college and work to resolve the problems students face in their daily academic and social communities. Through our events and programs, we connect students to the resources they need to succeed here and beyond, including campus entities, students of similar interests, faculty members, and organizations around UT and Austin. We constantly seek feedback from CNS students regarding functions and programs in the college and focus on how we can improve in order to better enhance the CNS student experience.

title: Natyam
descriptionSnippet: Natyam is a dance club for the practice of all traditional items of Bharatanatyam and Kuchipudi, two types of Indian Classical Dance forms.
fullDescription: Natyam is a club for the practice of two South Indian classical dance forms: Bharatanatyam and Kuchipudi. Natyam is the sanskrit word for "dance." Members will be able to learn, practice, and share items from a traditional Bharatanatyam or Kuchipudi margam (repertoire.) The goal of Natyam is to encourage the practice of Bharatanatyam and Kuchipudi in their pure classical forms; thus, all items learned will be purely classical numbers. Natyam is a lower time commitment club, which will have weekly meetings. Every meeting, we will warm up, review some adavus (steps) of Bharatanatyam, and continue work on a dance item of choice. No audition is required to join, however, previous training in Bharatanatyam or Kuchipudi is required.

title: Nritya Sangam Indian Dance Troupe
descriptionSnippet: Nritya Sangam Indian Dance Troupe is a not-for-profit organization at The University of Texas committed to serving its community through its passion for Indian classical dance and its philanthropic spirit.
fullDescription:
Nritya Sangam Indian Dance Troupe is a not-for-profit organization at The University of Texas committed to serving its community through its passion for Indian classical dance and its philanthropic spirit. NS was founded in 2002 by two students who shared a love for dance. The phrase "Nritya Sangam" means "unity of dance," which is exemplary of the type of students selected to join Nritya Sangam; our members represent a diverse array of schools and styles of Indian dance. In addition, each member  is an experienced dancer, carrying years of extensive training under the instruction of their respective teachers. We dance to keep up with an art form and talent we have spent so many years cultivating, and to preserve our age-old culture and traditions. 

The ancient Indian dance styles that we primarily derive inspiration from are Bharatanatyam and Kuchipudi, art forms that are struggling to survive in modern society. We hope to expose the mainstream community to the richness and depth of an art little-known in America through performances on the UT campus, as well as around Austin and other parts of the state and nation. The members of Nritya Sangam serve as ambassadors of traditional Indian fine arts on-campus, as the troupe is the only Indian classical dance group at the university. 

Nritya Sangam strives to make its community a better place. You can help us by officially recognizing and acknowledging the work that we do in the city of Austin and internationally. Your continued support affirms our drive to attain our goals. Please spread the word and help us publicize our causes and mission as we gain momentum as an organization.
