title: Nurses for Racial Justice
descriptionSnippet: Nurses and nursing students who want to learn about racial bias in healthcare/society and ways to promote racial justice.
fullDescription: Racial bias exists and little acknowledged in our education as nurses.  We want to do our best to learn and be aware of the ways in which racial bias affects all of our patients and the care we provide.  We aim to promote racial justice through providing resources, education, sharing ideas, and hosting guest speakers who can better help us understand the state of racial justice.

title: Office of the Dean of Students
descriptionSnippet: The Office of the Dean of Students provides opportunities and experiences that support student learning and personal development.
fullDescription: The Office of the Dean of Students (DoS) offers access to a comprehensive array of the resources available at The University of Texas at Austin. Our staff provides information and referrals to prospective and current students, Longhorn parents, faculty, staff and alumni.

title: Omega Chi Epsilon - Chemical Engineering
descriptionSnippet: The objective of Omega Chi Epsilon (OXE) is to recognize and promote high scholarship, original investigation, camaraderie, and professional service in the McKetta Department of Chemical Engineering at the University of Texas at Austin....
fullDescription: The objective of Omega Chi Epsilon (OXE) is to recognize and promote high scholarship, original investigation, camaraderie, and professional service in the Department of Chemical Engineering at the University of Texas at Austin.

title: Omega Delta Phi Fraternity, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Omega Delta Phi is a multicultural service/social fraternity that upholds and promotes the principles of Unity, Honesty, Integrity and Leadership.
fullDescription: Omega Delta Phi is a multicultural service/social fraternity that upholds and promotes the principles of Unity, Honesty, Integrity and Leadership. Established in 1987 at Texas Tech University, it has grown to 78 entities, including the Chi chapter at the University of Texas at Austin. For more information regarding our fraternity, Greek Life, or answers to questions you may have as new students on campus, feel welcomed to e-mail us at president.chi@omegadeltaphi.org.

title: Omega Phi Alpha National Service Sorority
descriptionSnippet: Our mission is service. We provide opportunities for leadership and friendship through training and participation in service activities. Our hope is that our members will become life-long, service-minded leaders. We strive to better the lives of others.
fullDescription: The mission of Omega Phi Alpha is service. We provide opportunities for leadership and friendship through training and participation in service activities. Our hope is that our members will become life-long, service-minded leaders. We strive to better the lives of others worldwide by collaborating with organizations and volunteering through a flexible service program.

title: Omega Phi Gamma Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Omega Phi Gamma is an Asian-interest fraternity established in the Spring of 1995 at the University of Texas at Austin. We strive to promote brotherhood, leadership, academics and service within the Asian-American community.
fullDescription: Omega Phi Gamma is an Asian-interest fraternity established in the Spring of 1995 at the University of Texas at Austin. We strive to promote brotherhood, leadership, and service within the Asian-American community, and continue to maintain the highest levels of excellence while encouraging the growth of strong and successful men. Every fall semester, we host the annual Unity Talent show to celebrate and showcase of Asian-American talent at UT.

title: One Note Stand
descriptionSnippet: One Note Stand is an a cappella group whose mission is to serve the Austin community through music.
fullDescription: One Note Stand is a nationally recognized competitive a cappella group that enjoys singing on and around the UT campus. Originally founded as a service organization, ONS continues to hold true to their roots by giving free performances to charity events and fundraisers while also focusing on improving musically and making a name for themselves in the national a cappella community.

title: OneWay South Asian InterVarsity
descriptionSnippet: OneWay is designed to be a place of fellowship for people to come together to learn more about Jesus and grow in their relationship with Him. It is a branch of the nationwide campus ministry called InterVarsity.

title: Opportunities for Undergraduate Research at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: OUR UT is an undergraduate research program for incoming freshmen students. Students take part in higher education research projects working with a student mentor, graduate students, faculty and student affairs professionals.
fullDescription: Each year, a select group of DoS Scholars is chosen to participate in OUR UT (Opportunities for Undergraduate Research at The University of Texas at Austin) program. Led by Associate Dean of Students for Research, Dr. Audrey Sorrells, these undergraduate students are matched with research being conducted by the DoS Research Institute. In an effort to connect research with the practice of student affairs, projects focus on co-curricular programming affecting student performance, engagement, retention and graduation. Current topics being explored include culturally responsive practices, mentoring, judicial services and student veterans. DoS Scholars are chosen through a competitive process.

title: Orange Bike Project
descriptionSnippet: The Orange Bike Project is UT's community bike shop where students can volunteer, learn, and work on their own bikes. We have the tools and expertise to teach you to work on your own. Need a bike repair, daily, or semester rentals? We'll help you out!
fullDescription:
The University of Texas at Austin's Community Bike Workshop and Rental.
OBP runs a competitive daily and semester bicycle rental and a community bike workshop.

UT student, staff and affiliates are welcome to come in and volunteer, fix and maintain their bikes and learn more about bicycles and cycling. 

Bicycles in the rental fleet are rented to UT students and staff both on a semester long basis and a daily basis. 

Bikes in the daily rental program are high quality Commuter/Hybrid bicycles that are great for errands, group outings, class field trips and more! They can be rented for a small daily, weekend or weekly fee by UT students and staff.

For detailed information on all of the above and more, please visit our official page:http://www.utexas.edu/parking/bike/orange.html

We are located in the 27th Street Garage. Come in through the parking lot on the ground floor and listen for the music!

title: Order of Omega - Iota Pi Chapter
descriptionSnippet: To recognize those fraternity men & women who have attained a high standard of leadership in interfraternity activities, to encourage them to continue along this line, and to inspire others to strive for similar conspicuous attainment.
fullDescription: To recognize those fraternity men & women who have attained a high standard of leadership in interfraternity activities, to encourage them to continue along this line, and to inspire others to strive for similar conspicuous attainment. To bring together outstanding fraternity men & women to create an organization which will help to mold the sentiment of the institution on questions of local & intercollegiate fraternity affairs.

title: Origami Circle
descriptionSnippet: The Origami Circle is dedicated to teaching UT students the art of paper folding.
fullDescription: The Origami Circle is dedicated to teaching UT students the art of paper folding. Folders of all experience levels are welcome to our bi-monthly meetings. Our meetings feature fun projects, hands-on instructions, and the opportunity to meet fellow origami lovers!

title: Orthodox Christian Campus Ministries at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: An organization for Coptic Orthodox, Oriental Orthodox, or any student to pursue their love for Jesus Christ.
fullDescription: Our mission as the Orthodox Christian Campus Ministries at UT Austin is to develop and maintain a relationship with our Lord Jesus Christ through prayer and worship, to reach out to the community through service and evangelism, and to grow in the bond of love through fellowship with each other in the Holy Spirit.

title: Orthodox Christian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: The mission of OCF is to support fellowships on college campuses, whose members experience and witness to the Orthodox Christian Church through community life, prayer, service to others, and study of the Faith. Furthermore, OCF will work to nurture a...
fullDescription: The mission of OCF is to support fellowships on college campuses, whose members experience and witness to the Orthodox Christian Church through community life, prayer, service to others, and study of the Faith. Furthermore, OCF will work to nurture and strengthen love for Jesus Christ and His church in its fullness at this most critical juncture of human life through: Communication between OCF's and with the larger Orthodox community, and development of resources for local OCF's.

title: OUTLaw - LGBTQ Law Student Association
descriptionSnippet: OUTLaw seeks to unify and promote the interests of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer/questioning law students.
fullDescription: OUTLaw seeks to promote the interests of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer/questioning law students. Membership in OUTLaw is not limited to individuals of a particular sexual orientation or gender identity; allies are always welcome. OUTLaw aims to diminish homophobia and transphobia by fostering awareness of queer issues at the University of Texas School of Law. OUTLaw also sponsors social activities for and supports the academic objectives of its members.

title: Oxfam at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: Oxfam is dedicated to finding and promoting lasting solutions to global poverty, hunger, and social injustice.
fullDescription: Oxfam is dedicated to finding and promoting lasting solutions to global poverty, hunger, and social injustice. We educate the student body about issues such as fair trade and extractive sectors as well as participate in community activism to create lasting change.

title: Pagan Student Alliance
descriptionSnippet: To provide a forum and support network for people of alternative faiths and to facilitate interfaith dialogue across the campus....
fullDescription:
The Pagan Student Alliance at UT Austin is a support organization for people of alternative religions, loosely focusing on a spectrum of polytheistic and earth or nature based faith-systems, and a forum for interfaith discussions. We seek to provide a venue in which to explore various aspects of these systems as well as to host social functions, rituals, and philanthropy events and initiatives. We also seek to increase the Pagan presence on campus and in the wider Austin community, as well as a myriad of other initiatives as deemed fit by the student membership. 

Everyone is welcome, as long as they remain respectful of other participants.

title: Palestine Solidarity Committee
descriptionSnippet: To promote education, discourse, activism, and awareness of the Palestinian struggle for freedom from oppression and occupation....
fullDescription: The Palestine Solidarity Committee is a student organization at the University of Texas at Austin dedicated to telling the story of the Palestinian struggle for justice and self-determination on the university campus and in the wider Austin community. We work to promote education, discourse, activism, and awareness of the Palestinian story through lectures by academics and political activists, movie screenings, and events and displays on the UT West Mall.

title: PALS (Partnership to Advance Language Study & Cultural)
descriptionSnippet: The PALS Program brings International and American students together for cultural exchange and to practice conversation skills. We carefully match one another based on their interests in language and hobbies.
fullDescription: The PALS Program brings International and American students together for cultural exchange and to practice conversation skills. We carefully match one another based on their interests in language and hobbies. We develop and plan fun events to promote an inclusive environment on UT campus. Our events have included a trip to Barton Springs, bowling night, game night, and a tie-dye activity. At PALS we want to make sure every student coming into our organization has the opportunity to hang out with their PAL along with mingling with other students in the organization. Members of the UT Austin and International communities are welcome to apply.

title: Party on the Plaza
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Party on the Plaza student organization is to promote the largest campus wide organization fair at the University of Texas. Party on the Plaza provides support for the Student Emergency Fund.
fullDescription: WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 4, 2019: 10AM-5PM

title: Patent Pending Texas
descriptionSnippet: Patent Pending Texas (PPT) was founded in 2018 with a mission to provide engineering leaders and innovators with intelligence surrounding patented process technologies. At PPT, we are driven by a passion for invention in the world of chemicals.
fullDescription: Patent Pending Texas (PPT) was founded in 2018 with a mission to provide engineering leaders and innovators with intelligence surrounding patented process technologies. At PPT, we are driven by a passion for invention in the world of chemicals and manufacturing processes. Our organization has two objectives:

title: Petroleum Graduate Student Association
descriptionSnippet: Our goals are to facilitate interaction among PGE graduate students, to gather and disseminate pertinent information, to conduct activities that promote the general welfare of PGE graduate students and to represent their views to the university community
fullDescription: We are the Petroleum Graduate Students Association (PGSA) at the University of Texas at Austin. We represent the graduate student organization for the Hildebrand Department of Petroleum Engineering. We are a student run organization that brings together students from all backgrounds interested in the oil and gas industry. We strive to provide a support system and social outlet for the graduate students and act as a liaison between the students and PGE department.

title: Pharmacy Council
descriptionSnippet: Pharmacy Council serves as the student governance and student voice of the College of Pharmacy. The programs sponsored by Pharmacy Council include Project Collaborate, College of Pharmacy Teaching Excellence Awards, Pharmacy Month, and many more.
fullDescription: The mission of the Pharmacy Council is to provide an official voice through which student opinion may be expressed in the College of Pharmacy; provide a means for responsible and effective participation in this organization; allow a system to enhance the quality and scope of education within the College of Pharmacy; and provide support for projects related to Pharmacy as a profession and it related fields which will benefit the University, the College, the students and the community.

title: Pharmacy Graduate Students Association
descriptionSnippet: 1) Represent the Pharmacy graduate students as an entity; 2) orient new graduate students; 3) for fellowship and professional interaction between students from different departments in Pharmacy.
fullDescription: 1) Represent the Pharmacy graduate students as an entity; 2) orient new graduate students; 3) for fellowship and professional interaction between students from different departments in Pharmacy.

title: Phi Alpha Theta, Beta Alpha Chapter - History
descriptionSnippet: Promotion of the study of history by the encouragement of research, good teaching, publication, and the exchange of learning and thought among historians.
fullDescription: Promotion of the study of history by the encouragement of research, good teaching, publication, and the exchange of learning and thought among historians. It seeks to bring students, teachers and writers of history together both intellectually and socially, and it encourages and assists, in a variety of ways, historical research and publication by its members.

title: Phi Beta Chi - Professional Women's Business Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: As the first professional women's organization at UT, Phi Beta Chi offers its members the opportunity to develop themselves as professional women, while also volunteering in the community, and enjoying their time together at exciting social events!
fullDescription: The goal of Phi Beta Chi is to promote the women of the University of Texas at Austin in the professional world by encouraging academic achievement, leadership skills, and fraternal relations; and by easing the transition from college students to career women.

title: Phi Chi Theta
descriptionSnippet: Phi Chi Theta is a national professional fraternity for students in Business and Economics established in 1924 to promote the cause of higher business education and training for all individuals to foster high ideals for all pursuing careers, to encoura...
fullDescription: Phi Chi Theta is a national professional fraternity for students in Business and Economics established in 1924 to promote the cause of higher business education and training for all individuals to foster high ideals for all pursuing careers, to encourage fraternity and cooperation among people preparing for such careers, and to stimulate the spirit of sacrifice and unselfish devotion to the attainment of such ends.

title: Phi Delta Chi
descriptionSnippet: The Lambda Chapter of Phi Delta Chi is a national and professional co-educational fraternity at the University of Texas at Austin College of Pharmacy. Since 1883, Phi Delta Chi has worked to advance the profession of pharmacy and its allied interests, ...
fullDescription: The Lambda Chapter of Phi Delta Chi is a national and professional co-educational fraternity at the University of Texas at Austin College of Pharmacy. Since 1883, Phi Delta Chi has worked to advance the profession of pharmacy and its allied interests, and to foster and promote a fraternal spirit among our Brothers. PDC is a lifelong experience and promotes scholastic, professional, and social growth in its Brothers. Across the nation, Phi Delta Chi has chartered over 60 active chapters and has had over 40,000 cross into our Brotherhood.

title: Phi Delta Phi: The International Legal Honor Society at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: PDP is intended to help pre-law students pave their path to law school through inviting guest speakers, preparing for the LSAT, and hosting networking events so that students are able to learn about what law school is and the life of an attorney is like.
fullDescription: Phi Delta Phi Pre-Law Honor Society will function as an organization to create a social and professional network for pre-law students, so that they are able to find out more information about law school and how to prepare for this. By attending our weekly chapter meetings, students will meet and hear from countless attorneys and Deans of law school on the steps to take and different types of law that will shape one's career. In addition, we host social and volunteering events to serve the greater Austin and create connections with those that share the same interests as you. PDP is a way for pre-law students to form a successful legal career and invigorate students academically.

title: Phi Delta Theta Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Phi Delta Theta is a fraternity organized to foster social activity, scholarship and association of students for their mutual advancement.
fullDescription: Phi Delta Theta is a fraternity organized to foster social activity, scholarship and association of students for their mutual advancement.

descriptionSnippet: To be a fellowship and home away from home for its members. To pro- vide guidance from peers in almost any direction. To provide not only brotherhood on this campus but on a national scale and thereby to broaden members horizons.
fullDescription: To be a fellowship and home away from home for its members. To pro- vide guidance from peers in almost any direction. To provide not only brotherhood on this campus but on a national scale and thereby to broaden members horizons. Performance of community service and charity functions are major activities.

title: Phi Gamma Nu Epsilon Beta
descriptionSnippet: The Epsilon Beta chapter of PGN is a business organization at UT that strives to bring passionate, driven, and hardworking students together. We are Co-ed and open to all majors, and build professional skills while also performing community service.
fullDescription: The Epsilon Beta chapter of PGN focuses on three areas: Professionalism, Philanthropy and Community building. As a new organization on campus, members have the unique opportunity to hold leadership positions and help decide its future. We host professional workshops, led by our own members, but also bring in speakers and entrepreneurs from the local Austin community. The Epsilon Beta chapter is very excited about the community service we have been doing in Austin, and are currently partnered with Austin Pets Alive as our main philanthropy. By bringing students with similar study habits and career goals together, we have created a strong peer network and enjoy spending time together, even outside of weekly meetings. Our chapter is unique at UT because we accept all majors, and most of our members are involved in other business, engineering, or social organizations on campus.

title: Phi Kappa Psi Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: The Phi Kappa Psi Fraternity engages men of integrity, further develops their intellect and enhances community involvement.

descriptionSnippet: The Objects of Phi Kappa Sigma fraternity shall be the promotion of good fellowship and the cultivation of the social virtues among our members; the protection of just rights and the advancement of the best interests, present and future, individual and...
fullDescription: The Objects of Phi Kappa Sigma fraternity shall be the promotion of good fellowship and the cultivation of the social virtues among our members; the protection of just rights and the advancement of the best interests, present and future, individual and collective, of all those who shall be associated together as members of this fraternity; the encouragement of good scholarship and the breadth of training for our members; and cooperation in the educational and cultural programs of institutions of higher education in which our chapters are located.

descriptionSnippet: The mission of Pi Lambda Chi is to create a strong Sisterhood and an educational support network for women on college campuses. Pi Lambda Chi seeks to preserve Latina/Latino culture and history as well as promote education and community service.
fullDescription: An important aspect of our Sorority is that women of all ethnicities are welcome to join our Sisterhood and share the experience of being a Sister. We don’t turn any woman away because of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or socioeconomic status. We love the diversity our Sorority has. We have Sisters represented worldwide; from California to Jersey, Nepal to Peru. We don’t choose our Sisters, our Sisters choose us.

We initiate dialogue, activities, programs, and networking opportunities within the LBJ School and the greater UT community. PAACC seeks to create a community where minority students voices are empowered by our efforts.

The panel is responsible for planning all social, scholarly, outreach, and recruitment events for the program.

title: Pratham
descriptionSnippet: To help raise awareness of the task to make a more literate India. Pratham looks to coordinate events to raise funds and support for this important issue
fullDescription: Pratham UT is a chapter of Pratham USA, started by a group of students in the fall of 2003 who wanted to make an impact on the world.  As a campus organization, Pratham UT’s goal is to increase awareness on campus about the need to combat illiteracy in India.

title: Pre-Optometry Professional Society
descriptionSnippet: For the benefit of interested optometry students to develop an understanding and awareness of the optometry career. Possible activities include group study sessions for the OAT, trips to Colleges of Optometry in Texas, etc....
fullDescription:
POPS is an established student organization that works to inform University of Texas at Austin students about the field of optometry. We encourage strong relationships between students and optometrists and provide hands-on experience for vision care through shadowing and volunteering opportunities. Our members are active participants at our school and in our community and are very engaged in the field of optometry. 

Each year, we invite optometry school representatives and local optometrists to speak at our meetings. Each fall semester, we host a Student-Doctor conference to provide students a one-on-one opportunity to speak with several different optometrists. We also take a trip to San Antonio to visit The Rosenberg School of Optometry. In the spring, we attend the Texas Optometric Association Convention here in Austin. We also take a trip to Houston every spring to attend the Spring Conference, hosted by University of Houston POPS, and Optometry Day, hosted by the University of Houston College of Optometry.

Come out to a meeting and learn what POPS and the field of optometry are all about!

http://www.texaspops.org/

2019-2020 POPS Officers
President: Kevin Le
External Vice President: Linda Bui
Internal Vice President: Pia Vo
Secretary: Lydia Philip
Treasurer: Austin Franco
Volunteer Coordinator: Ivette Zapata
Social Chair: Rolando Guillot
Historian: Aryssa Jo Cruz

title: Pre-Physician Assistant Society
descriptionSnippet: The Pre-Physician Assistant Society at UT was founded in 1999. As the physician assistant profession continues to grow, members of this organization will gain more insight about the profession and make valuable contacts in the healthcare industry.
fullDescription: Visit our website for more information!

title: Pre-Veterinary Association
descriptionSnippet: We are a Pre-Veterinary organization striving to provide students information about veterinary school and medicine while pursuing volunteer opportunities as an inspired group.
fullDescription: We are dedicated to providing pre-veterinary students with accurate and current information on pre-requisites, resume-building ideas, animal medicine volunteer opportunities, and mini-seminars from a wide variety of doctors in many different fields of animal medicine. Through our organization, you will connect with veterinarians, animal professionals, volunteer organizations, and other peers sharing similar long-term goals. We meet each week in JGB 2.202 starting February 4th. Our next meeting is February 18th. Follow our facebook page for detailed information about events!

title: Precious Plastic Texas
descriptionSnippet: We're a team of engineers, creators, designers, and thinkers looking to set up the Precious Plastic recycling process here at UT. We're always looking for some great people to join the fight against plastic pollution!
fullDescription: Precious Plastic Texas is the University of Texas chapter of an international grassroots movement with a mission to educate and empower individuals and communities to re-purpose single use plastic consumer waste, a vast majority of which piles up in landfills. Rather than viewing plastic as trash, we consider it a precious resource. PPTX is dedicated to helping create a circular economy of plastics in Austin and implement the Office of Sustainability’s Zero-Waste program. We enable plastic recycling efforts by building small-scale plastic re-processing and production machines based on open-source engineering designs to convert plastic waste into new, usable products.

title: Pride and Equity Faculty Staff Association
descriptionSnippet: PEFSA is a University Resource Group established in the Fall of 2006 to promote the interests of LGBTQ and allied faculty and staff at UT Austin. All UT faculty and staff are welcome to join. Help us to make a difference!

title: Pride Policy Alliance
descriptionSnippet: To act as a resource and support organization for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer, Intersex, and Asexual + students at the LBJ School of Public Affairs.
fullDescription: The Pride Policy Alliance is an inclusive LGBTQIA+ (Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer, Intersex, and Asexual +) organization. We aim to increase the visibility of LGBTQIA+ issues at the LBJ School of Public Affairs, create community, and advocate for policies that advance equality at the LBJ School, UT, and the greater Austin community. While focusing on the queer community, we welcome all to participate in our programming. PPA is a part of the UT Austin Gender and Sexuality Center Affiliate Program and organizes social, advocacy, and educational events throughout the semester.

title: Private Equity and Venture Capital Club

fullDescription: The Private Equity and Venture Capital Club will meet with professionals in PE/VC for breakfast or coffee to network and learn about their lines of work. The club would have meetings no more than once every two weeks to stay updated on upcoming breakfasts and other events. Later down the line, the club will host larger scale guest speaker events with a panel of professionals in PE/VC. We aim to network with the Austin PE/VC community and build our knowledge/skills.

fullDescription: Texas PRSSA – Dr. Alan Scott Chapter is one of the largest chapters in the nation with more than 150 members. The focus of our chapter is to provide an out-of-the-classroom experience that gives students, regardless of their major, an enhanced knowledge of the public relations field. descriptionSnippet: Punjabbawockeez is the first all-male fusion team at The University of Texas at Austin, combining traditional Bhangra with modern hip-hop and some additional surprises! We hope to promote bromances and captivate audiences for many years to come!
fullDescription: Punjabbawockeez is the first all-male fusion team at The University of Texas at Austin, combining traditional Bhangra with modern hip-hop and some additional surprises! Punjabbawockeez, or PJW, consists of extremely passionate, goofy, and handsome dancers whose common goal is having fun on and off stage. Each member of PJW brings something unique to the table. Making their debut in the Fall of 2010 at Jhalak, this band of brothers has changed the South Asian dance scene at UT. Punjabbawockeez stays heavily involved outside talent shows by facilitating unity in the South Asian dance community, participating in community service, and holding mixers with other dance teams and organizations. Punjabbawockeez hopes to score dates, promote bromances, and captivate audiences for many years to come.

title: Q++
descriptionSnippet: Q++ is an organization that aims to empower and provide support for students that identify as LGBTQIA+ in computer science and technology through academic, professional, and social events.

title: Quantitative Market Intelligence
descriptionSnippet: By giving all students the opportunity to develop highly sought-after technical skills, create proprietary datasets, and develop quantitative trading strategies, QMI empowers its members to become quantitatively intelligent investors.
fullDescription: In 2019, our founders, Catherine Cheng and Eric Sun, sought to create an interactive space for students to integrate computer science and data science skills with a traditional finance education. Quantitative Market Intelligence (QMI) was created to make applied data science education open and available to all students who wished to learn how to create, analyze, visualize, and utilize financially relevant datasets. By giving all students the opportunity to develop highly-sought after technical skills, create proprietary datasets, and develop quantitative trading strategies, QMI empowers its members to become quantitatively intelligent investors and business leaders.

title: Queer & Trans People of Color Agency
descriptionSnippet: To contribute to the self empowerment of Queer & Trans People of Color, their communities and allies....
fullDescription: To contribute to the self-empowerment of queer people of color, their communities, and allies. We are housed in the Multicultural Engagement Center (MEC) located in the Student Activity Center (SAC 1.102).  We host bi-weekly community meetings and would love for all QTPOC and Allies to join us!

title: Queer and Asian
descriptionSnippet: A space for Queer and Asian identified individuals to express concerns and show representation on campus.
fullDescription: Queer and Asian is intended to provide a safe environment for queer Asian and Pacific Islander individuals. By organizing biweekly meetings, Q&A has created an opportunity for these individuals to network, learn, motivate, and ultimately to form friendships with each other.

title: Queer Book Club
descriptionSnippet: A discussion group for ANYONE interested in reading, studying, and talking about queer literature. Meets twice a month, completing one book a month.
fullDescription: This is a group of people interested in reading & dissecting queer literature - which will include authors and subject matter surrounding all LGBTQ+ identities. We will meet twice a month, aiming to complete a book per month. Please join the Groupme to stay updated on meeting dates and reading materials!

title: Radio-Television-Film Department
descriptionSnippet: One of the top most desired majors at UT, RTF is one of a handful of film programs in the country that's ranked in the top ten in both film production and in the academic study of media.

title: Ratio Christi - Austin Chapter
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of Ratio Christi is to present an apologetic, or defense, of the Christian faith.
fullDescription: Our goal is to show everyone the intellectual reasons for the Christian faith, giving sound reasons, logic, and a solid, biblical worldview of Christianity. Our meetings will include dialogues/discussions of various objections, arguments, and issues to the Christian faith and seek to understand how one can hold a Christian worldview without compromising one's intellectual background. We will go onto campus and engage in dialogue with students and faculty alike why the Christian worldview is the most sound and reasonable one a person can hold.

title: Re-sonate
descriptionSnippet: Re-sonate promotes and supports women pursuing careers in the tech industry. This is accomplished through peer-led discussions and skill development workshops.
fullDescription: Re-sonate promotes and supports women pursuing careers in the tech industry. This is accomplished through peer-led discussions and skill development workshops.

title: Re:Sound A Cappella
descriptionSnippet: Re:Sound A Cappella is a Christian a cappella group whose vision is to worship God and make Him known through serving others and sharing music.

title: Recreational Sports
descriptionSnippet: Serving the campus community since 1916, Recreational Sports promotes physical fitness, healthy habits, and balanced behaviors through an array of recreation facilities, programs, services, special events, and student employment opportunities.

title: Redefined Dance Company
descriptionSnippet: To increase interest in hip hop choreography, provide a fun and active recreational hip hop dance outlet, and improve dance skills....
fullDescription: To increase interest in hip hop choreography, provide a fun and active recreational hip hop dance outlet, and improve dance skills.

title: Reformed University Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: RUF stands for Reformed University Fellowship and is the campus ministry of the Presbyterian Church in America. As a Christian ministry at UT, we strive to reach students with the good news of Jesus. We also want to equip our students to serve others.
fullDescription: RUF stands for Reformed University Fellowship and is the campus ministry of the Presbyterian Church in America. As a Christian ministry at UT, we strive to reach students with the good news of Jesus. We also want to equip our students to serve others.

title: Religious Studies Student Association
descriptionSnippet: RSSA is an academic and social student organization seeking to thoughtfully engage students in discussing religion through non-theological lenses. We also go on religious site visits and host professor speakers. All majors and ideological views welcomed!

title: Research Student Advisory Council
descriptionSnippet: The Research Student Advisory Council is dedicated to improving the undergraduate research experience. Specifically, RSAC advises the Office of Undergraduate Research and communicates the needs of UT's student researchers while executing new initiatives.
fullDescription: The Research Student Advisory Council is dedicated to improving the undergraduate research experience. Specifically, RSAC advises the Office of Undergraduate Research and communicates the needs of UT's student researchers. Members of RSAC meet twice a month to discuss innovative avenues and opportunities for student research. We also facilitate independent member projects including outreach initiatives and event planning. As a result, RSAC has many leadership opportunities available for motivated members.

title: Resident Assistant Association
descriptionSnippet: The Resident Assistant Association is dedicated to improving the job of resident assistants at UT by supporting all RA's through Programs, Financial sponsorship and the advancement of benefits for all RAs. RAA Communicates with the DHFS Administration ...
fullDescription: The Resident Assistant Association is dedicated to improving the job of resident assistants at UT by supporting all RA's through Programs, financial sponsorship and the advancement of benefits for all RAs. RAA Communicates with the DHFS Administration and University Officials about RA issues.

title: Rho Chi Pharmaceutical Honor Society
descriptionSnippet: National Honor Society in Pharmacy. Its official purpose is to promote scholarship, friendship, and to recognize high attainments in the Pharmaceutical Sciences.
fullDescription: National Honor Society in Pharmacy. Its official purpose is to promote scholarship, friendship and to recognize high attainments in the Pharmaceutical Sciences.

title: Rob Boss Society
descriptionSnippet: We follow Bob Ross painting tutorials, provide an environment for anyone to explore their creative capacities, and promote an optimistic outlook on life

title: Roden Leadership Program
descriptionSnippet: To develop leadership that makes a positive impact on the world around them.
fullDescription: To develop leadership that make a positive impact o the world around them. To achieve this, the Roden Leadership Program commits to: 1.) Develop the skills necessary to address real world problems; 2.) Stimulate creativity and new perspectives to promote innovative contributions to society; 3.) Provide experiences and resources that will enable scholars to initiate and drive changes; 4.) Emphasize the importance of promoting leadeship in others; and 5.) Ensure that Roden Scholars place integrity at the forefront of all their actions.

title: Ronald E. McNair Scholars Program
descriptionSnippet: The Ronald E. McNair Post-baccalaureate Achievement Program recognizes that the diversity of researchers is an integral component of scholastic excellence. It seeks to produce a new generation of scholars and researchers that will more accurately reflect
fullDescription: The Ronald E. McNair Post-baccalaureate Achievement Program recognizes that the diversity of researchers is an integral component of scholastic excellence. It seeks to produce a new generation of scholars and researchers that will more accurately reflect the growing diversity in intellectual perspectives, life experiences, and cultures represented in academia.

title: Round About Players
descriptionSnippet: Our mission is to cultivate, enrich, and support all undergraduate students interested in theatre by producing and devising work that is engaging, exhilarating, and daring.
fullDescription: Our mission is to cultivate, enrich, and support undergraduate students interested in theatre by producing and devising work that is engaging, exhilarating, and daring, and providing resources that will refine and improve their artistic skills.

title: Roustabouts Dance Company
descriptionSnippet: To provide entertainment to the UT community through high energy hip hop and stylized jazz performances. To share our passion for dance with the UT community.
fullDescription: To provide entertainment to the UT community through high energy hip hop and stylized jazz performances. To share our passion for dance with the UT community.

title: S.M.I.L.E. (Students Making Impacts Through Love & Empathy)
descriptionSnippet: S.M.I.L.E. is dedicated in volunteering with children throughout the Austin area! We volunteer at Dell Children's Medical Center and the Austin State Hospital! Our main focus is hosting Brave the Shave every spring semester!
fullDescription: S.M.I.L.E's mission is to provide the resources and opportunities for students, faculty, and staff to participate in community outreach to benefit the Austin community. We want to make it easy for members to help out in the community and meet students with similar interests. S.M.I.L.E. volunteers at a number of places! S.M.I.L.E. also hosts Brave the Shave where individuals shave their heads in solidarity of children fighting cancer, in which all money fundraised is donated to the St.Baldricks Foundation.

title: Saaya Dance Company
descriptionSnippet: Premiere Co-Ed Fusion Dance team!
fullDescription:
We are Saaya! UT's premiere co-ed fusion dance team! We have been combining Bollywood, Bhangra, Classical, Contemporary & Hip-Hop since 2008, with plans to add even more styles of dance this upcoming year! 

Saaya is just coming back from one of our most successful seasons yet, and we are so excited to get started on our 2019-2020 season!

title: Safety Education Program
descriptionSnippet: In order to continue to create a safer UT Community, all registered & sponsored student organizations complete the Safety Education Program annually. Safety Education connects student organizations to risk management, prevention, and emergency resources.
fullDescription: In order to continue to create a safer UT Community, all registered and sponsored student organizations complete the Safety Education Program annually. Safety Education connects student organizations to prevention resources, by engaging with bystander intervention and risk reduction practices, in order to shift the campus culture.

title: San Antonio Student Pharmacists Association
descriptionSnippet: Promote the profession of pharmacy to the San Antonio community and University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio (UTHSCSA). Also, to provide a channel of communication for the University of Texas College of Pharmacy students between campuses.
fullDescription: Promote the profession of pharmacy to the San Antonio community and University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio (UTHSCSA). Also, to provide a channel of communication for the University of Texas College of Pharmacy students between San Antonio and other affiliated campuses.

title: San Jacinto Residence Hall Council
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of our council is to represent the residents living in San Jacinto Residence Hall. We will strive to build a community within the hall through sponsoring various programs and events that reflect the interests of the residents. Our council w...
fullDescription: The purpose of our council is to represent the residents living in San Jacinto Residence Hall. We will strive to build a community within the hall through sponsoring various programs and events that reflect the interests of the residents. Our council will ensure San Jacinto remains a great place to live on campus. The council will continue to work closely with the University Residence Hall Association (URHA), the Division of Housing and Food Service (DHFS), and the University of Texas at Austin.

title: Sanger Learning Center
descriptionSnippet: Every student has a home at the Sanger Learning Center. We provide academic support for all majors on the University of Texas at Austin campus.
fullDescription: Sanger Learning Center is UT Austin’s main resource for academic support. Each year, we help more than 20,000 students achieve their academic potential.

title: School of Human Ecology
descriptionSnippet: We are human development and family sciences, nutritional sciences and textiles and apparel. We are science based and human focused.
fullDescription: We seek to improve the quality of life for all people through research and education on basic and enduring human experiences across time, place and life circumstances. We are particularly interested in: the foods we eat, the relationships we nurture and the textiles that protect and clothe us.

title: School of Human Ecology Ambassadors
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the organization is to promote a sense of community within the School of Human Ecology and act as a liaison between the students and the faculty at the school.
fullDescription:
Mission Statement 
To serve the School of Human Ecology by building community within the student population and supporting the school’s outreach efforts. We provide a voice for the students by acting as liaisons between faculty and the student population . Ambassadors provide leadership and engagement opportunities for the Human Ecology students.

title: SciCo USA
descriptionSnippet: SciCo USA is an organization that aims to deliver hands-on STEM education to students facing significant academic needs and promotes the development and use of scientific methods at an early age.
fullDescription:
SciCo USA, Science Communication, is an organization modeled after a European non-profit whose aim is to communicate scientific issues to the public via innovative and entertaining means. The organization consists of scientists, students, educators, artists and people with an interest in everyday science. 

SciCo USA aims to deliver hands-on STEM education to students and promote the development and use of scientific methods at an early age. This project is founded on the belief that all students have creative abilities that can be developed further to transform students from knowledge consumers to knowledge creators.

title: Science Under the Stars
descriptionSnippet: Science under the stars is a graduate student run public lecture series that showcases graduate student research. Events start at dusk outdoors at Brackenridge Field Laboratory on the second Thursday of every month.
fullDescription: Science Under the Stars is a free, monthly public outreach lecture series founded and organized by graduate students in the Section of Integrative Biology at University of Texas at Austin. Since 2009 we have hosted over 30 speakers at our public events!

title: Science Undergraduate Research Group
descriptionSnippet: With so many interesting subjects, it can be difficult for an undergraduate student to decide on a research path they enjoy. Our goal is to encourage undergraduate students to discover their research interests.
fullDescription: We hold weekly meetings with guest faculty speakers from a variety of scientific fields, organize the Roads to Research and Science Undergraduate Research Forum events, and socials!

title: SCORE Athletics
descriptionSnippet: UT SCORE Athletics is an affiliated student organization with SCORE Athletics, an established 501(c)(3) non-profit based in the Austin area that provides kids with the opportunity to play team sports in a safe, competitive environment.
fullDescription: The Problem

title: Secular Student Alliance Austin, Texas Chapter
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to foster a community of non-theist students who are committed to reason, critical inquiry into any topic, secular human-based ethics, and the separation of church and state.
fullDescription: Atheists, skeptics, humanists and other freethinking students of the University of Texas at Austin. We meet every Wednesday 5:30-6:30 pm in WAG 208!

title: Senate of College Councils
descriptionSnippet: To serve as the official voice of students in academic affairs through representation by the College Councils.
fullDescription: To serve as the official voice of students in academic affairs through representation by the College Councils. The members of Senate value the opportunities the University of Texas at Austin has to offer, and strives to make them publicized, expanded, and improved for the students on the 40 acres. Senate deals with issues like plus/minus grading, teacher evaluations, study abroad, core curriculum streams, advising, and tuition regulation, all on a hands-on level.

title: Services for Students with Disabilities
descriptionSnippet: Services for Students with Disabilities is part of the Division of Diversity and Community Engagement and helps determine eligibility and implement reasonable accommodations for students with disabilities at the University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: Services for Students with Disabilities helps determine eligibility and implement reasonable accommodations for students with disabilities at the University of Texas at Austin.

title: Seva Charities
descriptionSnippet: Seva Charities finds non-profit organizations/charities whose values and missions line up with ours and put on events to raise money for these causes, both local and global here at UT.
fullDescription: Seva Charities is an organization started by a group of passionate and driven students at The University of Texas at Austin. It was created to make a large impact not only in the local Austin community, but also throughout the world. We find charities whose values and missions line up with ours and put on events to raise money for these causes, both local and global. We strive to create tangible, sustainable change in this world also through volunteering in our local Austin community. We truly do believe in the power of giving and that college students, if passionate enough, can make a difference!

title: She's the First at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: She's the First at The University of Texas at Austin is the campus chapter of the international non-profit, She's the First. We support girls who will be the first in their families to graduate from high school and train students to be global citizens.

title: SHOUT - Shakespeare Outreach
descriptionSnippet: To support the Shakespeare at Winedale Outreach to schools program in the Department of English, through workshops and scene performance
fullDescription: To support the Shakespeare at Winedale Outreach to schools program in the Department of English, through workshops and scene performance.

title: Sigma Alpha Iota International Music Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: Sigma Alpha Iota is an international fraternity which promotes interaction among those who share a commitment to and love for music. Members of SAI are active in all areas of campus music and campus life.
fullDescription:
SAI is an organization which promotes interaction among those who share a commitment to music. Members of SAI are active in all areas of campus music and campus life, working closely with faculty, administration, campus and community groups, music professionals and patrons. 

The purpose of Sigma Alpha Iota is

title: Sigma Alpha Lambda at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: Sigma Alpha Lambda is a National Leadership & Honors Organization dedicated to developing the individual & serving our campus & community. We promote & reward academic excellence & unite members in the pursuit of a common goal through service, mentoring,
fullDescription: Sigma Alpha Lambda is a National Leadership and Honors Organization dedicated to developing the individual and serving our campus and community. We promote and reward academic excellence and unite members in the pursuit of a common goal through service, mentoring and personal development.

title: Sigma Alpha Mu Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: One of the largest fraternities at UT, Sigma Alpha Mu prides itself on its academics, brotherhood, philanthropy, and social events. We had the #1 GPA at UT during the Fall of 2018, as well as raised the most money in IFC's annual Movember campaign.
fullDescription: One of the largest fraternities at UT, Sigma Alpha Mu prides itself on its academics, brotherhood, philanthropy, and social events. We had the #1 GPA at UT during the Fall of 2018, as well as raised the most money in IFC's annual Movember campaign.

descriptionSnippet: The purpose of this fraternity shall be to cultivate and maintain the high ideals of friendship, justice and learning upon which Sigma Chi was founded....
fullDescription: The purpose of this fraternity shall be to cultivate and maintain the high ideals of friendship, justice and learning upon which Sigma Chi was founded.

title: Sigma Delta Lambda Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Sigma Delta Lambda-Beta Chapter is a multicultural service and social organization designed to help through tutoring and mentoring the youth of the Austin community. We're also committed to uniting Latinas on the UT campus and building lifelong contacts.
fullDescription: Sigma Delta Lambda-Beta Chapter is a multicultural service and social organization designed to help, through tutoring and mentoring, the youth of the Austin community. While we are committed to helping students in the Austin area, we are also committed to uniting Latinas on the UT campus, and building contacts that will last a lifetime.

title: Sigma Delta Tau
descriptionSnippet: It shall be the purpose of this fraternal organization to form a close social and fraternal union of those of similar ideals and to foster, maintain, and instill such ideals in the hearts of its members as well as result in actions worthy of the highes...
fullDescription: It shall be the purpose of this fraternal organization to form a close social and fraternal union of those of similar ideals and to foster, maintain, and instill such ideals in the hearts of its members as well as result in actions worthy of the highest precepts of true womanhood, democracy and humanity.

title: Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority Inc. Mu Upsilon
descriptionSnippet: To enhance the quality of life for women and their families through community service, civil and social action. Our goal is to achieve greater progress in the areas of education, health awareness,& leadership development.
fullDescription: It is the mission of Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc. to enhance the quality of life for women and their families in the U.S. and globally through community service, civil, and social action. Our goal is to achieve greater progress in the areas of education, health awareness, and leadership development.Our members, affiliates, staff and community partners work to create and support initiatives that align with our vision.

title: Sigma Gamma Tau - Aerospace Engineering
descriptionSnippet: Sigma Gamma Tau Society is established to recognize and honor those individuals in the field of aeronautics who have, through scholarship, integrity, and outstanding achievement, been a credit to their profession.
fullDescription: Sigma Gamma Tau Society is established to recognize and honor those individuals in the field of aeronautics who have, through scholarship, integrity, and outstanding achievement, been a credit to their profession. The society seeks to foster a high standard of ethics and professional practices and to create a spirit of loyalty and fellowship particularly among students of aeronautical engineering.

title: Sigma Lambda Alpha Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: Sigma Lambda Alpha is an organization built on service, academics, loyalty, culture, and sisterhood. We are dedicated to excelling the Latinx community not only at the University of Texas at Austin, but our society as whole.
fullDescription: The mission of Sigma Lambda Alpha Sorority, Inc. is to promote the importance of community service involvement and academic achievement as well as to educate and excel the stance of Latinx cultures in this diversely enriched campus.

title: Sigma Lambda Gamma National Sorority
descriptionSnippet: Sigma Lambda Gamma, historically a Latina based sorority, shall be primarily one of promoting standards of excellence in morality, ethics and education.
fullDescription: The purpose of Sigma Lambda Gamma, historically a Latina based sorority, shall be primarily one of promoting standards of excellence in morality, ethics and education. Further, the sorority shall work to better serve the needs and wants of all people by disseminating information about the diverse culture which we all share. Finally, the sorority shall maintain respect for the views of others through this valuing, thereby, enhancing our understanding of one another, and thus bettering our community, our country, and the world.

title: Sigma Phi Epsilon Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: 1) Uphold, develop and strengthen the character of its members; 2) in- culate those principles which naturally revolve upon an individual as a member of society; 3) impress upon its members the true significance of fraternal relationships; 4) aid and s...
fullDescription: 1) Uphold, develop and strengthen the character of its members; 2) in- culate those principles which naturally revolve upon an individual as a member of society; 3) impress upon its members the true significance of fraternal relationships; 4) aid and sustain, as far as possible the government and discipline of the institution where it is located; 5) promote scholarship, athletic excellence and social compatibility.

title: Sigma Phi Lambda
descriptionSnippet: We are a Christian sorority focused on faith, fellowship, and fun with the purpose of glorifying God and making His name great. Our activities include prayer nights, date events, community outreach, and retreats. Join Phi Lamb and find your best friends!
fullDescription: Sigma Phi Lambda (Phi Lamb) is a Christian sorority that centers on faith, fellowship, and fun with the purpose of glorifying God and making His name great. Through weekly meetings, prayer groups, sisterhood events, date events, and chapter-wide retreats, we provide opportunities to connect and grow within a supportive community. Join Phi Lamb and find, not only your best friends, but your sisters. Sigma Phi Lambda is not presently, nor will it ever be Panhellenic.

title: Sigma Phi Omega Sorority, Inc.
descriptionSnippet: We are the oldest Asian-interest sorority at the University of Texas at Austin and have helped many young women transition to college life. Our primary goal as a sorority is to promote sisterhood and everlasting relationships.
fullDescription: We are the oldest Asian-interest sorority at the University of Texas at Austin and have helped many young women transition to college life. Our primary goal as a sorority is to promote sisterhood and everlasting relationships.

descriptionSnippet: To promote the values and to spread awareness of Sikhism through events involving the university community and the Austin community.
fullDescription: To promote the values and to spread awareness of Sikhism through events involving the university community and the Austin community.

title: Silk Club
descriptionSnippet: Silk Club is an Austin-based organization for self-identified Asian womxn/non-binary folks/ femmes+ to collaborate on creative projects that celebrate our experience.
fullDescription: Silk Club is an organization for Austin-based self-identified Asian American womxn/non-binary folks/femmes+ to collaborate on projects that celebrate our experience. It is a space committed to validating and empowering intersectional identities, building creative opportunities, and fostering connections between different Asian communities.

title: Silver Spurs
descriptionSnippet: A tradition of unselfish devotion to life at this Univ. By becoming a Silver Spur one will be assuming a consciousness and a responsibility to share with us in making our school, as its founding fathers hoped, genuinely of the first class. We are an ho...
fullDescription: A tradition of unselfish devotion to life at this Univ. By becoming a Silver Spur one will be assuming a consciousness and a responsibility to share with us in making our school, as its founding fathers hoped, genuinely of the first class. We are an honorary service organization which helps manifest the fellowship, service and purpose implicit in our University. We care for Bevo, the Longhorn mascot, and support all Longhorn activities both academically and athletically.

title: Sky @ UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Art of Living is to bring the benefits of the Art of Living workshops to UT students and faculty. The club aims to offer workshops in yoga, meditation, and special breathing techniques to relieve stress, improve quality of life, and ...
fullDescription: The purpose of the Sky @ UT Austin is to bring the benefits of the Art of Living workshops to UT students and faculty. The club aims to offer workshops in yoga, meditation, and special breathing techniques to relieve stress, improve quality of life, and foster a stress-free, violence-free campus.

title: SNAFU Improv
descriptionSnippet: SNAFU Improv is UT's ONLY long-form improvised comedy troupe. We create never before seen, never before practiced, and completely made up on the spot shows based on audience suggestions!
fullDescription: SNAFU Improv is UT's ONLY long-form improvised comedy troupe. We create never before seen, never before practiced, and completely made up on the spot shows based on audience suggestions! Follow us on Facebook at Snafu Improv, and on Instagram @snafu_prov
