descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the SOC General Interest Group is to promote knowledge sharing among Student Organization Center (SOC) staff. Can this edit appear without Admin viewing it?
fullDescription: The purpose of the SOC General Interest Group is to promote knowledge sharing among Student Organization Center (SOC) staff.  Can this edit appear without Admin viewing it?

title: Social Anime Club
descriptionSnippet: A social club at UT. Let's eat food, talk about/watch anime and get caught up in wacky shenanigans.
fullDescription: A social Anime Club where we have lots of fun outings. We have a weekly meeting where discuss anime, play games, go out for dinner and try to expand our social circles.

title: Society of American Archivists
descriptionSnippet: To serve as a means of introducing and integrating new archivists into the profession; to enhance the educational function of the Society by providing focus for students to discuss archival issues, identify with profession and engage in professional ac...
fullDescription: To serve as a means of introducing and integrating new archivists into the profession; to enhance the educational function of the Society by providing focus for students to discuss archival issues, identify with profession and engage in professional activities to promote communia tion among student members; to develop the leaders of tommorrow's archival profession; and to attract new members into the Society of American Archivists.

title: Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to prepare Asian heritage scientists and engineers for success in the global business world, to celebrate diversity and participate socially on campus, and to provide opportunities for members to make contributions to their local community
fullDescription: Our purpose is to prepare Asian heritage scientists and engineers for success in the global business world, to celebrate diversity and participate socially on campus, and to provide opportunities for members to make contributions to their local communities. At core, we are an equally social and professional organization for students to be involved on campus. Our chapter website is here, and please join our Facebook group (https://www.facebook.com/groups/sasetexas/) as we post announcements for all our meetings and events there! Email us at sasetexas@gmail.com to receive our newsletters!

title: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers
descriptionSnippet: To encourage recruitment, retention and advancement of Hispanic engineers in education and employment. Promote career awareness, self-esteem, and pride within the community....
fullDescription: Mission: SHPE changes lives by empowering the Hispanic community to realize its fullest potential and to impact the world through STEM awareness, access, support and development.

title: Society of Petroleum Engineers
descriptionSnippet: Support petroleum engineering professionalism and learning, to aid the Hildebrand Department of Petroleum and Geosystems Engineering, and to encourage student interaction between peers and members of the oil and gas industry.
fullDescription: SPE at UT is an organization committed to helping students learn more about the energy industry. We offer students the opportunity to network with company representatives, other students, and UT faculty and staff. We host various events through out the school year including general meetings, tailgates, and community service events. Please contact us or visit us online to learn more!

title: Society of Petroleum Resources Economists at UT-Austin
descriptionSnippet: This is the student chapter of The Society of Petroleum Resources Economists at the University of Texas at Austin. Our main focus is on the economic, financial and financial markets side of the Oil and Gas industry (Petroleum Economics).
fullDescription: This is the student chapter of The Society of Petroleum Resources Economists, which is specifically dedicated to the business side of the Oil and Gas industry. SPRE at UT-Austin aims to spread the knowledge within the UT Austin community and introduce students to the petroleum economics side of the oil and gas industry, which provides a link between the oil and gas exploration and production, reserves assessment and valuation, risk analysis, oil and gas finance, and Financial Markets.

title: Society of Physics Students
descriptionSnippet: Local chapter of the national Society of Physics Students. See our website at www.ph.utexas.edu/~sps and Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/groups/TexasSPS/ for more and sign up at utlists.utexas.edu/sympa/info/sps for email alerts!
fullDescription: Local chapter of the national Society of Physics Students. See our website at www.ph.utexas.edu/~sps for more and sign up at utlists.utexas.edu/sympa/info/sps for email alerts!

title: Society of Plan II Engineers
descriptionSnippet: To promote the interests of students of the Plan II/Engineering dual degree plan. This support is intended to further the academic and professional opportunities available to its members.
fullDescription: To promote the interests of students of the Plan II/Engineering dual degree plan. The organization aims to further the academic and professional opportunities available to its members.

title: Society of Plastics Engineers at the University of Texas
descriptionSnippet: Society of Plastics Engineers at the University of Texas is the first student chapter at UT to represent the largest global network of plastics professionals representing 84 countries and 22,500+ members.
fullDescription: Society of Plastics Engineers at the University of Texas is the first student chapter at UT to represent the largest global network of plastics professionals representing 84 countries and 22,500+ members. PETX aims to enhance the academic and professional careers of students interested in the plastics/polymer industry. We promote scientific and engineering knowledge relating to plastics and polymers. We invite professionals for a bimonthly seminar series so students can gain perspective about the challenges, opportunities, and career paths in the plastics industry. We also organize industrial tours and attend the annual SPE plastics conference. One of our core tenets is sustainability and as such, we are the first plastics community in Austin with a large international network of industry/academic professionals engaged in sustainable plastic use. Our goal is to engage dialogue between industry practitioners, professors, and students to shape the future of global sustainable plastics production from an industrial standpoint.

title: Society of Professional Mediators
descriptionSnippet: The Society of Professional Mediators - Provides the opportunity for trained mediators and those in training to discuss professional issues, share experiences, and promote mediation as a resource for conflict resolution.
fullDescription: To provide the opportunity for trained mediators and those in training to discuss professional issues, share experiences, and promote mediation as a resource for Dispute Resolution.

title: Society of Women Engineers
descriptionSnippet: To strengthen and empower women engineering students by: * creating a sense of identity and community, * providing resources for women engineers, *encouraging females to engage in opportunities and * enhancing leadership and professional skills

title: Socks for the Sole
descriptionSnippet: An all student led non-profit with the goal of providing socks and articles of clothing to the homeless, through fundraising and promoting awareness of homelessness.
fullDescription: Socks for the Sole is a student-led nonprofit organization aimed at providing new pairs of socks to the homeless of Austin. By doing so, we will raise awareness about the struggles faced by people who suffer from homelessness within our own community, and work through fundraising and service events to have an impact on their lives.

title: Son Vision
descriptionSnippet: Son Vision is an organization that exists to enable students to see Jesus for themselves and experience His tangible love in their lives. We do this through hosting weekly events such as praise parties, worship nights and social events.
fullDescription: Son Vision is an organization for people to see the vision of the son of God. It is intended to provide opportunities for students to grow in their Christian faith, find out more about the Christian faith and discover their purpose in life. The Vision is intended to create constant atmospheres for students to have fun in a safe environment. We do this through providing weekly social events for students to find community and have fun. We also provide weekly spiritual gatherings for students to express their faith with God and with each other.  Son Vision seeks to empower students become role models and grow in spiritual leadership, theology, knowledge and experience. Son Vision provides mentorship for students to reach their educational, physical, social and spiritual goals. The mission is to allow students to have fun, grow in faith and have fellowship with one another.

title: Sorority and Fraternity Life
descriptionSnippet: Sorority and Fraternity Life within the Office of the Dean of Students provides programs, services and support to the 6000+ members of UT Austin's Sorority and Fraternity Community.
fullDescription: The mission of Sorority and Fraternity Life is to develop students, both as individuals and within organizations, through diverse involvement opportunities, educational experiences, and academic initiatives in order to be socially responsible and ethical leaders in a global community.

title: Soul Blend: The UniverSOUL Sound
descriptionSnippet: Noteworthy is a co-ed A Cappella group at The University of Texas at Austin founded in 2014. Since their evolution in 2017, Noteworthy has strived towards a modern sound emphasizing a more complex take on popular music.
fullDescription: Noteworthy is a co-ed A Cappella group at The University of Texas at Austin founded in 2014. When the group first formed under the name Soul Blend A Cappella, they remained as a local group performing within The University of Texas. Since their evolution in 2017, Noteworthy has strived towards a modern sound emphasizing a more complex take on popular music. Noteworthy continues to exemplify diversity and inclusion in both membership and song selections.

title: Spark
descriptionSnippet: Spark’s student organization is designed to help improve the college experience of students who have experienced foster care. Students will have a chance to develop personal and interpersonal skills through engagement with students and the community
fullDescription: Spark’s student organization is designed to help improve the college experience of students who have experienced foster care. Spark is intended to increase networking and success rates for former foster youth. We hope to build character and leadership in our members so that they shall become passionate and empathetic members of their communities. The Spark student organization provides former foster youth a chance to have a safe community at UT Austin. The group is lead by students for students with the support of the Spark program, it is what we make it!

title: Spark Magazine
descriptionSnippet: Student-run fashion publication | www.sparkmagazinetx.com

title: Spitshine Poetry
descriptionSnippet: We want to create a community of writers who use poetry to better themselves and others....
fullDescription: We want to create a community of writers who use poetry to better themselves and others. We see poetry as a tool that empowers the individual. Everyone has a story, and at Spitshine, we aim to find those stories by giving voices to those who have been silenced and providing a stage (literally and figuratively) for them to spit.

title: Sports Medicine Club at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: The Sports Medicine Club at The University of Texas is a group that was founded in Spring 2018. Our club mission is to help students explore opportunities in the field of sports medicine. We are open to all interested parties.
fullDescription: The Sports Medicine Club at the University of Texas at Austin is a group founded in Spring 2018. We strive to provide volunteer, internship, and shadowing opportunities in the Austin healthcare community. Additionally, we are committed to increasing experience in the sports medicine field by participating in intramurals and community athletic events.

title: STEEL Dance Company
descriptionSnippet: Steel Dance Company's main goal is to offer an opportunity to those who desire to perform and share their love for dance.

title: Strings' N Things Club
descriptionSnippet: Strings' N Things Club is a knitting, crochet, and crafting group dedicated to creating an open and welcoming space for all kinds of people to come together and create. The organization welcomes all ability levels and encourages learning and growth.

title: Student Activities
descriptionSnippet: Student Activities in the Office of the Dean of Students provides services to support to the over 1,200 registered student organizations on campus.
fullDescription: Student Activities in the Office of the Dean of Students provides several services to support to the over 1,200 registered student organizations on campus. Student Activities offers many services to student organizations, providing information through its publications, training through its workshops, one-on-one consultations and event planning support.

title: Student Association for the School of Information
descriptionSnippet: SASI is the official council for the School of Information. We strive to promote a sense of community within the iSchool and foster the ideas of professionalism and leadership. SASI is the primary link between School of Information Students and the adm...
fullDescription: SASI is the official council for the School of Information. We strive to promote a sense of community within the iSchool and foster the ideas of professionalism and leadership. SASI is the primary link between School of Information Students and the administration of the school and the university.

title: Student Bar Association
descriptionSnippet: The student body of the law school is organized as a Student Bar Association, the membership of which includes all students in the school. The Board of Governors is in charge of the association and acts as the student government of the law school.
fullDescription: The student body of the law school is organized as a Student Bar Association, the membership of which includes all students in the school. The officers of the association are the president, vice president of operations, vice president of programming, vice president of communications, financial director, and Board of Governors. The organization coordinates the intellectual, cultural, social, and community service activities of the student body. Its goals are to unify the students and direct them toward worthy ends and to enhance cooperation and understanding among students.

title: Student Chapter of the Society of Petrophysicists and Well Log Analysts at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: The Student Chapter of SPWLA at UT Austin is dedicated to advancing the science of petrophysics and formation evaluation among students and young professionals at The University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: The Student Chapter of SPWLA at UT Austin is dedicated to advancing the science of petrophysics and formation evaluation among students and young professionals at The University of Texas at Austin. The chapter host monthly technical seminars that are presented by industry leading petrophysicists, formation evaluation specialists, and petroleum engineers. The chapter also hosts an annual student paper contest where winners are invited to present their work at the SPWLA Annual Symposium. The Student Chapter of SPWLA at UT Austin is an officially recognized student chapter of the Society of Petrophysicists and Well Log Analysts.

title: Student College of Clinical Pharmacy at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: A student chapter of the American College of Clinical Pharmacy (ACCP) that orients students to the practice of clinical pharmacy by providing opportunities in research, information on careers, and skill development in clinical practice.
fullDescription: The American College of Clinical Pharmacy (ACCP) is a national pharmacy professional organization that provides leadership, education, advocacy, and resources to enable clinical pharmacists to achieve excellence in practice and research.

title: Student Community of Asian Nurses
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Student Community of Asian Nurses is to provide representation of the Asian nursing community and to provide an environment that promotes learning, discovery, freedom, leadership, individual opportunity, and responsibility.
fullDescription: Student Community of Asian Nurses (SCAN) promotes community and support for those interested in the nursing field. Members are provided a sense of unity and guidance through group discussions and participation in volunteering events. SCAN also aims to promote and preserve asian culture, and raise awareness of how it affects healthcare.

title: Student Conduct Advisory Committee
descriptionSnippet: SCAC provides the peer perspective on matters of student conduct and academic integrity at The University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: SCAC has a three-tiered purpose for supporting the University conduct system's principles: (a) ADVICE by providing input and feedback on issues relating to student conduct and academic integrity to the Office of the Dean of Students - Student Judicial Services; (b) ADVOCACY by providing educational outreach to University students, faculty, and staff; and (c) ADVANCEMENT by exploring new and innovative ways to increase student awareness of and involvement in the University's conduct system.

title: Student Conduct and Academic Integrity
descriptionSnippet: Student Conduct and Academic Integrity is responsible for investigating alleged violations of University rules and for implementing the discipline process.
fullDescription: Student Conduct and Academic Integrity strives to support the educational mission of The University of Texas at Austin by upholding University standards of student conduct and academic integrity through a fair and objective process.

title: Student Consulting Initiative
descriptionSnippet: To link UT students with struggling small businesses around Austin for two purposes: 1) help students find real-world business experience, and 2) serve the community by building better businesses.
fullDescription: To link UT students with struggling small businesses around Austin for two purposes: 1) help students find real-world business experience, and 2) serve the community by building better businesses.

title: Student Council for Exceptional Children
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to advance the education of individuals with disabilities and bring awareness to the inequalities that these individuals face on a daily basis.
fullDescription:
Student Council for Exceptional Children (SCEC) is a student organization at UT Austin that advocates for adults and children with special needs. As a group we promote awareness and inclusion by participating in events dedicated to these individuals, such as Rosedale Ride, Mary Lee Foundation, DSACT Buddy Walk, Growing Roots and many more. 

General meetings are held every other week in the Sanchez Building (SZB) and various volunteer events occur throughout the semester. 

Our organization is open to students in all majors, so come to our next meeting to see what we’ll be up to this year!

title: Student Emergency Services
descriptionSnippet: Student Emergency Services, in the Office of the Dean of Students, works with campus and community organizations to provide a number of services to assist students, and in some cases their families and friends, during an emergency or crisis situation.
fullDescription: Student Emergency Services assists students with different types of emergencies, including student deaths, death of a relative, family emergencies, attempted suicide, student illness/injury, interpersonal violence or stalking, sexual assault,  missing students, apartment or house fire, natural disaster, financial problems, and concerns about academic adjustment or performance.

title: Student Employee Excellence Development Program
descriptionSnippet: If you are a student employed by UT Austin, the SEED Program is for you! SEED offers free, one-hour workshops to help you succeed in your student job and future career. You can learn valuable skills and earn a certification to list on your resume.
fullDescription: SEED is a professional development program for students employed by UT Austin. The program offers free, one-hour workshops on 16 different topics, all designed to help you succeed in your current job and your future career. We also focus on work/life balance. Each workshop is presented twice a semester by an expert from one of the SEED partner orgranizations across campus. Student employees who attend at least 6 workshops and write a short reflection on what they learned can earn a Student Employee Excellence Certification. An Advanced Certification opton is availabe for student employees who attend at least 10 workshops and complete a project that furthers student employee training. The program is open both to undergraduates and graduate students.

title: Student Endowed Centennial Lectureship
descriptionSnippet: SECL is an endowed organization, supported by the $2 student contribution through registration. SECL hosts high-profile speakers and provides an opportunity for their speakers to interact with the university community.
fullDescription: SECL is an endowed organization, supported by the $2 student contribution through registration. SECL hosts high-profile speakers and provides an opportunity for their speakers to interact with the university community.

title: Student Engineering Council
descriptionSnippet: The Student Engineering Council, or SEC, is an organization composed of engineering students whose purpose is to represent students of the Cockrell School of Engineering on campus and in the surrounding communities.
fullDescription: The Student Engineering Council (SEC) is an organization composed of engineering students whose purpose is to represent students of the Cockrell School of Engineering on campus and in the surrounding communities. As the umbrella student organization of the Cockrell School of Engineering, all of our initiatives are aimed at involving the widest demographic of engineering students.

title: Student Engineers Educating Kids
descriptionSnippet: We strive to promote awareness of the engineering field to community youth through tutoring and mentoring while allowing engineering students to pursue philanthropic endeavors and learn more about their future careers.
fullDescription: SEEK is a mentoring program run and led by UT Engineering students, paired with Communities in Schools. UT students lead weekly engineering related projects with several different at-risk middle schools in Austin. SEEK also strives to provide lower-income elementary students the opportunity to explore the idea of higher education and a career path in the STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, & Mathematics) fields. Through SEEK we believe that we can encourage kids to make the right decisions and also inspire them to be the engineers of tomorrow.

title: Student Government
descriptionSnippet: Established in 1902, Student Government is the official voice of students to the UT Administration, the Board of Regents, and the Texas Legislature.

title: Student Government Students with Disabilities Agency
descriptionSnippet: Represents UT students with disabilities in order to raise awareness on issues and working directly with the office of Services for Students with Disabilities to provide better assistance for these students at UT.

title: Student Health Advisory Committee
descriptionSnippet: The Student Health Advisory Committee provides an essential link between University Health Services and the entire UT student body.
fullDescription: Since 1997, the Student Health Advisory Committee (SHAC) has provided an essential link between University Health Services (UHS) and the entire UT student body. We advocate for prevalent student health concerns on campus, design and implement creative initiatives to promote UHS, and actively work to empower the student body on issues regarding their health and wellness.

title: Student Historic Preservation Association
descriptionSnippet: The SHPA is dedicated to the advancement of preservation field ; related areas of study through activities that include volunteering, advocacy, community outreach, extracurricular scholarship and interdisciplinary collaboration.
fullDescription: The SHPA is dedicated to the advancement of the historic preservation field & related areas of study through activities that include volunteering, advocacy, community outreach, extracurricular scholarship, & interdisciplinary collaboration.

title: Student Industry Pharmacists Organization
descriptionSnippet: The Student Industry Pharmacists Organization is a student-centered organization whose mission is to advance the experience of student pharmacists interested in industry careers by promoting knowledge, resources, academic support, and opportunities
fullDescription: The organization is open to all student pharmacists who have an interest in industry pharmacy. Toward our goal of advancing the pursuit of a successful career in industry pharmacy, IPhO at Austin will:

title: Student Mobilization
descriptionSnippet: Student Mobilization is a Christian organization that seeks to help college students develop in their leadership and spiritual lives.
fullDescription: Student Mobilization is a Christian organization that seeks to help college students develop in their leadership and spiritual lives.

title: Student National Pharmaceutical Association
descriptionSnippet: The Student National Pharmaceutical Association is an education and service association of pharmacy students and high school affiliate members, concerned about pharmacy and other health professions.
fullDescription: The Student National Pharmaceutical Association is an education and service association of pharmacy students and high school affiliate members, concerned about pharmacy and other health professions with a focus on minority students and communities. The purpose of SNPhA is to plan, organize, coordinate, and execute programs geared toward improvement of the health, social, and educational environment of the community; while providing opportunities for professional development.

title: Student Pharmacist Recovery Network
descriptionSnippet: To educate our peers and the community to lessen the stigma related to substance use disorders, mental health conditions, co-occurring disorders, and recovery.
fullDescription: The purpose of the Student Pharmacist Recovery Network (SPRN) is to provide resources to help fight the stigma against substance use disorders, mental health conditions, co-occurring disorders, and recovery. It was designed by conscientious students, faculty members, and staff members of the college. SPRN students, faculty, and staff members are able to refer others to the appropriate University and Austin resources that best address their particular needs.

title: Student SafeHorns
descriptionSnippet: Student SafeHorns is intended to improve safety for the University of Texas at Austin students, faculty, staff, and visitors on and around the campus through on-going advocacy, strategic planning, and implementation.
fullDescription: The purpose of the organization shall be to identify safety concerns and needs of the University of Texas at Austin students on and around the campus where students live; create safety alliances with university, city, businesses, housing, and police department leaders; inform members of safety related issues impacting students; and represent and advocate for Student SafeHorns members at local city and university safety related meetings.

title: Student Veteran Center
descriptionSnippet: UT Austin SVC is a lounge and meeting space where student veterans can study, socialize and relax between classes. Equipped with Wi-Fi access, a public computer workstation and a flat screen television, the center offers events and programs for veterans.
fullDescription: UT Austin's Student Veteran Center is a lounge and meeting space where student veterans can study, socialize and relax between classes. Equipped with Wi-Fi access, a public computer workstation and a flat screen television, the center offers events and programs specifically for student veterans. Come visit us on the fourth floor of the Student Services Building (SSB), 4.472.

title: Student Veterans Association
descriptionSnippet: "The SVA is dedicated to creating a culture for veterans on campus to further their social, academic, and professional skills while advocating for their needs."

title: Students Against Cruelty to Animals
descriptionSnippet: Students Against Cruelty to Animals is a student-run animal advocacy organization. SACA educates the community of the ethical, environmental, and health-related consequences of using animals for food, clothing, entertainment and experimentation.
fullDescription: Students Against Cruelty to Animals seeks to educate students and the public through outreach events such as distributing leaflets, showing documentaries, and encouraging individuals to actively investigate all ways in which the human lifestyle causes suffering to animals, as well as the value of all animals as sentient beings rather than as objects or commodities.

title: Students Expanding Austin Literacy
descriptionSnippet: Students Expanding Austin Literacy (SEAL) is a University of Texas student service organization that helps kids dive into reading.
fullDescription: Students Expanding Austin Literacy (SEAL) is a University of Texas student service organization that helps kids dive into reading. SEAL Reading Buddies are matched with their own 1st - 3rd grade student and serve as semester-long mentors, tutors, and play pals. Our goal is simple: to make our kiddos fall in love with us, and in turn, fall in love with reading. If you love kids, enjoy Dr. Suess books, and miss coloring pages and LEGO's, then SEAL is just right for you!

title: Students Fighting Climate Change
descriptionSnippet: Exploring how humans interact with the environment and what we can do to improve our relationship with the Earth through educating people on climate change in an interdisciplinary way and working with organizations to advocate for a sustainable future.

title: Students for Equity and Diversity
descriptionSnippet: We seek to promote awareness and appreciation of self by creating inclusive spaces through interactive workshops, peer facilitated dialogue, and program that focus on social justice issue prevalent in our society. We a sponsored organization of the MEC.
fullDescription: SED was established with the sole purpose of designing and implementing diversity education programs for all students. We seek to promote awareness and appreciation of self and others by creating inclusive spaces through interactive workshops, peer facilitated dialogue, and program that focus on social justice issue prevalent in our society.

title: Students for Juliana
descriptionSnippet: This organization will host events to spread the news of the upcoming Supreme Court case Juliana v. US and rally support for the case itself.

title: Students for Planned Parenthood
descriptionSnippet: Students for Planned Parenthood empowers and rallies students to fight for reproductive freedom.
fullDescription: Students for Planned Parenthood empowers and rallies students to fight for reproductive freedom and other related causes. We exist to educate ourselves and our community about sexual health, intersectionality, and the importance of voter engagement while building coalitions. We connect our members with opportunities to volunteer at Planned Parenthood and opportunities to work on social campaigns.

title: Students for Sensible Drug Policy
descriptionSnippet: Students for Sensible Drug Policy believes the War on Drugs is both ineffective and damaging to our communities. Therefore, we strive to educate the community about drug use and harm reduction and advocate for local and national legislative reform.
fullDescription: Students for Sensible Drug Policy is  concerned about the effects of drug use on our community, but believes the War on Drugs is both ineffective and damaging to our communities. Therefore, we strive to provide objective information regarding substance use in order to facilitate informed, individual decisions. We promote and advocate local legislative reforms within our local community and partner with national and local organizations in order to further our collective efforts to combat the War on Drugs.

title: Students in Medical Laboratory Science
descriptionSnippet: To increase awareness about CLS/MT as a profession. To promote the ideas of scholarship, leadership, service and fellowship. - to provide students the opportunity to realize their academic and leadership potentials, to provide opportunities to particip...
fullDescription: To increase awareness about CLS/MT as a profession. To promote the ideas of scholarship, leadership, service and fellowship. - to provide students the opportunity to realize their academic and leadership potentials, to provide opportunities to participate in community service and fellowship activities in and out of the University. To provide a comfortable environment for students in different disciplines to network and participate within a purposeful organization. To help students in transition.

title: Students Over 25 at UT
descriptionSnippet: According to recent data, The University of Texas undergrads that are over age 25 make up less than 5% of the student population. Older students have felt the gap, but are not alone. This is our community.

title: Students with Texas State Employees Union
descriptionSnippet: We're an organization for students who are members of the Texas State Employees Union, but also for all students who are interested in standing in solidarity with working people!

title: StudentsCare at University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: StudentsCare is an organization that will set up a hospital buddy system between undergraduate students at UT Austin and long-term pediatric patients at Dell Children's hospital. We strive to bring companionship to the patients and their families.

title: Study Abroad
descriptionSnippet: Study abroad changes lives, and the work of Study Abroad at the University of Texas is guided by our commitment to promoting access to study abroad opportunities for our diverse population of students.
fullDescription: Our mission is to provide outreach, service, and support to students considering or committed to studying abroad. We accomplish this by partnering with faculty and staff to facilitate participation through integration into the curriculum, and by continuously seeking ways to improve our own practices to better serve students and the University.  Our vision is that all UT students who are interested in and eligible to study abroad will have the opportunity to do so.

title: Subiendo Longhorn Chapter
descriptionSnippet: To create a network of UT students who participate in Subiendo: The Academy for Rising Leaders. Our organizational pillars are mentorship, service, and professional development.
fullDescription: To create a network of UT students who participate in Subiendo: The Academy for Rising Leaders.

title: Supply Chain Management Student Organization
descriptionSnippet: To promote the supply chain management major and to inform students about the career opportunities in the field.
fullDescription:
SCMSO exists to promote the Supply Chain Management major and to inform students about the career opportunities in the field.
It serves as the premier platform for Supply Chain Management majors and minors to network with one another, learn about the industry, and interact with supply chain professionals from the corporate world.

title: Sustainability Investment Group
descriptionSnippet: The Sustainable Investing Group is an organization dedicated to exploring how investment portfolios and firms can be managed in a way that generates monetary returns while also generating social returns.
fullDescription: The Sustainable Investing Group is an organization dedicated to exploring how investment portfolios and firms can be managed in a way that generates monetary returns while also generating social returns. Through the exploration of Environmental, Social, and Governance factors and their impacts in investing, as well as looking at sustainability techniques from an individual companies standpoint, we will provide a rigorous finance and sustainability curriculum to our members.

title: Symposium about Language and Society, Austin
descriptionSnippet: To provide a forum for student research in language and culture. To plan and facilitate a yearly conference for the presentation of similiar research for faculty and students at UT. We draw presenters from around the country.
fullDescription: To provide a forum for student research in language and culture. To plan and facilitate a yearly conference for the presentation of similiar research for faculty and students at UT. We draw presenters from around the country.

title: Synapse
descriptionSnippet: We aim to cultivate a welcoming space in which students—brought together by a shared appreciation for the brain—find social belonging and academic guidance at a large university. In short, we are about neuroscience and community.
fullDescription: We aim to cultivate a welcoming space in which students—brought together by a shared appreciation for the brain—find social belonging and academic guidance at a large university. In short, we are about neuroscience and community.

title: Taiwanese American Students Association
descriptionSnippet: To provide cultural identity to Taiwanese Americans, Asian Americans, and those interested in Taiwanese culture by offering social, cultural, and philanthropic events....
fullDescription: To provide cultural identity to Taiwanese Americans, Asian Americans, and those interested in Taiwanese culture by offering social, cultural, and philanthropic events.

title: Taiwanese International Student Association
descriptionSnippet: TiSA is a social organization that is dedicated to provide a sense of home and belonging for ethnic Taiwanese and Mandarin speaking students, as well as those interested in Taiwanese culture.
fullDescription: About:

title: Taiwanese Student Association
descriptionSnippet: To promote Taiwanese identity and culture. To promote friendship and cross-cultural dialogues between Taiwanese and Americans. To provide a forum for exchange on cultural, socioeconomic, educational, environmental and political developments in Taiwan.
fullDescription: To promote Taiwanese identity and culture. To promote friendship between Taiwanese and Americans. To provide a forum for exchanging research findings or expertise on cultural, social, economic, educational, environmental and political developments in Taiwan.

title: Take the Wheel Productions
descriptionSnippet: Take the Wheel Productions is a student-run production company that will create, develop and produce original student work for both the stage and screen.
fullDescription: Take the Wheel Productions is a student-run production company that creates, develops, and produces student work for both the stage and screen. Our organization works collaboratively to bring stage and screen projects to life each semester, based off ideas pitched by members. Whether you want to produce an original piece of work, or have dreamed of staging your own production of a beloved show or musical, Take the Wheel Productions can help you realize your goal.

title: Tamil Students Association
descriptionSnippet: The Tamil Students Association promotes the Tamil Language and Tamil Culture by engaging students in educational, recreational and cultural activities that educate about Tamil heritage.
fullDescription: The Tamil Students Association promotes the Tamil Language and Tamil Culture by engaging students in educational, recreational and cultural activities that educate about Tamil heritage. We do a lot of outreach activities and fun events!

title: Tau Beta Pi - Engineering
descriptionSnippet: Tau Beta Pi is an interdisciplinary engineering honor society that recognizes students with distinguished scholarship and exemplary character. Established in 1885, TBP is the second-oldest collegiate honor society.
fullDescription: Tau Beta Pi is an interdisciplinary engineering honor society that recognizes students with high academic achievement as well as a commitment to personal and professional integrity. Established in 1885, TBP is the second oldest collegiate honor society in America.

title: Tau Beta Sigma - Beta Gamma Chapter
descriptionSnippet: A national honorary band service organization with a main purpose to serve the Longhorn Band and the community.
fullDescription: Tau Beta Sigma is a National Honorary Band Sorority that provides service both to the Longhorn Band and our community. Here at the Beta Gamma chapter of UT we perform service such as handing out water at the football games and providing medkits at all band events. During Band Week, we provide lunches for all returning and prospective members. Additionally, we adopt a local, under-privilleged high school band and we play at a few of their football games with them.

title: Tau Kappa Epsilon Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: To form a brotherhood which is conducive to the betterment of its members in the educational, fraternal, and social aspects of their lives....
fullDescription: To form a brotherhood which is conducive to the betterment of its members in the educational, fraternal, and social aspects of their lives.

title: Tau Sigma at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: Tau Sigma at the University of Texas at Austin is a National Honor Society designed exclusively for transfer students on the Forty Acres.
fullDescription: Tau Sigma at The University of Texas at Austin strives to recognize and promote the academic excellence and involvement of transfer students on the Forty Acres. Tau Sigma at The University of Texas at Austin is a National Honor Society that provides its members with opportunities to earn scholarships, attend leadership conferences, take leadership positions, and serve others at UT and in the Austin community, all while developing friendships and becoming a more integral part of the longhorn family!

title: TCA Chinese Campus Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: udents/caa/index.htm TCA Chinese Campus Fellowship welcomes students joining us in weekly Bible study and various students events to emerge in the love of Jesus Christ.

title: Technology & Business
descriptionSnippet: The Technology & Business Student Organization allows students to explore the financial strategies of Technology firms and understand how firms use technology as a valuable asset.
fullDescription: The Business & Technology club will serve the interests of its members by hosting speakers form technology-based firms at meetings. In our meetings, we will learn more about the industry and hear about how we can best prepare ourselves for future jobs like these.

title: Tejas Club
descriptionSnippet: One of the oldest organizations at the University of Texas, the Tejas Club was founded in 1925 on the principles of friendship, leadership, and scholarship.
fullDescription: One of the oldest student organizations at the University of Texas, the Tejas Club was founded in 1925 on the principles of friendship, leadership, and scholarship.

title: Terry Scholar Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of this organization is to promote leadership, service, and academic success while serving as a unifying center of engagement and information for Terry scholars on the University of Texas at Austin campus.
fullDescription: The Terry Foundation is a Houston-based scholarship program founded to provide full scholarships to outstanding Texas high school graduates and transfer students for attendance at public colleges and universities within the state. As the Terry Scholar Student Association, our mission is to unify Terry Scholars, promote social and academic health of freshmen and continuing scholars, and honor the foundation by giving back to the community.

title: Texans for Israel
descriptionSnippet: Texans for Israel (TFI) is our community for Israel engagement, education and advocacy. TFI serves as a gathering place for students who share an interest in Israel and a strong, mutually-beneficial, U.S.-Israel relationship.
fullDescription: Texans for Israel (TFI) is our community for Israel engagement, education and advocacy. TFI serves as a gathering place for students who share an interest in Israel and a strong, mutually-beneficial, U.S.-Israel relationship. Since its establishment in 1991, TFI has been a force on campus, helping people exchange ideas, share experiences, and learn about and educate others on Israel's people, politics, and culture.

title: Texas 180 Degrees Consulting
descriptionSnippet: Texas 180 Degrees Consulting is the world’s largest university-based consultancy. We provide consulting services for local social enterprises with the goal to improve education, reduce homelessness, and alleviate poverty.
fullDescription: Texas 180 Degrees Consulting is designed to help students gain access to real-world consulting experience. Students will learn to provide support and expertise to local nonprofit organizations with the goal of expanding and improving their services. In addition, students will work in teams to discuss and collaborate with their peers and provide thoughtful and innovative solutions for our clients. By doing this, we will be able to empower nonprofit organizations to reach their full potential.

title: Texas 4000 for Cancer
descriptionSnippet: Texas 4000 is dedicated to fighting cancer by sharing hope, knowledge, and charity. We cultivate the next generation to lead the fight against cancer through our cornerstone event, a more than 4,000-mile bike ride from Austin to Anchorage....
fullDescription: Texas 4000 is dedicated to fighting cancer by sharing hope, knowledge, and charity. We cultivate the next generation to lead the fight against cancer through our cornerstone event, a more than 4,000-mile bike ride from Austin to Anchorage.

title: Texas Adventure Time
descriptionSnippet: Texas Adventure Time is an organization brings together people who love to explore, hike, and enjoy the great outdoors of Texas. Our club is meant to provide a stress-free break from school to go out and enjoy all nature has to offer.

title: Texas Advertising Group
descriptionSnippet: TAG's missions is to help students stand out by providing them with a network of peers and professionals who will help them pave a path to a successful career in advertising.
fullDescription: TAG's mission is to help students stand out by providing them with a network of peers and professionals who will help them pave a path to a successful career in advertising.

title: Texas Aerial Robotics
descriptionSnippet: We are a competition aerial robotics team, dedicated to competing in the International Aerial Robotics Competition.
fullDescription: We are a competition aerial robotics team, dedicated to competing in the International Aerial Robotics Competition (IARC). IARC challenges us to solve cutting edge problems in the field of aerial robotics such as GPS denied navigation, obstacle avoidance and real-time dynamic decision making all in full autonomy.  To learn more please visit our website: http://www.texasaerialrobotics.com/.

title: Texas Angels
descriptionSnippet: Texas Angels is a social, spirit and service organization that is dedicated to philanthropy, school spirit, academics, and sisterhood.
fullDescription: Texas Angels was established at the University of Texas at Austin in 2014. The vision of the original founders was to create a strong sisterhood that would uphold the four pillars: social, scholastic, spirit, and service.  These collectively represent the core values held at the heart of the Texas Angels. Texas Angels works to create a positive impact in the Austin Community and our chosen philanthropy, the Miracle Foundation. Angels also support the University in all of its organizations, from the arts to athletics. This organization empowers is members through positive affirmations and inspires fellow Angels to be the best they can be. By providing a network of support and sisterhood, Texas Angels promotes social and personal growth within the organization.

title: Texas Army ROTC
descriptionSnippet: Texas Army ROTC selects, educates, trains, and commissions college students to be officers and leaders of character in the Total Army; instills the values of citizenship, national and community service, and personal responsibility.
fullDescription: The Army ROTC program at The University of Texas at Austin is both challenging and rewarding. If you are attending Concordia University, Huston-Tillotson, St. Edwards University and Austin Community College you can join ROTC. There's no commitment required to join the Army ROTC program; you can try it out during your Freshmen and Sophomore years and gain some valuable leadership skills at the same time. But if you're ready to commit to a challenging career, then an Army ROTC scholarship might be available for you!

title: Texas Asian Pan-Hellenic Council

fullDescription: The Texas Asian Pan-Hellenic Council is the governing body for Asian-interest Greek letter organizations at the University of Texas at Austin. The council is dedicated to promoting leadership, scholarship, service, and Asian awareness.

fullDescription: Spirit and pride run deep at The University of Texas, and never is that more evident than game days. Find some burnt orange and show your true colors at one of our many Texas Athletics home sporting events.

descriptionSnippet: An organization to unite student-athletes for the purpose of providing support while navigating the undergraduate pre-health process as a student-athlete.

descriptionSnippet: A club for students which focuses solely on practicing classical ballet. Experience is not required; however, it is suggested.
fullDescription: A club for students with any level of ballet experience to come together for a student led ballet class. We do not claim to be instructors, just ballet students of several years who want to put together and participate in weekly dance classes. We hope to establish a club at the university that focuses solely on classical ballet. The purpose of this club is to provide a space and time for students to take a break from studying and practice classical ballet.

descriptionSnippet: To provide an opportunity to learn and improve the art of Ballroom dancing in a lively social atmosphere....
fullDescription: The mission of Texas Ballroom is to provide an opportunity to learn and improve the art of Ballroom dancing in a lively social atmosphere. We provide regular practice sessions and opportunities to dance through social functions and formal dance events. We also have competitive teams for country dancing and ballroom dancing that compete across the nation.

title: Texas Baseball Diamonds
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of Texas Baseball Diamonds is to support the UT Baseball team while upholding our 3 pillars of Spirit, Social, and Service. Our organization creates lasting friendships while supporting the baseball team and assisting the baseball office wi...
fullDescription: The purpose of Texas Baseball Diamonds is to support the UT Baseball team while upholding our 3 pillars of Spirit, Social, and Service. Our organization creates lasting friendships while supporting the baseball team and assisting the baseball office with events.

title: Texas Belles Event Planning Organization
descriptionSnippet: Texas Belles is a pre-professional event planning organization for students pursuing careers in the hospitality industry. We are affiliated with the College of Communication but do not restrict membership to those majors.

title: Texas Bhangra
descriptionSnippet: Texas Bhangra is a nationally competing bhangra team from UT Austin! We, not only represent Austin, but we are one of the oldest and leading collegiate teams in Texas and we represent our state in national and international competitions!
fullDescription: Texas Bhangra was formed at The University of Texas at Austin in 2003 with a very distinct vision: to promote awareness of Punjabi culture through dance and the importance of diversity and multiculturalism. We perform the dance style of Bhangra, a high energy, fast paced dance form originating from the Punjab region in North India/Pakistan. Bhangra originated as a dance celebrating the harvest season each year in the villages and we strive to maintain the spirit in which Bhangra was performed. We accomplish these goals by performing at numerous charity and cultural events for both our campus and the community at large. Our team is known for our energy both on and off stage; we are driven to inspire others with our passion, dedication, and unique style.

title: Texas Billiards
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to help bring together billiards players on campus or introduce those who wish to learn the sport. We also compete against other universities in various intercollegiate tournaments.
fullDescription:
Texas Billiards, founded in 1985, is the University of Texas's answer for all things regarding pool and pocket billiards. 
We meet every Tuesday in the Union Underground at 7:00 PM to sharpen our skills, hang out, and have fun.

title: Texas Blazers
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Texas Blazers is threefold: 1. To serve the University of Texas and Austin community through volunteerism 2. To uphold and promote University of Texas spirit and traditions 3. To provide campus leadership through involvement while ma..
fullDescription: The purpose of the Texas Blazers is threefold: 1. to serve the University of Texas and Austin community through volunteerism 2. to uphold and promote University of Texas spirit and traditions 3. to provide campus leadership through involvement while maintaing high standards of academic excellence.

title: Texas Blockchain
descriptionSnippet: Our mission is to promote the education and research of distributed ledger technology through student collaboration, while cultivating innovation within The University of Texas by exploring applications of blockchain across varying industries.
fullDescription: Texas Blockchain Group is a student-run organization at UT Austin that is dedicated to research and education of distributed ledger technology systems. Our team consists of students from a variety of backgrounds such as Computer Science, Engineering, Business, Economics, and more. Our goal is to find new applications of blockchain technology throughout the various industries that our team has experience in as well as encouraging personal development of our members in the blockchain industry.

title: Texas Bluebonnets
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Texas Bluebonnets is to unite diverse UT students through service, social, and spirit events. The Texas Bluebonnets' main focus is on leadership and character development.
fullDescription: Texas Bluebonnets is a spirit organization on campus. Founded with character as our core pillar, we hope to improve ourselves and our community through our philanthropic efforts with the Austin Animal Center and other service projects in the Austin community area. In addition, Bluebonnets are dedicated to academia and strive to be excellent students and mentors. We are also proud of attending the prestigious institution of UT Austin and wholeheartedly support our university with our Longhorn spirit. Most importantly, we support our members by incorporating a sisterhood of strong, long-lasting friendships.

title: Texas Business Forensics Association
descriptionSnippet: TBFA is an organization created for students interested in business ethics and white collar crime. Its goal is to encourage discussions about ethics and compliance, as well as provide valuable professional experiences in various business fields.
fullDescription: TBFA is an organization created for students interested in business ethics and white collar crime. Its goal is to encourage discussions about ethics and compliance, as well as provide valuable experiences for individuals who are pursuing careers in accounting, compliance, data analytics, or business law.

title: Texas Business Healthcare Association
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas at Austin's Texas Business Healthcare Association is a student organization dealing with business, healthcare and student involvement. TXBHA is open to all members.
fullDescription: Texas Business Healthcare Association is an organization within the McCombs School of Business at The University of Texas at Austin. TXBHA is focused on filling in the gap between business and healthcare by exposing students to the financial, managerial, legal, and consulting aspects of the healthcare industry. Each semester, TXBHA curates a series of speakers to provide insight on these topics, in addition to providing community service opportunities and organizing social events. Membership is open to all UT students interested in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy or business.

title: Texas Business Law Association
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Business Law Association exists to provide networking and professional opportunities for students interested in learning about law school or the legal side of business. Membership is open to all UT students.

descriptionSnippet: The mission of the Texas Business Law Society (TBLS) is to provide educational, networking and professional development opportunities for law students interested in both transactional law.
fullDescription: TBLS does not track membership via Hornslink. To join the organization please email txbusinesslaw@gmail.com

title: Texas Challah For Hunger
descriptionSnippet: Challah for Hunger is a national non-profit that raises money and awareness for hunger and disaster relief both locally and globally, through the production and sale of challah bread.
fullDescription: Challah for Hunger is a national non-profit that raises money and awareness for hunger and disaster relief both locally and globally, through the production and sale of challah bread. The UT chapter meets weekly at the Texas Hillel on 21st and San Antonio from 5:30-7:00 on Tuesdays to braid the challah, and then it is baked fresh on Wenesday and sold on the West Mall starting at 12. Proceeds from the sale benefit the Capitol Area Food Bank and Mazon. Challah for Hunger is a non-denominational organization and welcomes volunteers of all backgrounds and ages!

title: Texas Cinema Club

fullDescription: The Texas Cinema Club, open to all active UT students, explores the culture of film, from its beginnings nearly over a century ago, to current innovations. Topics of conversation range from directors to actors, to the history of the medium, to social movements in film, along with screenings held every month.

descriptionSnippet: Code Orange is providing computer literacy and basic coding skills to K-12 students in under-served communities around Austin.

title: Texas Consulting
descriptionSnippet: Texas Consulting is a student-run management consulting organization focused on advising and working on pro-bono projects for Fortune 500s and global non-profits. We focus on providing our members with hands-on experiences.

title: Texas Consulting Team

fullDescription: Texas Consulting Team is an organization focused on introducing undergraduate students to the consulting industry. TCT holds regular meetings and social events so students can hear speakers, practice cases, learn about firms, and more.

title: Texas Convergent

fullDescription: Texas Convergent was established to promote collaboration across the University of Texas through entrepreneurship. Historically, it has been the combination of students from varying backgrounds with the common goal of innovation that has driven the most creative ideas and products. Convergent aims to bridge the gap between the Computer Science department and students across the university by providing hands-on experience through collaborative projects and a community for students to launch their ideas.

fullDescription: TCCI is a student organization that strives to raise awareness for inflammatory bowel disease and aims to raise funds for research to find a cure. In addition to serving this cause, we aim to provide opportunities for pre-health students in the form of service and fundraising. We will table for membership, raising awareness and selling goods. We will hold an annual field day for IBD patients, empowering them to participate in physical activities that they would normally abstain from. We will also hold a kickball tournament to raise funds.

fullDescription: As both a student organization and competitive sports team, the club seeks to promote the sport of cycling on campus and facilitate rider development. We strive to create an atmosphere that is positive and meets the needs of all of our riders.

fullDescription: Established in 2003, Texas Darlins is an organization bound by sisterhood, driven by service, and unparalleled in spirit. As the official spirit group of the Texas Men's and Women's basketball programs, we unite every kind of woman with the aim of changing our community and altering ourselves through service and spirit. Embedded in each of us are the qualities that make a strong leader, devotion, kindness, loyalty, determination, and grace. We are a group of individuals move as one toward a common goal: unity in service, sisterhood, and spirit.

fullDescription: TDSA is an organization for students that are interested in a career big data, data analytics, and data science. Our goal is to help students develop the skills necessary for a career involving data. Our foundation is built upon four pillars: professional, social, philanthropic, and academic.

fullDescription: Texas Dhoom is a new, noncompetitive Bollywood fusion dance team! We will be incorporating a variety of styles such as classical, hip-hop, contemporary, and more! Since this is a noncompetitive team, we will just focus on dancing without any additional stressors. We will be choreographing our own items and performing at various events throughout the year.

title: Texas Dragon/Lion Dance Team
descriptionSnippet: Our goal is to share and introduce the art of lion dancing throughout the community.
fullDescription: The Texas Dragon/Lion Dance Team (TDDT) is a performance-driven lion dance group based in Austin, Texas. Our goal is to share and,  in many cases, introduce the art of lion dancing to the community. We are one of the few teams in Central Texas that performs year-round, for a wide variety of events. In the past we've performed for elementary schools, cultural events, festivals, restaurants, and weddings. Our prime performance season is during the Lunar New Year (early February or March) where we perform the gauntlet of back-to-back performances for businesses and organizations all over Austin.

title: Texas Energy Conference
descriptionSnippet: Texas Energy Conference is a student run, two day conference that will be held in Austin, TX on April 12-13, 2019. TEC is focused on fostering innovation amongst energy related startups through a business plan competition named The Energy Olympiad.
fullDescription: Texas Energy Conference is a student run, two day conference that will be held in Austin, TX on April 12-13, 2019. Executives, professors, and professionals will present talks, panels, and workshops regarding the future of energy. TEC is focused on fostering innovation amongst energy related startups through a business plan competition named The Energy Olympiad, while bringing entrepreneurs, students, and corporate professionals together to keep Texas at the forefront of solving tomorrow's greatest clean energy challenges.

fullDescription:
What Does TELJ Publish?
TELJ is a biannual publication that provides practitioners with current legal articles, developments, and information pertaining to environmental and natural resources law, as well as news of activities and other relevant events.

fullDescription: The primary purpose of the Equestrian Team is to compete in intercollegiate horse show competitions. title: Texas Federalist Society

fullDescription: The Texas Federalist Society is part of a national network of judges, practitioners, public policy experts, government officials, and students who share a conservative/libertarian perspective on the law. Our goal is to expose the student body to those perspectives, which we believe are often not well or not fairly represented in the average classroom. To that end, we host debates, panels, and speeches to fairly and seriously engage with the most pressing issues of the day. We also forge conservative and libertarian community through frequent networking events.

descriptionSnippet: Our mission is to build enthusiasm for field hockey in Texas by growing knowledge, building skills, and increasing players. Anyone regardless of skill is invited to join for opportunities to socialize, exercise, and learn more about field hockey!

fullDescription: TFT is an organization that provides students with opportunities to experience firsthand financial innovation via technology. TFT aims to introduce members to emerging financial based technologies via information sessions, meetings, guest speakers, and events. We seek to foster lasting relationships with various companies involved in financial technology based in Austin that are able to grant internships and employment offers for students.

title: Texas Fish Club

fullDescription: Texas Fish Club encourages and supports a love of fish. Our primary emphasis is on the art of fishing itself, but the club also includes fish education. Events consist of fishing, aquarium visits, fish films, and just some fun gatherings to discuss fish and get to know the other members more. No experience in fishing or knowledge of fish is necessary to join: we welcome all.

descriptionSnippet: Texas Folklorico Dance Company is a student founded organization at the University of Texas at Austin that seeks to educate, preserve and promote Mexican traditions/culture through dance. As well as encourage the community to delve into new experiences.

fullDescription: Texas Forensics exists to encourage students interested in the field of forensic science by educating them on career possibilities and opportunities and by creating a forum to unite these students. check out our website for more information on events and meetings!

fullDescription: The University of Texas tradition in forensics is one of the oldest programs at UT. Starting as the Athaeneum Literary Society, the first student organization on campus began even before the University’s charter was completed.

fullDescription: Texas Girl Gang wants to help female-identifying students on UT's campus become their best selves! Come join us to learn how to achieve more in your personal, professional, and political lives through various workshops and speakers. We also host social events (like brunch and Galentine's day!) and volunteer opportunities, so that you can connect with other #girlbosses and serve the greater Austin community!

title: Texas Gospel Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: Texas Gospel Fellowship is intended to serve the Black community through the love of Christ. Texas Gospel Fellowship, commonly known as TGF, is part of a larger nationwide movement known as Intervarsity.
fullDescription: Texas Gospel Fellowship is a witnessing family, striving to serve the Black community through the love of Christ. Our purpose on The University of Texas’ campus is to foster a safe space for Black students as they grow in their faith and their love for God, to spread love and joy to every corner of the campus and develop servant leaders. We currently have a women's small group meeting every Friday at 6:30pm (contact us for location) and Large Group at Parlin 303 every Tuesday @7pm.

title: Texas Graduate Christian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: To bring believing graduate students together for study, support, and community. Dinner and Bible study on Thursday nights 6-8 pm at 2104 Nueces. We also have monthly talks with Christian professors, movie viewings and discussions, book groups, and more.
fullDescription: To bring believing graduate students together for study, support, and community. We meet weekly on Thursday nights at 2104 Nueces for (free!) dinner and Bible study from 6-8 pm. See http://www.hillhouseaustin.org/ for directions. We also have monthly talks with Christian professors, movie viewings and discussions, book groups, and more. Email texas.gcf@gmail.com for more information.

title: Texas Gymnastics
descriptionSnippet: Texas Gymnastics is a competitive club that offers an opportunity for members to improve skills in artistic gymnastics, and to provide an opportunity for men and women to compete in gymnastics at the national club level.
fullDescription: Texas Gymnastics is a competitive club that offers an opportunity for members to improve skills in artistic gymnastics, and to provide an opportunity for men and women to compete in gymnastics at the national club level.  Our competitions begin in the Spring, so don't forget to visit our website or like us on Facebook in order to stay up to date with our meet schedule.

title: Texas Handball
descriptionSnippet: 1) Promote handball at The University of Texas and beyond; 2) sponsor a competitive handball team and assist its members financially at competitions (e.g., entry fees, lodging, etc.); 3) when possible, provide team members with equipment and uniforms
fullDescription: 1) Promote handball at The University of Texas and beyond; 2) sponsor a competitive handball team and assist its members financially at competitions (e.g., entry fees, lodging, etc.); 3) continually increase participation in the four tournaments we host each year; 4) administer a successful 2020 Collegiate Nationals to be held at UT

title: Texas Health Promotion Club
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Health Promotion Club is a student organization open to all students at the University of Texas and serves as a platform to unite like-minded individuals under a common goal of health promotion.

title: Texas Healthy Habits
descriptionSnippet: Texas Healthy Habits is a service organization focused on educating youth on healthy eating habits and oral hygiene in the local Austin community.
fullDescription:
Texas Healthy Habits is a service organization focused on raising awareness for healthy living practices to children in the local Austin community. Texas Healthy Habits puts particular emphasis on good hygiene techniques, nutrition, and first aid. The club reaches out to local elementary schools and visits several times during the semester to give an interactive presentation to the kids, which is split into two parts- public health and dental. Each presentation is designed for specific age groups.

The story behind our mission is many children develop habits at an early age that carry onto adulthood. Bad habits are hard to break later on as people are so accustomed to their habits. This is why our goal is to educate children on habits such as washing your hands, brushing your teeth twice a day, and staying hydrated. We want to teach children small, every day habits they can incorporate into their lives and take an interest in. Therefore, the children can develop healthy living habits that they will keep as they grow older! 

The great thing about Texas Healthy Habits is that you can earn community service hours while volunteering alongside with other members. Many college students are in search of community service hours, so why not volunteer together with your friends and meet new ones!

title: Texas Hillel
descriptionSnippet: Texas Hillel creates opportunities for all Jewish students at The University of Texas to develop their own Jewish interests and participate in a welcoming campus-based community that respects the value of pluralism and promotes ongoing involvement.
fullDescription:
Founded in 1927, Texas Hillel at The University of Texas at Austin’s mission is to enrich the lives of Jewish undergraduate and graduate students so that they may enrich the Jewish people and the world. Texas Hillel students, professionals and volunteer leaders are dedicated to creating a pluralistic, welcoming and inclusive environment for Jewish college students, where they are encouraged to grow intellectually, spiritually and socially. Texas Hillel helps students find a balance in being distinctively Jewish and universally human by encouraging them to pursue tzedek (social justice), tikkun olam (repairing the world) and Jewish learning, and to support Israel and global Jewish peoplehood. Texas Hillel is committed to excellence, innovation, accountability and results.

The University of Texas at Austin is a vibrant campus community with more than 4,000 Jewish students, making Texas Hillel host to the largest population of Jewish students in the region. Texas Hillel plans more than one hundred different activities each year, and programs under its sponsorship have been recognized by the University as Best Campus Service Organization (for social action and community volunteerism), Best Campus Political Organization (for Texans for Israel advocacy and education work and for the White Rose Society's anti-genocide campaign), and Most Outstanding Campus Religious Organization. Texas Hillel has also been recognized by Hillel: The Foundation for Jewish Campus Life as an Exemplar of Excellence and with the Haber Award in 2005 for the White Rose Society (a Holocaust Remembrance and Genocide Awareness group).

title: Texas Horns for Cannabis
descriptionSnippet: To engage and de-stigmatize the notions surrounding medicinal plants, the medicinal herb industry, and the economical benefits of cannabis. In coalition with the UT student body at large, we will explore opportunities for research and career development

title: Texas Humanities for Humanity
descriptionSnippet: We tell the life stories of individuals facing critical illness who would like to preserve their legacy in a durable format.
fullDescription: Texas Humanities for Humanity, also known as Texas H4H, aims to tell a story. We strive to aid individuals facing life-limiting illness who desire to leave their legacy in a tangible and durable format. Our volunteers meet with individuals such as patients isolated in hospice centers and parents suffering from terminal disease who hope to impart wisdom to their children, grandchildren, and community. From these interview sessions, our volunteers, organized into a peer editing board, will craft a short film and brief biographical article about the interviewee. Our desire to share others’ stories stems not only from our conviction that every human being deserves the opportunity to leave their legacy, but also from the current medical literature which suggests that “whether in written or spoken form, putting lived experiences into a story is linked to both physical and mental health benefits.” At Texas Humanities for Humanity, we strive to improve patient health outcomes and help others fulfill the fundamental human desire to immortalize an individual’s life narrative.

fullDescription: To build and improve community within the Joint Admissions Medical program and create a known presence in the university community.

title: Texas Journal of Oil, Gas & Energy Law
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Journal of Oil, Gas, and Energy Law's (TJOGEL) vision is to be a leading energy law journal. We want to be the forum of choice for energy law practitioners, professors, and students around the globe. Our focus centers on providing significant..
fullDescription: The Texas Journal of Oil, Gas, and Energy Law's (TJOGEL) vision is to be a leading energy law journal. We want to be the forum of choice for energy law practitioners, professors, and students around the globe. Our mission is to provide energy professionals with relevant information on emerging issues in the dynamic field of oil, gas, and energy law, while cultivating the industry's future leaders.

title: Texas Journal of Oil, Gas, and Energy Law Society
descriptionSnippet: The Oil & Gas Law Society is designed to expose first-year law students to the energy legal community so that they can explore the various career paths and academic issues related to the energy practice.

title: Texas Journal on Civil Liberties & Civil Rights
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Journal is to publish scholarly writings on various civil liberties and civil rights issues. The Journal publishes two issues per academic year.
fullDescription: The purpose of the Journal is to publish scholarly writings on, encourage dialogue, and foster awareness of various civil liberties and civil rights issues. The Journal publishes two issues per academic year.

title: Texas Judo
descriptionSnippet: We provide judo instruction to members of all skill levels while also having fun and making friends!
fullDescription: We teach judo to members of all skill levels ranging from beginner to expert and we hope to teach you too! We improve our judo skills with our amazing coaches while also making new friends and bonding as a team. Practices are held every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 6-8 and Sunday from 4-6 in RSC 1.138.

title: Texas Juggling Society
descriptionSnippet: To conduct regular meetings for the study of juggling and related disciplines. We offer assistance to members of the community seeking to learn or improve their skills, and promote the appreciation of said skills.
fullDescription: Meetings: Sundays 2-4 PM, SAC 2.310

title: Texas Ladies
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Ladies are the newest, loudest, proudest spirit group on campus. We differ from other groups in that we offer pre-professional service opportunities; namely pre-medical, pre-law, and business. Join us as we serve, lead, and conquer!
fullDescription: The Texas Ladies are the newest, loudest, proudest spirit group on campus. We differ from other groups in that we offer pre-professional service opportunities; namely pre-medical, pre-law, and business. We work with  UHS, Travis County Courthouse, and more! The Ladies take a new approach to club leadership: rather than the traditional democratic system, the Ladies have a CEO and Board of Directors to teach our members business functions and encourage them to reach for leadership positions in their life outside the group as well. Like any other spirit group, our core values are social, spirit, and service. We host many social events and love UT sports. Join us as we serve, lead, and conquer!

title: Texas Ladybirds
