descriptionSnippet: Texas Ladybirds is a spirit organization at the University of Texas at Austin founded in memory of Lady Bird Johnston. We strive to uphold our pillars of service, spirit, scholarship, and social.
fullDescription: The Texas Ladybirds is a spirit organization at the University of Texas at Austin, founded to foster lifelong friendships between high-caliber people and to inspire them to uphold the legacy of Lady Bird Johnson. We were founded in Fall of 2014 for people ready to make a change in the world. Each of our members are held to high standards of excellence and participate in many spirit, social, service and scholarship events throughout each semester.

title: Texas Lambda Alpha Nu
descriptionSnippet: We are a co-ed social fraternity for Computer Science majors at the University of Texas at Austin.

title: Texas Lassos
descriptionSnippet: Texas Lassos is a service organization at the University of Texas in Austin. The organization shall strive to promote spirit, service, and social activities to all members while fostering friendship and leadership.
fullDescription:
Texas Lassos is classified as a service organization at the University of Texas at Austin. As an organization, we strive to promote spirit, service, and social activities to all members while fostering friendship, leadership, and cooperation with the University and community. Founded in 1998 with only seven members, today Texas Lassos is home to over 150 active members and an accomplished group of alumni. As a whole we are a group of diverse young women intent on contributing to the University and the Austin Community. We're not the oldest, we're not the biggest, we're simply the best.

Service:
Lassos work hard to improve the UT campus and the city of Austin. We participate in service projects and volunteering for numerous charitable organizations and causes, including Austin Animal Center, Texas THON, Inside Books, Austin Marathon, SUREwalk, Outside the Box, Best Buddies, and many more! Active members are required to complete 12 hours of service a semester. We have numerous service opportunities available throughout the semester, including service mixers with other organizations on campus!

Spirit:
Texas Lassos are proud to be Longhorns and we support all UT athletics! Each semester, active members are required to attend six games of their choosing. We have tailgates with other male organizations for football and baseball. As Lassos, we play IM Softball and Volleyball as well as participate in events like OU Weekend and 40 Acres Fest. We also love supporting our fellow Lassos in their individual interests, by attending events like Acapella performances and dance competitions.

Social:
Lassos love to have fun! We have plenty of social events throughout the year that foster sisterhood among our fellow members, friendship with other organizations, and date events as well! Our events include Date Dash, Crush, Destination Unknown, Mixers, Boat Party, Lasso Thanksgiving, Crawfish Boil, Formals, Semi-formals, Mugdown and Shootout.

Visit our website at www.txlassos.com to learn more about Texas Lassos.

title: Texas Latin Dance
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Texas Latin Dance is to promote the art of Latin Dance to the UT community at large. It is students teaching fellow students how to dance in a fun, positive environment.
fullDescription:
The purpose of Texas Latin Dance is to promote the art of Latin Dance to the UT and Austin community. As a dance organization, we intend to build and enhance the dance skills of our new and returning members, whose experience with Latin Dancing, specifically, can rage from none to ample. Throughout this process, we seek to manifest an awareness of the importance of dance in Latin America historically, culturally, and socially as well as the global impact of Latin Dance that transcends ethnicities. 

We offer our members weekly dance classes in the different genres we teach, as well as social events, club parties, dance outings, workshops with professionals, and individual practices. For those who seek to reach a more advanced level of dance, we offer Dance Companies in Bachata, Salsa, Cumbia, Merengue and other genres that meet for practice individually and perform at our annual Spring Showcase, along with other UT and Austin dance organizations/companies.

title: Texas Law Disability Alliance
descriptionSnippet: We are a group of law students with disabilities and their allies. We work to promote community, education, self-care, and advocacy around disability at the law school and in the legal profession.
fullDescription: Texas Law Disability Alliance is a coalition of law students with disabilities and their allies. We work to promote community, education, and advocacy around disability.

title: Texas Law Veterans Association
descriptionSnippet: Texas Law Veterans Association (TLVA) is composed of all current and former military and military-affiliated members of the Texas Law School community.
fullDescription: Texas Law Veterans Organization (TLVA) is composed of all current and former military and military-affiliated members of the Texas Law School community. In addition to providing support  and mentoring to members, TLVA works with other student groups to promote and share military and veterans related legal issues to Texas’s campus.

title: Texas Law Women's Christian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: To create a safe space for those interested in learning more about Christian women through studying and applying God's word in law school and beyond; to provide a platform for fellowship; and to encourage others in their Christian walk.

title: Texas Lonestars
descriptionSnippet: Texas Lonestars is a group of women at UT dedicated to the pillars of service, spirit, and sisterhood. Lonestars share a special bond through their love of the university and serving their community.
fullDescription: Texas Lonestars is a group of women at UT dedicated to the pillars of service, spirit, and sisterhood. Each year, the Lonestars contribute hundreds of hours to community service events. The Lonestars truly bleed burnt orange! Whether it be cheering on the Horns from their group seats at football games, marching in the OU Parade, or playing intramural sports, Lonestars have spirit in every sense of the word. Lonestars is more than just an extra curricular activity- its a family. This close-knit organization provides a home away from home for its members.

title: Texas Meditation Society
descriptionSnippet: Texas Meditation Society is a non-religiously affiliated meditation society featuring group meditation sessions and a support network to facilitate individual meditation practices
fullDescription: Texas Meditation Society is a non-religiously affiliated meditation society featuring group meditation sessions and a support network to facilitate individual meditation practices.

title: Texas Men's Lacrosse
descriptionSnippet: To promote lacrosse through sportsmanship and skill; to teach new players and improve old ones; to provide an outlet for physical creativity and activity; to provide social functions and interaction for the team members.
fullDescription: To promote lacrosse through sportsmanship and skill; to teach new players and improve old ones; to provide an outlet for physical creativity and activity; to provide social functions and interaction for the team members.

title: Texas Men's Volleyball
descriptionSnippet: To play and win at the most competitive level of Collegiate Club Volleyball....
fullDescription: To play and win at the most competitive level of Collegiate Club Volleyball. We compete in the Southern Intercollegiate Volleyball Association, as well participate in a National tournament every spring.

title: Texas Men's Water Polo
descriptionSnippet: To practice and participate in water polo events and to spark and hold an interest in water polo on campus. http://texaswaterpolo.com/
fullDescription: To practice and participate in water polo events and to spark and hold an interest in water polo on campus.

title: Texas Mohini Dance Team
descriptionSnippet: Texas Mohini is UT Austin's premier all-girls' dance team, combining Bollywood and classical dance along with modern styles of dance, such as hip-hop. We perform across the country and competed in Bollywood America, the national championships, in 2016.
fullDescription: Awards:

title: Texas Moto
descriptionSnippet: The first and only organization dedicated to the campus Motorcycle community.
fullDescription: We are a collection of the motorcyclists at the University who discuss and participate in anything motorcycle related. Our main events include weekly group rides around the state of Texas and multiple camping trips every year. We discuss general maintenance, recent updates in the motorcycle world and motorcycle safety at every meeting. This club was created because riding in a group with friends is always more fun than riding alone! We do our best to represent all motorcyclists favorably and are respectful to the road laws and other drivers. Our main goal is to unite the large motorcycle community around UT and share our love for two wheels and an open road.

title: Texas Music Producers
descriptionSnippet: Texas Music Producers is a community of young producers who are beginning and continuing their journeys in music. Join us to meet like-minded people, make next level music, and learn more about the industry.
fullDescription: Texas Music Producers won’t turn anyone into a superstar overnight. However, what it will do is provide musicians with a collaborative environment to build and apply their technical skills.

title: Texas Nutrition at the University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: To provide students with a knowledge of opportunities and developments in nutrition and dietetics fields, and to promote healthful eating and behavioral habits within the community.
fullDescription: To provide the students with a knowledge of opportunities and developments in nutrition and dietetics fields. Texas Nutrtition primarily focuses on enhancing the students' exposure to professionals in nutrition-related fields, local and national dietetic associations, and information regarding nutritional degrees at UT. Because Texas Nutrition is not limited solely to nutrition majors, it offers collaboration between students majoring in nutrition and other academic tracks such as exercise science, kinesiology, pre-health professions, business, etc. The organization also offers a variety of additional opportunities including volunteering, social engagements, and intramural sports. Events from past calendars range from Urban Roots volunteering, kayaking, and IM volleyball.

title: Texas Orange Jackets
descriptionSnippet: Texas Orange Jackets is a women’s honorary service organization that seeks to better The University, to empower women to be leaders in their respective communities, and to promote a lifelong pursuit of service, leadership, and scholarship.
fullDescription: Texas Orange Jackets is a women’s honorary service organization, founded in 1923, that seeks to better The University and the City of Austin, to empower women to be leaders in their respective communities, and to promote a lifelong pursuit of the three core tenets: Service, Leadership, and Scholarship. As a part of the oldest women's service organization on campus, members of Texas Orange Jackets serve as official hosts for The University of Texas at Austin and are committed to three core values:

title: Texas Parents
descriptionSnippet: Texas Parents is the official parents’ association of the University of Texas at Austin with a fully-staffed campus office to serve the needs of all UT parents and families.

title: Texas Peaches
descriptionSnippet: We are a small, tight-knit group of girls who love UT, Austin, and serving others. This spirit group is founded on the notion that girls can be friends and have fun without drama.

title: Texas Pearls
descriptionSnippet: Texas Pearls is a service organization for students looking to build leaders and foster friendships through serving the University of Texas campus and Austin community.
fullDescription: The purpose of Texas Pearls is: to volunteer for various community events; to raise money for various charities; to introduce members to social activities; to develop mature, lasting friendships and leadership skills among its members; and to promote the University of Texas and the Austin community.

title: Texas Performing Arts
descriptionSnippet: Texas Performing Arts serves The University of Texas at Austin campus and the Austin community at large through a diverse season of international performances, campus and community engagement activities, and collaborative partnerships.
fullDescription: Texas Performing Arts serves The University of Texas at Austin campus and the Austin community at large through a diverse season of international performances, campus and community engagement activities, and collaborative partnerships. Performances include classical music, jazz, world music, modern and international dance, and conversation. Comprised of six state-of-the-art theatres, Texas Performing Arts presents, produces, and commissions global culture experiences otherwise unavailable locally to the Central Texas community.

title: Texas Personal Finance
descriptionSnippet: Texas Personal Finance (TPF) is intended to provide a learning environment for those interested in personal finance. TPF seeks to enable as many people as possible to be financially literate, intelligent and responsible.
fullDescription: Texas Personal Finance (TPF) is intended to provide a learning environment for those interested in personal finance. Whether you're set to graduate with a signing bonus to a six-figure salary or burdened by student loans and forced to work a part-time job, everyone should know the basics of personal finance - how to save, what the stock market is, the ins and outs of credit, insurance, and more. TPF seeks to enable as many people as possible to be financially literate, intelligent and responsible.

title: Texas Phi Delta Epsilon
descriptionSnippet: Phi Delta Epsilon at the University of Texas is a Pre-Med coed fraternity. PhiDE Texas focuses on community service, friendship, prehealth opportunities, and leadership abilities. Our motto is Facta-Non-Verba: Deeds not words.
fullDescription:
Phi Delta Epsilon was founded over 100 years ago as a professional medical fraternity
supporting the need for camaraderie and mentoring among medical students. Since then, the
membership has changed dramatically but the mission and objectives of our organization
remain the same. PhiDE (pronounced F-eye Dee Eee) provides educational opportunities,
supports philanthropic projects, and serves as a foundation for the development of relationships
among medical professionals throughout the entire spectrum of a medical career.
Through a host of planned activities during the academic year, students develop their leadership
and professional skills, which complement a basic understanding of medical science. When the
time comes to apply for medical school or match for residency, active membership in PhiDE is
evidence of that a student is well rounded and motivated. In addition to our numerous resources
for the MCAT and USMLE, there are many chapter activities to help relieve the stress of
studying.
Since 1904, when our professional coeducational organization was founded, we are
continuously striving to meet the following objectives:
 To promote fellowship, equality, and unity.
 To promote the highest scientific and educational standards in the field of
medicine.
 To promote, uphold, and maintain the highest standards of ethics in the practice
of medicine, medical teaching, and research.
 To promote non-profit service to the community.
 To promote discussions at all Fraternity level of current social and economic
issues as related to medicine, the practice of medicine, and other health care
related matters.

title: Texas Photo Bike Dash
descriptionSnippet: Organize and participate in Photographic Bike Dashes; unique events that combine photographic ability, navigational skills and physical fitness.

title: Texas Photo Society
descriptionSnippet: Texas Photo Society is an organization that aims to foster unity and creativity among the UT student body through photography. We are a community where photography enthusiasts can discuss, learn, and explore the art and science of photography.
fullDescription: Texas Photo Society is an organization that aims to foster unity among the UT student body through photography. Through discussions, tutorials, competitions, excursions, and more, everyone can take his or her photography to the next level. We are a community where photography enthusiasts discuss, learn, and explore the art and science of photography.

title: Texas Political Union
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Political Union is a forum for political debate and discussion in a noncompetitive environment. Students from all parts of the political spectrum are welcome here to speak their mind on the issues and hone their public speaking skills.
fullDescription: The Texas Political Union is a forum for political debate and discussion in a noncompetitive environment. Students from all parts of the political spectrum are welcome here to speak their mind on the issues and hone their public speaking skills. We believe that civil political discourse is essential for civic engagement and leadership. We also host outside and faculty speakers.

title: Texas Polo Team
descriptionSnippet: This polo club is a student organization that facilitates the sport of polo. The club provides the opportunity for everyone to experience polo and develop their skills at an affordable price. We also offer horseback riding lessons!

title: Texas Pre-Dental Society
descriptionSnippet: Please visit our website if you are interested in becoming a member http://texaspredental.org/
fullDescription: Texas Pre-Dental Society is an organization within The University of Texas at Austin College of Natural Sciences that educates students about the field of dentistry and prepares them for various aspects of the dental profession. Through facilitating events at which students can interact with dental school deans and admissions board members, and dentists, members are exposed to the expectations for dental school candidates. Membership provides access to group trips to dental schools within Texas, a shadowing program with local dentists, on-going community service events, and social events.

title: Texas Programming Contests
descriptionSnippet: Texas Programming Contests organizes programming contests where students of all levels can compete, win prizes, and improve their algorithmic and technical skills.
fullDescription: Texas Programming Contests organizes programming contests where students of all levels can compete, win prizes, and improve their algorithmic and technical skills.

title: Texas Public Health
descriptionSnippet: Texas Public Health is open to students of all majors who are interested in public health. We hope to raise awareness on public health issues around the globe and foster strong ties of responsibility and dependability to our local Austin community.
fullDescription: Texas Public Health is the student organization representing students interested in health education, disease prevention, and the development of a strong public health initiative at the University of Texas at Austin. The interdisciplinary field of public health combines biology, chemistry, medicine, and sociology. We provide information about graduate school, research opportunities around campus, and a vibrant community to explore public health. At the University of Texas at Austin, the Public Health B.S. degree is broken into 6 concentrations:

title: Texas Publication Coalition
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Publication Coalition (PubCo) is intended to bring together publications from across the campus to support and assist one another, host publication-oriented events for UT students, and generate publicity for all member publications.

title: Texas Punjabi Cultural Association
descriptionSnippet: Texas Punjabi Cultural Association seeks to promote unity among Punjabi students, and awareness about Punjabi culture while educating the students about the rich history of the region, which today is partitioned between India and Pakistan.

title: Texas Quidditch
descriptionSnippet: We play quidditch as sanctioned by United States Quidditch both inter-collegiately and intramurally. House practices are 6-8pm at Whitaker Fields on Wednesdays. Anyone is welcome to come out to a house practice and try it out.
fullDescription: Quidditch is a relatively new sport that is based on the sport from the Harry Potter series.  The sport is a fast paced and physical game that involves bits and pieces from multiple sports including rugby, basketball, and dodgeball. Here at the University of Texas we have two traveling teams that compete intercollegiately with other teams from around the state and the country. We also have two intramural teams that compete once a month against each other.

title: Texas Raas
descriptionSnippet: Texas Raas (Dirty South Dandiya) is UT's very own nationally renowned Raas/Garba Dance Team. Each year we put together a garba/raas routine that we perform for local events as well as compete with at national competitions all around the country.
fullDescription: Founded in 2003, UT Austin's very own professional Garba/Raas dance team, Texas Raas, also known as Dirty South Dandiya, has been representing Texas for the past 13 years. Come support us at our local and national events every year! We perform not only on the UT campus but also at national-level competitions around the nation along with private parties such as weddings, receptions, etc.

title: Texas Real Estate Law Society
descriptionSnippet: The mission of the Texas Real Estate Law Society is to provide networking, educational, professional development, and leadership opportunities for law students interested in Real Estate and related areas of the law.
fullDescription: The mission of the Texas Real Estate Law Society is to provide networking, educational, professional development, and leadership opportunities for individuals interested in Real Estate Law and its many facets.

title: Texas Review of Law and Politics
descriptionSnippet: The Unfettered Pursuit of Conservative Legal Scholarship
fullDescription: The Texas Review of Law and Politics is a premier conservative and libertarian law journal. Our scholarship is at the forefront of conservative and libertarian legal thought and is routinely cited in opinions, scholarship, and the popular press. Our authors include federal and state judges, federal and state senators, governors, professors, policy experts, practicing attorneys, and leading law students. Our network includes the leading conservative legal minds in America at every level of professional success.

title: Texas Rock Climbing
descriptionSnippet: Texas Rock Climbing is the official climbing team at UT Austin, representing UT in the Collegiate Climbing Series, the national governing body for competitive collegiate climbing. The team also offers a non-competitive climbing club.
fullDescription: Texas Rock Climbing is the official climbing team at UT Austin, representing UT in the Collegiate Climbing Series, the national governing body for competitive collegiate climbing. Team members practice up to four days a week and receive instruction from Coach John Myrick, who has over 22 years of experience as a climbing coach. The team trains during the Fall Semesters and competes in local, regional, and national competitions during the Spring semesters. Additionally, the team hosts two competitions annually and builds community through participating in community competitions and volunteering on trail and climbing area cleanup projects in the Austin area.

title: Texas Rotaract
descriptionSnippet: Texas Rotaract is the university chapter of Rotary International. We pride ourselves in “service above self,” service at home and overseas, and the creation of leaders.
fullDescription:
The Rotaract Club is the university chapter of Rotary International. We pride ourselves in “service above self,” service at home and overseas, and the creation of leaders. Our sponsoring Rotary club is the Austin University Area Rotary Club.

We are a service organization, both local and international. We also interact extensively with our Rotarians.

title: Texas Roundtable
descriptionSnippet: To unite the student leaders of the spirit group community at The University of Texas in the effort to advance the community, improve risk management, and develop leadership potential.
fullDescription: To unite the student leaders of the spirit group community at The University of Texas in the effort to advance the community, improve risk management, and develop leadership potential.

title: Texas Royals
descriptionSnippet: Texas Royals was formed in honor of Darrell K. Royal, and seeks to support all University of Texas sports as well as enhance the experience of its members through social, philanthropic, leadership, and spirit activities.
fullDescription: Texas Royals seeks to enhance the college experience of its members by involvement in social, philanthropic, leadership and spirit activities. The highest pillars of Texas Royals are to create lasting friendships and strengthen the individual's tie to The University of Texas at Austin, through both academics and campus engagement.

title: Texas Rugby
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas Mens Rugby Team - Facebook.com/UTRugby - twitter.com/UTRugby - UTRFC.com- Hook 'Em
fullDescription: The University of Texas at Austin Men's Rugby team competes in the Red River Rugby Conference, playing in both 7s and 15s. We participate in the top division of college rugby, D-1A Divison of USA Rugby college rugby and are sanctioned by the Texas Rugby Union and USA Rugby. We are members of the UT Sports Club Association and are sanctioned by, and in good standing, with The University of Texas at Austin.

title: Texas Running Club
descriptionSnippet: Come see what we are all about at one of our weekly evening runs (M-Th) at 6:00pm outside Gregory Gym! All running levels and experience are welcome.
fullDescription: Texas Running Club is a UT Recreational Sports teams with a dynamic, competitive, and social atmosphere. We have participated in a multitude of races from the Longhorn Run to the Texas Independence Relay to the Boston Marathon. We welcome and invite all running levels to come join us for one of our evening runs, and see what we are all about! Texas Running Club will begin 2019 Fall Runs on August 28th at 6pm in front of Gregory Gym.

title: Texas Shabbat 500
descriptionSnippet: Texas Shabbat 500 is an annual event that welcomes students from all walks of life to participate in a Shabbat dinner with the large UT community.
fullDescription:
Shabbat 500 is a Shabbat dinner experience planned by students, for students. We're planning the largest Shabbat dinner ever to hit the UT campus, and we want you there! We aim to strengthen Jewish unity at UT while providing as many Jewish Longhorns as possible with an unbelievable Shabbat dinner experience. There are over 4000 Jewish students at UT, so we've set a goal of 500- but we're aiming for more! Come, bring your friends, and enjoy an evening of meaningful services and incredible food. The best part? It's free! If you've never been to a shabbat dinner before, now is the perfect chance. So grab your friends, reserve a table, and RSVP to join us for what is sure to be a night you'll never forget!
We look forward to seeing you!

title: Texas Sibling Network Longhorn Chapter
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Sibling Network is a place for students who have a sibling with a disability to network, learn, and get support. We understand the unique experience of growing up with a sibling with a disability and aim to provide a supportive place

title: Texas Sigma Pi Sigma
descriptionSnippet: Texas Sigma Pi Sigma is one of the few Honors organizations here on campus that service Physics majors. Despite the implication that it is exclusively for Physics Majors, Sigma Pi Sigma is for people in any major.

title: Texas Skate Club
descriptionSnippet: Texas Skate Club is an organization intended for those who enjoy skateboarding/longboarding/and other skateboard related activities and want to meet like-minded individuals on campus.
fullDescription: Texas Skate Club is an organization intended for those who enjoy skateboarding/longboarding/and other skateboard related activities and want to meet like-minded individuals on campus. In the organization, people can learn from others, help beginners, attend skating events, and create friendships. Anyone with a passion and desire to skateboard is welcome!

title: Texas Slavic Club
descriptionSnippet: Texas Slavic Club is an outreach organization that helps international Russian students and students that want to learn about Russian language/culture meet each other through volunteer and social events.
fullDescription: Texas Slavic Club is an outreach organization that helps people who want to learn the Russian language and culture, as well as aid international Russian students in adjusting to life in Austin. This club focuses on volunteer work and social events to provide a welcome community for students to join and meet new friends.

title: Texas Spirits
descriptionSnippet: To promote spirit among the students of the The University of Texas and to serve the university and the Austin community in the best way possible. Our four pillars of spirit, love, service,and friendship represent core values Texas Spirits strive to have
fullDescription: To promote spirit among students at the The University of Texas and to serve the university and Austin communities. Our four pillars of spirit, love, service,and friendship represent core values Texas Spirits strive to uphold each and everyday.

title: Texas Sports Analytics Group
descriptionSnippet: This organization uses advanced statistical analysis of big data in sports to determine more efficient ways of evaluating teams, players, and performance in sports. The purpose of this organization is to promote discussions surrounding these topics.

title: Texas Sports Law Society
descriptionSnippet: A group of UT Law students that have an interest in sports law.
fullDescription: Texas Sports Law Society is a student organization for students at The University of Texas School of Law. TSLS is open to anyone who is interested in sports law, who is an aspiring sports agents, or who is just interested in sports in general.

title: Texas Stock Team
descriptionSnippet: Texas Stock Team (TST) is an organization of The University of Texas at Austin that was created during the 2013 Spring semester. TST aims to provide more information on the technical analysis of stocks and a basic understanding of fundamental analysis.
fullDescription: Texas Stock Team (TST) is an organization of The University of Texas at Austin that was started during the Spring semester of 2013. TST aims to teach members financial concepts in valuation, accounting, corporate finance, and technical analysis.

title: Texas Student Media
descriptionSnippet: TSM is comprised of several student-produced media properties: The Daily Texan newspaper; the humor magazine Texas Travesty; the Cactus yearbook; KVRX 91.7 FM; Texas Student Television (TSTV), and BurntX.
fullDescription: Texas Student Media (TSM) is the main source for news on campus. TSM is composed of The Daily Texan newspaper, Texas Travesty, the Cactus Yearbook, KVRX 91.7 FM, TSTV-Texas Student Television, BurntX and the Advertising Department. All of these entities are run by students for students. It is a great place for students to get hands on, professional experience in a variety of communications fields that will help them succeed upon graduating from UT.

title: Texas Student Psychological Association
descriptionSnippet: Our mission is to involve students interested in psychology with opportunities available to them on and off campus.
fullDescription: TSPA is a student-run educational association targeted towards any students interested in psychology! We attract key guest speakers affiliated with UT, the community, and private practices to talk to us about their experience with psychology and various pertinent topics. TSPA is first, and foremost, a club that fosters learning and emphasizes building connections! Visit our website to learn more! (https://bit.ly/tspa-ut)

title: Texas Student Television
descriptionSnippet: TSTV is UT's very own student-run TV station! We provide student volunteers an educational and creative outlet to produce cross-media programming, which entertains, educates and enriches the lives of the student body, Austin community and other audiences
fullDescription: Texas Student Television is the University of Texas at Austin's entirely student-run television station. TSTV broadcasts student-created content all across Austin, 24 hours a day. Students create all the content on TSTV, produce the shows, manage and maintain the equipment, and oversee the budget and daily operation of the station.

title: Texas Sunshines
descriptionSnippet: Texas Sunshine’s is a group of students at UT dedicated to service, spirit, and friendship. We want to make your time at the university of Texas unforgettable and we want to make you feel at home. Texas sunshine’s wants to be your home away from home.
fullDescription: Texas Sunshine’s is a group of students at UT dedicated to service, spirit, and sisterhood. We unite with the aim of changing our community and being diverse. We bleed burnt orange and want to make your time at the university of Texas at Austin unforgettable. Texas sunshines wants to be your home away from home.

title: Texas Sweethearts
descriptionSnippet: Texas Sweethearts is an honorary service, spirit, and social student organization at the University of Texas at Austin. Members serve both the University and Austin community while promoting spirit throughout campus.
fullDescription: The Texas Sweethearts are a diverse group of young women dedicated to serving the Austin community and supporting University of Texas athletics. We strive to promote scholastic achievement, integrity, and leadership while fostering lifelong friendships among our Sweetheart sisters.

title: Texas Swing Dance Society
descriptionSnippet: To share and promote swing dancing in the UT Austin community by providing lessons and dances in a relaxed, social environment. To create a community of students also interested in preserving traditional jazz and vernacular jazz dancing.
fullDescription: Our first lesson of Spring 2019 is February 7th from 6:30-8pm at 2609 University Ave, Rm 2.106! We will no longer accept new members after the 28th. Visit us on FB for more updates and events.

title: Texas Table Tennis
descriptionSnippet: Texas Table Tennis is a club for table tennis enthusiasts of all levels to enjoy the more competitive side of collegiate table tennis. We love to introduce UT students to the sport of table tennis and guide them to improve their and have fun doing so!
fullDescription: Texas Table Tennis is a club for table tennis enthusiasts of all levels to enjoy the more competitive side of collegiate table tennis. We love to introduce UT students to the sport of table tennis and guide them to improve their and have fun doing so! We expect our members to come to practice regularly and have the desire to improve. As a team, we travel to different cities throughout Texas to participate in both team and individual tournaments. Our aim is to help members succeed in whatever goals they have set for themselves both in and out of the sport. In short, we are a fun-loving group of people with a competitive spirit. We welcome players of any skill level and would love to see you at our practice!

title: Texas Table Top
descriptionSnippet: To provide a variety of tabletop/board games for students to learn and enjoy.
fullDescription: Texas Table Top is an organization with a goal to provide a variety of tabletop/board games for UT students to learn and enjoy.  Students are welcome to come to our board game nights where they can meet students across campus while having fun!

title: Texas Taekwondo
descriptionSnippet: We kick butt, train, and compete together. All skill levels welcome! All scheduled practices are in RSC 1.138 on T/Th 7-9 pm and Sat 12-2 with additional training M/W at Belmont 904 from 7-9 pm.
fullDescription:
We train in Olympic-style Taekwondo sparring and compete at regional, state, and national tournaments in both the collegiate and open categories, including the National Collegiate Taekwondo Association's annual Championships, a USA Olympic Taekwondo endorsed event.

Practice is open to anyone regardless of martial arts experience; beginners are not only welcome but encouraged to join - historically, over half of the incoming club members have never done Taekwondo before.

title: Texas Tai Chi
descriptionSnippet: Staff interest group that is open to anyone to share the art and practice of tai chi.
fullDescription:
Texas Tai Chi is a registered organization at The University of Texas at Austin dedicated to the practice of tai chi. Anyone – student or staff – from the university community is welcome to join us. Our group began in the summer of 2010 practicing behind Anna Hiss Gym. To make our classes accessible to everyone, there are no dues or fees. Our group is led by Jen Shipman.
Subscribe to the Texas Tai Chi e-mail list for updates and cancellations.

title: Texas Talaash
descriptionSnippet: Texas Talaash is UT Austin's premier Bollywood fusion dance team. Founded in 2019, Talaash aims to display a mixture of South Asian and Contemporary culture through dance performances across the nation and at UT events.
fullDescription: Texas Talaash aims to display a mixture of South Asian and Contemporary culture through dance performances across the nation and at UT events. In our first year, our goal is to have fun while learning an art form that is sacred to the South Asian culture, while bringing it to the spotlight with a modern twist.

title: Texas Tap
descriptionSnippet: To provide a creative and active outlet on UT campus with tap dancing.

title: Texas Theme Park Engineering Group
descriptionSnippet: Our purpose is to expose engineering students to the industry of Theme Park and Amusement entertainment by conducting hands on activities that allow them to have design experience. We also hope to expose them to other TPEG groups in the country.
fullDescription: Our purpose is to expose engineering students to the industry of Theme Park and Amusement entertainment by conducting hands on activities that allow them to have design experience. We also hope to expose them to other TPEG groups in the country (Ohio State and Penn State to name two), and many industry professionals.

title: Texas THON
descriptionSnippet: Texas THON is a student-run philanthropy at The University of Texas that raises funds and awareness for Dell Children's Medical Center of Central Texas - our local Children's Miracle Network Hospital, right here in Austin.
fullDescription: Texas THON is a student-run philanthropy that raises awareness and funds for Dell Children’s Medical Center of Central Texas – our local Children’s Miracle Network Hospital. Texas THON unites the Austin community to help provide children with necessary medical treatment and serve all families, regardless of their ability to pay. We seek to help promote not only health but confidence in the lives of our Miracle Kids and their families. Our year-round fundraising efforts culminate in a 12-hour spring event where our Miracle Makers stand For The Kids (FTK!).

title: Texas Tower Communications
descriptionSnippet: A student-run communications firm working exclusively with non-profits in the Austin area.
fullDescription: Student run communications firm that exclusively helps a variety of nonprofits in the Austin area. Together we make up a community of driven students who seek to gain experience in the communications field while giving back to the community.

title: Texas Transfer Students
descriptionSnippet: Texas Transfer Students is an organization built by transfer students, for transfer students. Our goal is to make the transition to UT successful for new and returning transfer students.
fullDescription: We are Texas Transfer Students, a student organization at the University of Texas at Austin. We're an academic and social club on campus created by transfer students, for transfer students, and our goal is to help others have an easy transition to UT. We want everyone to feel at home at such a big school and become a part of the Longhorn community. With weekly socials, study nights, a mentorship program, and more, we aspire to help others meet new people and achieve their academic and personal goals while finding their UT family. Drop by one of our biweekly meetings or check out one of our many of events upcoming up, and come get to know us!

title: Texas Trap and Skeet
descriptionSnippet: Our goal is to engage UT students and faculty in the recreational aspect of shotgun sports as well as to compete locally and nationally at a collegiate level as a shotgun shooting team....
fullDescription: Texas Trap and Skeet is a student run Rec Sport at the University of Texas at Austin, that works to engage UT students and faculty in shotgun sports events with a focus on skeet, trap, sporting clays, and five stand. We have both casual and competitive members and send squads to compete at the local, state, and national levels.

title: Texas Triathlon
descriptionSnippet: Texas Triathlon is a club that provides consistent group workouts, training, and support for triathlon and endurance races.
fullDescription: Texas Triathlon is a club that provides consistent group workouts, training, and support for triathlon and endurance races. We are a group of fun, health-conscious athletes with various interests and backgrounds and enjoy working out together. We also have a wide range of skill levels, and we are beginner friendly. If you have any interest in joining our ridiculously good-looking group of fun people, don't hesitate to contact LillieAnne, our President, at president@texastriathlon.org!

title: Texas Tribe
descriptionSnippet: Texas Tribe is a coed social-service organization that seeks to provide an environment that encourages individuality and expression. In addition to providing a unique college experience, Texas Tribe aspires to make an impact of UT and the city of Austin.
fullDescription: Texas Tribe is a coed social-service organization that seeks to provide an environment that encourages/ inspires individuality and creative expression amongst all its members. In addition to providing a unique college experience, Texas Tribe aspires to make an impact on UT and the city of Austin through community involvement. Through all of this, Texas Tribe seeks to cultivate close-knit, authentic relationships amongst its members who compose tribe.

title: Texas Undergraduate Investment Team
descriptionSnippet: 18 members. $35,000 portfolio. Founded in 2007. The first, premier investment team at UT Austin.
fullDescription: TUIT is the first, premier investment team at The University of Texas at Austin. Founded in 2007 by Eric Chang and James Peng, the organization offers members a tangible finance-oriented education, a culture of mentorship, and a network for career development. Members learn about investing and financial modeling through the qualitative and quantitative analysis, and we focus on developing critical thinking skills that are transferable to any career. TUIT also prides itself on its investment returns and strategy. Our small team dynamic and strong culture of mentorship helps each member pursue their own personal and career goals and ultimately Pay it Forward—our motto.

title: Texas Undergraduate Law Review
descriptionSnippet: A law journal written, edited and published entirely by undergraduate students.
fullDescription: Texas Undergraduate Law Review is a biannual publication consisting of law-oriented articles written and edited entirely by undergraduate students. The purpose of the organization is to give undergraduate pre-law student members experience working for a law review.

title: Texas Undergraduate Moot Court Team
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of TUMCT is to give students a way to develop and practice moot court skills that can be used in all facets of life in addition to providing members of the University of Texas at Austin community exposure to the appellate courts.

title: Texas Undergraduate Research Journal
descriptionSnippet: The URJ produces an annual student produced journal that publishes research done by undergraduates at UT Austin. Additionally, the URJ hosts panels & workshops throughout the year to expose students to broad topics in research and research writing.
fullDescription: The Texas Undergraduate Research Journal (URJ) is responsible for publishing an annual academic journal with articles by Texas students who have engaged in independent research projects. We also organize various events throughout the academic year to promote student engagement with research on campus.

title: Texas UNICEF
descriptionSnippet: Texas UNICEF serves to educate the campus and community about UNICEF's child survival work, advocate awareness of child survival issues, and raise funds to help children in our local community and around the world.
fullDescription: Texas UNICEF serves to educate the campus and community about UNICEF's child survival work, advocate awareness of child survival issues, and raise funds to help children in our local community and around the world.

title: Texas Veterans in Business
descriptionSnippet: Represents and supports the veteran community within the McCombs School of Business, while working to facilitate large-scale integration with other McCombs organizations, veteran organizations and the Texas community at large.

title: Texas Wake
descriptionSnippet: Texas Wake is the official Wakeboarding Team of UT. Texas Wake gives UT riders the chance to learn/further develop their wakeboarding skills and connect with great friends. We compete in collegiate level competitions nationwide. No experience necessary!
fullDescription: Texas Wake is the official Wakeboarding team of the University of Texas. It is a club in which UT wakeboarders and wakesurfers can connect and ride. We teach beginners as well as help experienced riders progress their skills. Texas Wake goes out on our boat multiple times a week for 4 hours each day, during which members can wakeboard or wakesurf. We have also recently set up a deal with Next Level Ride Cable Park, so every Texas Wake member gets a season pass, enabling them to wakeboard to their heart's content. We also compete (optional) at the collegiate level in various competitions nationwide. No experience necessary!

title: Texas Wesley UMCM
descriptionSnippet: We are a Christian campus ministry sponsored by the United Methodist Church, but invite students from all backgrounds to join in and participate. Our mission is to glorify God alone, exemplify Christ, and encourage other towards a personal relationship.
fullDescription: We are a Christian campus ministry sponsored by the United Methodist Church, but invite students from all backgrounds to join in and participate. Our mission is to glorify God alone, exemplify Christ, and encourage other towards a personal relationship with Him

title: Texas Women in Economics
descriptionSnippet: As a group we will encourage the career and academic developments of all women-identifying UT students who are interested in economics.
fullDescription: As a group we will encourage the career and academic developments of all women-identifying UT students who are interested in economics.

title: Texas Women's Club Lacrosse
descriptionSnippet: The nationally competitive, women's lacrosse club at The University of Texas at Austin. Texas Fight, y'all. Travels to: California and Colorado Scrimmages in Fall/Games in Spring Practices from 7-9 on Tues-Thurs in the Spring
fullDescription: Lacrosse tournaments, scrimmages. practices and social related events.

title: Texas Women's Rugby
descriptionSnippet: Promote rugby among university students, faculty, and staff. Anyone, regardless of experience, is welcome to join us at practice and learn about rugby! See our website for practice locations and times, and a match schedule: texaswomensrugby.weebly.com
fullDescription: Promote rugby among university students, faculty, and staff. Anyone, regardless of experience, is welcome to join us at practice and learn about rugby! We practice T/Th 6-8 PM at UT's intramural fields. See our website for more information at: https://texaswomensrugby.weebly.com/

title: Texas Wranglers
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Wranglers is a group of men dedicated to serving the Austin community, acting as the primary spirit group for the Men's Basketball Team, and striving for excellence in scholarship, leadership, and athletic ability. www.texaswranglers.org
fullDescription: The Texas Wranglers is a group of men dedicated to serving the Austin community, acting as the primary spirit group for the Men's Basketball Team, and striving for excellence in scholarship, leadership, and athletic ability.

title: Texas Wushu
descriptionSnippet: We study and practice the modern Chinese Martial Arts known as Wushu
fullDescription: We are UT's wushu club. What is wushu? It is Chinese martial arts. Basically, it's the stuff you see Jet Li, Jackie Chan, etc do in the movies, but with weapons. That's right, not only we do marital arts forms, but we also use swords, staffs, and fans. So come hang out with us. All skill levels are welcome!

title: TexASHRAE
descriptionSnippet: ASHRAE is a building technology society that focuses on building systems, energy efficiency, indoor air quality and sustainability within the industry. ASHRAE's mission is to advance the arts and sciences of heating, ventilating, air conditioning and r...
fullDescription: ASHRAE is a building technology society that focuses on building systems, energy efficiency, indoor air quality and sustainability within the industry. ASHRAE's mission is to advance the arts and sciences of heating, ventilating, air conditioning and refrigerating to serve humanity and promote a sustainable world. Student Branch Members have the opportunity to widen their skills and advance their knowledge of the field, attend presentations, go on campus and facility tours, work on real-world projects, and network with area engineering professionals.

title: Thai Association of Austin
descriptionSnippet: Thai Association of Austin was founded since 1973 with the mission to foster the Thai community and Thai culture in Austin. We organize social and cultural events for our members and provide any needs for new members.
fullDescription: 1. Provide transportation and lodging for the new coming students

title: The Annette Strauss Institute For Civic Life
descriptionSnippet: The Annette Strauss Institute for Civic Life exists to cultivate informed voters and active citizens. We do so through research, education, and outreach programs focused on three key pillars: civic discovery, young people, and civil dialogue.

title: The Association of Black Psychologists
descriptionSnippet: Texas Student Circle of Association of Black Psychologists (ABPsi) mission is to promote professional development, Black Psychology and mental health awareness at The University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: Hello!

title: The Austin Meal Movement
descriptionSnippet: Do you like to cook and would love to share your talent to help the society? “The Austin Meal Movement” is an organization made to help the Austin community through cooking.
fullDescription: The Austin Meal Movement is an organization started in order to bring all food lovers together.

title: The Bass Team at the University of Texas
descriptionSnippet: Provide a social environment for students interested in tournament bass fishing.
fullDescription: The Bass Team at the University of Texas provides a competitive and social environment for students who have interest in fishing. The club participates in collegiate tournaments against schools from across the nation. The team goes on multiple camping trips throughout the year where we camp at night and fish during the day. In addition to tournaments and camping trips, the team regularly fishes in and around Austin on Ladybird Lake and Lake Austin. If you have a love for the outdoors and/or are interested in meeting a great group of guys and girls, this is the club for you.

title: The Center for Students in Recovery
descriptionSnippet: The Center for Students in Recovery (CSR) supports students recovering from addictions at the University of Texas at Austin.
fullDescription: The Center for Students in Recovery (CSR) supports students recovering from addictions at the University of Texas at Austin. We offer programming, resources, and activities that provide a pathway to both recovery and academic achievement. Since its founding in 2004, hundreds of students have turned to us for support. Our goal is to help students in recovery stay in recovery while enrolled here. We also welcome students curious about sobriety to explore, experience, and understand recovery at UT.

title: The Crafty Society
descriptionSnippet: We are an organization dedicated to giving students a fun, creative environment to express themselves. If you love crafting, have a passion for creating art, or enjoy doing DIY projects, than the Crafty Society is the perfect club for you!
fullDescription: Are you interested art, crafting, and DIY projects? Are you interested in creative projects that give back to your community? Do you want to explore more art scenes around Austin? If you answered yes to any of those questions, then the Crafty Society is the perfect org for you.

title: The Crow's Nest
descriptionSnippet: The mission of The Crow's Nest is to develop members mentally, morally and physically and to imbue them with the highest ideals of duty, and loyalty, and with the core values of honor, courage and commitment in order to commission graduates and officers.

title: The Fruits
descriptionSnippet: Christians gather together to worship and have fellowship in Jesus Christ.

title: The Gathering ATX
descriptionSnippet: A collective of students bringing in Austin worship leaders for campus wide nights of worship in the heart of UT.
fullDescription: The Gathering ATX is intended to bring students together by hosting worship events on campus at the University of Texas at Austin. The Gathering’s mission is to unify the Christian community through worship and to connect students to the body of Christ.

title: The Greek and Cypriot Society
descriptionSnippet: Welcome to the official page of The Greek and Cypriot Society of The University of Texas at Austin. The primary aims of the society are to bring all Greeks, Cypriots, and philhellenes in Austin together, promote the Greek culture, traditions, and values.

title: The Health and Society Collective
descriptionSnippet: An organization for Health and Society majors to meet and discuss topics of interest and share advice
fullDescription: The goal of HSC is to bring together UT students in the Health and Society major as well as students interested in health care policy and administration.

title: The House Campus Ministry
descriptionSnippet: We're designed to thrive, not survive. Are you desiring a community to build you up? The House is what you're looking for. EVERYONE is welcome to The House. We want to connect you to good people, a good church, and a good God! Come out and join us!
fullDescription: There's more to life than just surviving. We're designed to thrive. If you desire a community that is willing to fight for you and build you up, then The House is the answer to all your questions.

title: The Impact Movement - UT Austin Chapter
descriptionSnippet: The Mission of The Impact Movement is to take the truth of Jesus Christ to the campus, community and world by producing leaders of African descent who are spiritually focused, financially responsible and morally fit.
fullDescription: The Vision of The Impact Movement is to see each community of African descent fulfill its destiny as a reflection of the redemptive power of Jesus Christ.

title: The Language Campaign
descriptionSnippet: The Language Campaign is intended to facilitate conversational language exchange between students by connecting English as Second Language students in Austin high schools with UT students learning a second language.

title: The Latino Pan-Hellenic Council
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of the Latino Pan-Hellenic Council is to act as a governing body, which serves to unify the Latino/a Fraternal Organizations. In addition to increase awareness, increase interest in and strengthen Latino/a community on campus....
fullDescription: The purpose of the Latino Pan-Hellenic Council is to act as a governing body, which serves to unify the Latino/a Fraternal Organizations. In addition to increase awareness, increase interest in and strengthen Latino/a community on campus.

title: The Longhorn Rocketry Association
descriptionSnippet: The Longhorn Rocketry Association is a student-run organization which designs, builds, and tests high-power rockets. We aim to provide hands-on experience with industry-standard design processes, fabrication techniques, and testing and launch procedures.
fullDescription: The Longhorn Rocketry Association is a student-run organization at the University of Texas which designs, builds, and tests high-power rockets. Through this, we aim to provide hands-on experience with industry-standard design processes, fabrication techniques, and testing and launch procedures.

title: The Multicultural Engagement Center (MEC)
descriptionSnippet: The MEC (SAC 1.102) is a hangout space for all students located in the Student Activity Center. We exist to promote social justice and diversity on campus and house six student-led agencies. Come by and check us out!
fullDescription: The Multicultural Engagement Center (MEC; SAC 1.102), formerly Multicultural Information Center, has been on campus for 25 years.  We are a hangout space for all students as often serve as a 'home away from home' for many.  We are open 8-6PM weekly.  Please stop by and to use our multiple computer stations, outlets, watch tv, study desks, or to talk/hangout with our five full-time dedicated staff!

title: The Onyx Honor Society
descriptionSnippet: Honor Society to recognize and inspire students of color at UT.
fullDescription: The mission of this organization is to inspire and recognize students of color at The University of Texas at Austin who strive for the advancement and inclusivity of the black community through academic excellence, leadership, and community engagement.

title: The Project
descriptionSnippet: The Project is a single-day service event open to the entire UT community. The event promotes connections between the UT and greater Austin communities through volunteering. Project 2020 will take place during February 2020.
fullDescription: Our goal is to provide an opportunity for the UT community to volunteer together, create an impact, and most importantly, provide a chance to connect with underserved neighborhoods in Austin. By acting as a unified student body, we are able to share our overarching passion for service with the community we serve, resulting in a tangible impacts within the area and hearts we touch. The Project is UT's largest day of organized service in which approximately 15-20 different sites, each with unique activities, are assisted and beautified. Examples of the tasks we complete include are planting, mulching, painting buildings, painting murals, and building fences.

title: The Ransom Notes
descriptionSnippet: To promote, rehearse, and perform an extensive variety of a cappella music for the enjoyment of ourselves and others.
fullDescription: To promote, rehearse, and perform an extensive variety of a cappella music for the enjoyment of ourselves and others.

title: The Review of Litigation
descriptionSnippet: Publication of 4 issues of The Review of Litigation at UT Law to national and international readership.
fullDescription: Publication of 4 issues of The Review of Litigation at UT Law to national and international readership.

title: The SOC
descriptionSnippet: The Student Organization serves as the front lines for the Student Activities area of the Office of the Dean of Students.

title: The Texas Backyardigens
descriptionSnippet: We go hiking with cameras and sketch books in our backpacks.
fullDescription: McKinney Falls. Bull Creek. Wild Basin Wilderness Preserve. The Texas Backyardigens do it all. We are a hiking club that meets every other weekend to explore the outdoors. We frequently stop to take photos and sketch the surrounding nature. There is no minimum skill level or membership fee required for the club; anybody is welcome to join! Check out our Instagram and Facebook and please join our GroupMe to stay updated with our hiking schedule and upcoming events: https://groupme.com/join_group/43358794/R38g9Z

title: The Texas Law Aggie Society
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Law Aggie Association seeks to strengthen ties between students, Texas A&M UT Law alumni, and the Austin community.
fullDescription: The vision for the Texas Law Aggie Association is two-fold. First, the Texas Law Aggie Association is going to build and strengthen the community of Aggies at the University by hosting events to bring students together and by bringing in alumni who are interested in mentoring students. Additionally, the organization will be finding ways to serve the legal community, as well as, give back and carry on both school's traditions of helping others though fundraising and hands-on work.

title: The Texas Orator
descriptionSnippet: The Texas Orator is a nonpartisan political review that was founded and is maintained by University of Texas students. We value thorough analysis in our publications and strive to protect free speech and unhindered access to information on campus.
fullDescription: The Texas Orator is a nonpartisan, peer-reviewed political publication that was founded and is maintained by University of Texas students. We value thorough analysis in our publications and strive to protect the ideals of free speech and unhindered access to information on campus and nationwide. We seek to keep the student body informed of the implications of ever-changing political climates, both domestically and abroad, from a range of voices and perspectives.

title: The Thomistic Institute at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: The Thomistic Institute exists to promote Catholic truth in our contemporary world by strengthening the intellectual formation of Christians at universities and elsewhere. The thought of St. Thomas Aquinas, is our touchstone.

title: The Triple Helix at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: The Texas TTH chapter strives to discuss relevant scientific and ethical issues using a research-based perspective.
fullDescription: Our organization's goal is to produce an ePublication each year that discusses relevant scientific and ethical issues using a research-based perspective. We emphasize the intersection between science, society, and law through the critical analysis of new scientific findings both in the global scientific community as well as the free exchange of ideas at The University of Texas at Austin. It is not simply a rehashing of old research, but rather a forum where undergraduate authors can disseminate original and creative thoughts about previously done and ongoing work and research. Our team consists of writers, editors, and designers.

title: The University of Texas at Austin Student Foundation
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas at Austin Student Foundation is dedicated to creating a culture of philanthropy on the UT campus.
fullDescription: What We're About

title: The University of Texas at Austin: Pre-Law Division of The National Black Law Students Association/ Longhorn Chapter
descriptionSnippet: The chapter will allow undergraduate students interested in law school to get a first hand look at what it takes to get into law school, law school exam, prep courses, and even shadowing a law student. Pre-LAw NBLSA bridges the gap between the aspiring...
fullDescription: The purpose of the Pre-Law Division is to articulate and promote the educational, professional, political and social needs and goals of African American pre-law students. By implementing functions on the law school admission process and advocating for the community. Pre-Law NBLSA bridges the gap between the aspiring law student and the actual law student. This organization is open to all aspiring law students regardless of race, color, religion, sex or national origin.

title: The University of Texas Elementary School
descriptionSnippet: We are a public charter that provides outstanding education for young East Austin students free of charge, while also training new educators from UT Austin and collaborating with our partner schools for the most positive outcomes for all students.
fullDescription:
The University of Texas Elementary School's Mission is:

(1) To develop students into lifelong learners through rigorous, research-based curricula, individualized instruction, high expectations, and a nurturing environment that includes parental and community involvement;

(2) To provide opportunities for professional development and outreach for The University of Texas at Austin’s academic units; and

(3) To serve as a model of an exemplary educational program for diverse learners.

title: Theta Chi Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: The Delta Mu chapter of Theta Chi fraternity is comprised of gentleman who are not only leaders in the classroom but leaders in their communities and student organizations as well. Theta Chi strives to remain active on campus and the Austin community.
fullDescription: The purpose of Theta Chi is to give men at UT the opportunity to be a part of a truly life-changing experience by providing them with the tools to grow as a student, leader, and man. Theta Chi is not just another club, but an organization of men with the desire to build lifetime friendships and devote time to develop values. Theta Chi teaches, inspires, and empowers any member to be successful both inside and outside of the classroom and throughout their lives.

title: Theta Tau - Professional Engineering Fraternity
descriptionSnippet: The Purpose of Theta Tau is to develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members, and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship. Come check out our website at http://texasthetatau.org!
fullDescription: The Purpose of Theta Tau is to develop and maintain a high standard of professional interest among its members, and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship. Come check out our website at http://texasthetatau.org!

title: TILE at The University of Texas at Austin
descriptionSnippet: A speaker series involving talks on Innovation, Leadership, and Entrepreneurship.
fullDescription: TILE talks are the free events that chapters organize and operate. Each season has a few events taking place one weekday evening a month. Each event features a 30-40 minute on-stage interview with a local innovator, leader, or entrepreneur, followed by 20-30 minutes of questions from the audience.

title: Together Texas
descriptionSnippet: Texas Real Beauty stages a yearly campaign focusing on the topic of redefining beauty during the month of October. Each year, the campaign includes events such as the chalkboard walk, free yoga, open mics, and documentary screenings to bring UT together
fullDescription: Our mission is to help people of the UT campus and greater Austin community break the barriers that restrict their self-confidence through redefining the idea of beauty and to create a community of people who embrace their imperfections and evaluate their worth based on their heart, soul, and mind.

title: Trout Unlimited at The University of Texas
descriptionSnippet: UT's premier and most active fly fishing club with about 40 members that brings fly fishing and river conservancy to the University of Texas community. This is done through group float trips, river clean ups, and other outreach events.
fullDescription: An active fly fishing club with about 40 members that brings fly fishing and river conservancy to the University of Texas community. This is done through group float trips, river clean ups, and other outreach events.

title: Turing Scholars Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The Turing Scholars Student Association is an association for students in the Turing Scholars Honors Program of the Computer Science Department.
fullDescription: The Turing Scholars Student Association is an association for students in the Turing Scholars Honors Program. The Turing Scholars Honors Program is an honors program for computer science (CS) majors and is housed in the Department of Computer Science. Our goals as an organization are to develop better community within the Turing Scholars and provide support for theses.

title: TX Human Development and Family Sciences
descriptionSnippet: TX HDFS is a student organization welcome to all who are interested in exploring topics and opportunities relevant to development and family sciences.
fullDescription: TX HDFS exists to create a network of students, graduate students, faculty, and advisors that fosters community and opportunity regarding developmental and relationship science for majors and non-majors alike.

title: TX Votes
descriptionSnippet: To register students and educate them on voting and take a more active role in government.
fullDescription: TX Votes is a nonpartisan political student organization dedicated to creating more voters and better citizens. We promote voter registration and remind students to update their addresses, as well as educate on voter ID laws and elections. During off election cycles, we hold meetings to educate on public policy, discuss important issues in an open and judgment-free space, and encourage civil discourse.

title: Type Texas: The CDN Chapter at UT Austin
descriptionSnippet: Type Texas: The CDN Chapter at UT Austin aims to connect, inspire, and empower individuals living with diabetes.
fullDescription: Type Texas: The College Diabetes Network (CDN) Chapter at UT Austin was founded for the purpose of connecting college students with or affected by diabetes, in the hopes that these connections will create a support network thats enables students to fulfill their potentials long after their time on The Forty Acres.

title: Tzu Chi Collegiate Association Austin Chapter
descriptionSnippet: TCCA welcomes all who are interested in serving the community as a family of volunteers! We aim to provide international relief at a local level because we believe that through simple acts of kindness, together, we can make a significant impact.
fullDescription: Tzu Chi Collegiate Association (TCCA) welcomes all who are interested in serving the community as a family of volunteers! Tzu Chi means "compassion relief," and TCCA is part of the Tzu Chi Foundation, which is an international non-governmental humanitarian organization registered under the United Nations. Our members aim to provide international relief at a local level because we believe that through simple acts of kindness, together, we can make a significant impact.

title: UKirk Longhorn Presbyterian Fellowship
descriptionSnippet: Our organization meets weekly over lunch to build a faith community. We create lasting friendships, support one another through our studies, engage in current events and serve our community. Follow us on Facebook.
fullDescription: Our organization meets weekly over lunch to build a faith community. We create lasting friendships, support one another through our studies, engage in current events and serve our community. Follow us on Facebook.

title: Umoja
descriptionSnippet: Umoja is a sister of women of color who has a mission to inspire other women of color at The University of Texas at Austin to be politically and socially pro-active, culturally responsible, resolute in empowering women, and apologetically beautiful.
fullDescription: Umoja has a mission to inspire women of color at The University of Texas at Austin to be politically and socially pro-active, culturally responsible, and resolute in empowering women.

title: Undergraduate Architecture Student Council
descriptionSnippet: To promote and develop an awareness of the built environment, serve as a nucleus for student activities and interests, serve as a liaison for the students to the faculty administration and the professional in architecture....
fullDescription: To promote and develop an awareness of the built environment, serve as a nucleus for student activities and interests, serve as a liaison for the students to the faculty administration and the professional in architecture.

title: Undergraduate Business Council
descriptionSnippet: By serving as the umbrella organization for the McCombs School of Business, the Undergraduate Business Council's mission is to help organize and unite the McCombs Affiliated Student Organizations to make a strong student body that supports its school.
fullDescription: The Undergraduate Business Council serves as a vital link between the students of the McCombs School of Business administration, faculty, and the professional world. Through student-led programs and activities, UBC educates and informs the McCombs student body about academic issues, professional topics, and general interests. By serving as the umbrella organization for McCombs, UBC's mission is to help organize and unite the McCombs Affiliated Student Organizations to make a strong student body that supports its school.

title: Undergraduate Chemical Engineering Women
descriptionSnippet: UChEW is an organization dedicated to providing an academic, professional, and social network for undergraduate women in the McKetta Department of Chemical Engineering. UChEW is open to both women and men.

title: Undergraduate Computational Finance Team
descriptionSnippet: Texas Undergraduate Computational Finance is a student run trading organization that educates UT undergraduates about quantitative methods in finance.

title: Undergraduate French Society
descriptionSnippet: We meet Mondays 5-6 pm in HRH 2.118 (with food!) Throughout the semester we will have events about French film, culinary, vocabulary, and cultural outings. We are open to all levels of French speakers, even total beginners, so come on out!
fullDescription: The Undergraduate French Society meets weekly to work on French language skills and increase cultural knowledge. The organization is open to all levels of learners from absolute beginners to fluent speakers. We learn vocabulary sets, watch French films, learn about French culinary, and have guest visits from French-speaking people in Austin. Throughout the year we have social events, and volunteer events to help build language proficiency. For members enrolled in French courses at UT we provide study resources such as Quizlet sets and study guides.

title: Undergraduate Geological Society
descriptionSnippet: To provide an organization for undergraduate students interested in the Earth Sciences to unite in a social and professional environment. Our aims and ambitions are to foster lasting relationships between members.
fullDescription: To provide an organization for undergraduate geology students to unite in a social and professional environment.

title: Undergraduate Linguistics Society
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas Undergraduate Linguistics Society was created to assist undergraduates at UT become involved in their field through tutoring, research, collaboration, and inspiration.
fullDescription: Undergraduate Linguistics Society was created to foster interest in linguistics among UT students through tutoring, research, collaboration, and easy connection with professors, grad students, and fellow undergrads.

title: Undergraduate Mock Trial Association
descriptionSnippet: We compete in mock trial against the best universities in the country. Learn from real trial attorneys, strengthen your understanding of the law, and hone critical thinking and speaking skills as part of our traveling team.
fullDescription: Mock Trial is a fantastic way to get involved at UT if you're interested in law school, debate, or being in a competitive team atmosphere! You do not have to be pre-law to join. We especially encourage freshmen and sophomores to try out but we also take upper classmen.

title: Undergraduate Studies Council
descriptionSnippet: Undergraduate Studies Council (UGSC) is the official college council and student representative body of the School of Undergraduate Studies at the University of Texas at Austin. Through our actions, we empower the UGS community to explore all of UT.
fullDescription: Undergraduate Studies Council (UGSC), or UGS Council is the official college council in the Senate of College Councils and student representative body of the School of Undergraduate Studies at the University of Texas at Austin. Through our actions, we empower the UGS community to explore all of UT and help them find their place at the university, while fostering leadership skills needed to become leaders in any field they enter into.

title: Undergraduate Women in Physics
descriptionSnippet: Promote the retention and success of undergraduate women and minorites in physics.
fullDescription: UT UWIP welcomes all who are dedicated to promoting gender equality within physics by providing a supportive community whose members share their experiences, advice, and ideas. We provide our members with outreach opportunities both within UT and the greater Austin area as well as resources for developing their future careers.

title: United Muslim Relief Texas
descriptionSnippet: United Muslims Relief Texas aims to provide relief to those in the local community with a focus on building the future leaders of our community while improving ourselves in the service of others.
fullDescription: UMR Texas utilizes a unique approach and relief, allowing young people to be involved in the transformative process of serving other from start to finish. We are a diverse group of students and volunteers who strive on a daily basis to implement targeted, cost-effective relief and development programs that improve lives. Our motto, "Development Through Service" bears a message of changing lives at both ends: those who need our help and those who want help from others.

title: University Democrats
descriptionSnippet: To promote candidates and ideals of the Democratic Party and increase political awareness and activity in the University community. General meetings are Wednesdays at 8 in RLP 0.128.
fullDescription: To promote candidates and ideals of the Democratic Party and increase political awareness and activity in the University community.

title: University Fashion Group
