descriptionSnippet: University Fashion Group is a student organization whose mission is to inform and promote fashion principles from the arts, sciences, and humanities through community outreach, campus activities, and real world application to build a local community

title: University Filmmakers' Alliance
descriptionSnippet: UFA is open to all UT students and encourages them to create films with fellow students. Bi-weekly meetings with local film community guests, group filmmaking challenges, and movie screenings.
fullDescription: The University Filmmakers Alliance is a registered student organization at the University of Texas Austin. The organization is open to all UT students and encourages them to create films with fellow students. UFA was founded in 1997 when several Radio/Television/Film students felt they were not given enough experience by the department. Over the years, many students aspiring in film have met and created movies together, received internships or jobs, and have become acquinted with industry professionals.

title: University Finance Association
descriptionSnippet: The University Finance Association provides students interested in the world of finance with a diverse network of over 200 member & Alumni. Our corporate speakers augment classroom instruction by teaching us about corporate culture and various careers.
fullDescription: The University Finance Association provides students interested in the world of finance with a diverse network of over 200 member & Alumni. Our corporate speakers augment classroom instrucion by teaching us about corporate culture, various careers, & industry characteristics. Members are also able to share their experiences with interviewing, work, & companies.

title: University Financial Planning Association
descriptionSnippet: We aim to provide detailed financial education to our fellow Longhorns, to aid their financial planning efforts in both career and personal endeavors, and thoroughly explore the field of wealth management and financial planning.
fullDescription: This organization will introduce McCombs students, along with students from other colleges, to the field of financial planning as well as important personal finance topics. Our hope is to encourage students to find a career that pushes them to better themselves, and help others in the process. Financial planning is about working with clients and tailoring their finances to meet with what they want to accomplish. It is a field for people that have a compelling interest in finance, business, service, psychology, etc., and want a rewarding job. We would teach the different aspects of finance that financial planning deals with; budgeting, debt management, estate planning, retirement planning, basic investing (practice with examples to apply what was taught), saving, etc. Through guest speakers, lessons, social events, networking (members may speak to professionals who come and speak after the presentation), we hope to create a safe environment for students to collaborate and learn these important life skills.

title: University Flying Club
descriptionSnippet: We are the University Flying Club, a group of people who share an interest in aviation and have a love for our beloved Longhorns!
fullDescription: Welcome to the University Flying Club! We're a group of aviation lovers based in the Austin area and provide a social atmosphere to all who are interested in flying. Throughout the school year we'll plan on having meetings, special guests and fly-outs. Join our email list and social media pages to learn more!

title: University Health Services
descriptionSnippet: University Health Services (UHS), located in the Student Services Building, is an on-campus healthcare facility just like your family doctor and more.
fullDescription: University Health Services is a high quality, on-campus healthcare facility. UHS provides general medicine, urgent care, women’s health, sports medicine, physical therapy, nutrition services, allergy shots, and immunization/ travel medicine services, which are supported by in-house laboratory and radiology departments.

title: University Interfaith Council
descriptionSnippet: UIC is a student run interfaith council where students from a variety of spiritual backgrounds come together, learn about one another, and work together on various projects.
fullDescription: The University Interfaith Council is an interfaith organization that promotes diversity and learning on a spiritual level. Students have the opportunity to explore and learn about different faiths as well as collaborate with other students on service projects. The goal of UIC is to form a bridge of communication between various religious groups and the students in them.

title: University Investors Association
descriptionSnippet: University Investors Association prepares students for various careers in the business world while creating an open environment for students to come together and learn about finance, economics and investing.
fullDescription: Welcome to University Investors Association at The University of Texas at Austin. If money, investing, finance and the economy pique your interest, then UIA is for you.

title: University Leadership Initiative
descriptionSnippet: We are an undocumented youth-led organization that advocates for the rights of the undocumented community at the local, state, and national levels focusing on education equity, DACA implementation, deportation defense, LGBTQ inclusion, and legislation.
fullDescription: University Leadership Initiative (ULI) is an Austin community and UT student organization composed of undocumented students and allies organizing around immigrant rights on the local, state, and national level and serves as a support system for undocumented members of the UT and Austin communities.  We educate our community about their rights, fight and prevent deportations, bring resources to our community including free DACA forums and clinics, fight bad and uplift good legislation (especially in the Texas legislature), work with local schools to educate undocumented students and their educators about access to higher education, and, along with many other things, EMPOWER our members to stand up, fight back, and shape the future!

title: University Leadership Network
descriptionSnippet: The University Leadership Network (ULN) is a nationally recognized incentive-based scholarship program for students with demonstrated financial need. Each year, 500 freshmen are selected to begin the program.
fullDescription: The University Leadership Network (ULN) is a nationally recognized incentive-based scholarship program for students with demonstrated financial need. Each year, 500 freshmen are selected to begin the program. ULN includes a comprehensive four-year plan that involves leadership training, experiential learning opportunities, and university service. The ULN program helps students to develop academic and leadership skills consistent with graduating in four years.

title: University Lutheran Church - Austin Chapter
descriptionSnippet: To celebrate in worship and the instruction of the Gospel of Jesus Christ as communicated from a Lutheran perspective. We worship every Sunday at 5 pm and follow up with dinner.
fullDescription: Lutheran Student Fellowship is a student organization that meets and worships every Sunday at 5 pm. We enjoy dinner together after every service!

title: University Management & Business Research Association
descriptionSnippet: We profoundly disagree with the notion, "if it ain't broke, don't fix it". The University Management & Business Research Association--UMBRA--creates innovative solutions and augments potential gains for UT departments and local companies.
fullDescription:
We profoundly disagree with the notion, "if it ain't broke, don't fix it". Rather, we see the world through an entrepreneurial lens: how things should or could be. 

The University Management & Business Research Association--UMBRA--creates innovative solutions and augments potential gains for UT departments and local companies. We develop recommendations through reputable, industry-derived Design Thinking and Lead User methodologies. Quality-assurance is ascertained by a membership of interdisciplinary, driven students. 

By completing these projects, our members build upon their ideation, problem-solving, and leadership capabilities, while acquiring a highly marketable and applicable skillset for generating solutions.

title: University of Texas - American Pharmacists Association - Academy of Student Pharmacists
descriptionSnippet: The mission of APhA-ASP is to be the collective voice of student pharmacists, to provide opportunities for professional growth, to improve patient care, and to envision and advance the future of pharmacy.
fullDescription: Encourage advancement of pharmacy as a profession and as a science. Also to develop interest in and loyalty to the College of Pharmacy of The University of Texas at Austin and to promote a community of interest between the faculty and the students.

title: University of Texas Amateur Radio Club
descriptionSnippet: UTARC/N5XU is the official Amateur Radio club of the University of Texas at Austin. We are students, faculty and staff who enjoy amateur radio operations with all modes on the main ham radio bands. Our club welcomes everyone and joining is 100% free.
fullDescription: The experimental station 5XU was established on the University of Texas campus on October 1, 1921. Since then, our goal is to further the enjoyment of Amateur Radio (or Ham Radio) by providing aid in obtaining a license, by operating an HF and VHF radio station, and through contact with other operators and radio enthusiasts.

title: University of Texas at Austin Argentine Tango
descriptionSnippet: To promote the dance, music, and culture of Argentine tango....
fullDescription: The UT Argentine Tango Club is a student organization dedicated to Argentine Tango at University of Texas at Austin. Our goal is to educate the UT Austin community about tango dance, music, and culture, while connecting to the greater Austin tango community and beyond.  Our club offers weekly classes, a performance group, as well as free monthly milongas (social dances).

title: University of Texas Leadership and Ethics Institute (LEI)
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas Leadership and Ethics Institute provides comprehensive leadership training, programs and resources available to all UT students and student organizations through a variety of leadership trainings, programs and resources.
fullDescription: The University of Texas Leadership and Ethics Institute provides comprehensive leadership training, programs and resources available to all UT students and student organizations.  The area provides specialized leadership development to all students through the Leadership Education and Program (LEAP) and other annual events such as The Texas Leadership Summit.

title: University of Texas Sport Club Association
descriptionSnippet: The Sport Club program consists of sponsored student orgs that comprise the University of Texas Sport Club Association (UTSCA). Each club is formed, developed, governed and administered by the student membership of the club working with RecSports.
fullDescription: The Sport Club program consists of sponsored student organizations that comprise the University of Texas Sport Club Association (UTSCA). Each club offers students the opportunity to pursue a higher degree of participation with a group of individuals interested in the same level and type of sport. The UTSCA promotes student participation in a wide variety of physical and athletic activities, contributes to the development of student leadership and provides a bond between individual clubs.

title: University of Texas Weightlifting Team
descriptionSnippet: A competitive Olympic Weightlifting club that seeks to train, develop, and produce athletes of all levels in the sport of Weightlifting. The club operates under the governing body of USAW and will compete at local, regional, and national competitions.

title: University Ombuds Offices
descriptionSnippet: The Ombuds offices can help, whether it’s listening, directing you to the appropriate university office, identifying your options, or coaching you to prepare for a difficult conversation.

title: University Orchestra Student Association
descriptionSnippet: The UOSA is an organization dedicated to serving the UT University Orchestra Student Body. Our purpose is to create community among members of UTUO through social gatherings and small music ensembles.

title: University Panhellenic Council
descriptionSnippet: As the governing body of the 14 Panhellenic sororities, we make and enforce the rules for the sororities pertaining to the areas of academics and scholarship, membership and social.

title: University Residence Hall Association
descriptionSnippet: The University Residence Hall Association empowers, motivates, and advocates for on-campus residents by providing them with skills and resources in order for them to excel and positively impact the campus community.
fullDescription: Welcome

title: University Theatre Guild
descriptionSnippet: University Theatre Guild serves as a creative outlet for theatre lovers of all experience levels who want to surround themselves with like-minded individuals. UTG is completely autonomous in its funding, management, and production
fullDescription:
The University Theatre Guild is the oldest student-run theatre organization at UT Austin that puts on plays for all to enjoy!

We put on at least two plays a semester with members participating in all aspects of production. This includes performing, directing, technical theatre, publicity, etc. We also have numerous social activities that allow our members to socialize with one another and have fun on the UT campus and around the greater Austin area.

title: University Yoga Club
descriptionSnippet: To study and practice yoga. There will be an off campus speaker/ instructor who will be donating his services....
fullDescription: To study and practice Yoga. There will be an off campus speaker/ instructor who will be donating his services. Our practice is a classical routine that is suitable for people with beginning and advanced experience with Yoga. Each session is free of charge. We practice Yoga to encourage healthy lifestyles, relieve stress and tension, heal physical and mental injuries, and reconnect with ourselves.

title: Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Team
descriptionSnippet: UAV Austin is a student-led technical and educational organization that specializes in both hardware and software engineering of fixed-wing, semi-autonomous, unmanned aerial systems. The mission of UAV Austin is the growth of its members into engineers.
fullDescription: UAV Austin is a student-led technical organization that specializes in fixed-wing unmanned aerial systems based at The University of Texas at Austin.

title: Urban Studies Society
descriptionSnippet: The Urban Studies Society is an interdisciplinary organization for students of all majors who share a common interest in urban issues, ranging from affordable housing and economic development to transportation and sustainability.
fullDescription: The Urban Studies Society is an interdisciplinary organization for students of all majors who share a common interest in urban issues, ranging from affordable housing and economic development to transportation and sustainability. We aim to enrich our members' classroom learning and on-campus community with biweekly meetings featuring local subject matter experts, visits to local sites of interest, service opportunities, and social events. (https://www.facebook.com/groups/urbanstudiessociety/)

title: UT Aikido Club
descriptionSnippet: Practicing mind-body coordination through special Ki-development exercise and through non-aggressive, non-competitive self-defense arts.
fullDescription: Practicing mind-body coordination through special Ki-development exercise and through non-aggressive, non-competitive self-defense arts. We provide instruction in Ki-Aikido for both beginning and experienced persons. We try to inform the University community, through occasional seminars and demonstrations, of the art of Ki- Aikido, and to give people the chance to learn relaxation and coordi- nation techniques they can use in their daily life activities.

title: UT Archery
descriptionSnippet: Our goal is to further archery as a competitive intercollegiate sport and to provide students, staff, and faculty, regardless of experience, an opportunity to obtain and improve their archery skills.
fullDescription: Our goal is to further archery as a competitive intercollegiate sport and to provide students, staff, and faculty, regardless of experience, an opportunity to obtain and improve their archery skills.

title: UT Badminton Club
descriptionSnippet: To promote interest and encourage participation in the game of badminton. We play Tuesdays and Thursdays from 7:30 PM -10:00 PM as well as Sundays from 4:00 PM -6:30 PM

title: UT Dance Team
descriptionSnippet: As the official competitive dance team for the University of Texas at Austin, we work to represent our university with pride and grace at various public performances around Austin, as well as multiple dance competitions nationwide.
fullDescription: The UT Dance Team, also known as "Texas Dance," is the exclusively competitive dance team that represents UT Austin on a national level. We attend national competitions such as American Dance/Drill Team Nationals in Denton, TX and NDA Collegiate Championships in Daytona Beach, Florida. Our main goal as a team is to represent UT with pride and grace as we promote a healthy competitive spirit and a passion for dance. We pride ourselves on being a student-run organization, and we work diligently towards achieving a National Championship title.

title: UT Fencing Club
descriptionSnippet: UTFC aims to provide members of the University community with the opportunity to develop their fencing skills and increase their enjoyment of the sport through participation in organized drills, bouting and tournaments!
fullDescription: UTFC aims to provide members of the University community with the opportunity to develop their fencing skills and increase their enjoyment of the sport through participation in organized drills, bouting and tournaments!

title: UT General Interest
descriptionSnippet: To raise awareness of general interest of UT....
fullDescription: To raise awareness of general interest of UT.

title: UT ITF Taekwondo Team
descriptionSnippet: To represent The University of Texas in the realm of ITF Taekwon-Do through competition and community. All levels of experience are welcome!

title: UT Kendo Association
descriptionSnippet: To further the study and practice of Kendo (Japanese fencing)
fullDescription: Spring 2018 Practice Schedule:

title: UT Men's Soccer Team
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas Men's Soccer team is the elite Men's Soccer Program on UT's campus. In 2018, we qualified for and competed in the NIRSA National Soccer tournament, making it to the round of 16.
fullDescription: Participation in intercollegiate athletic soccer programs.

title: UT Men's Ultimate Club
descriptionSnippet: We represent the University of Texas in the frisbee disc sport by playing in the top tournaments nationwide. Tuff, the A team, often finishes in the top 10 teams in the nation while Graze, the B team is consistently one of the best B teams in the nation.
fullDescription: Ultimate Frisbee, or utlimate for short, is a vastly growing sport nationwide. Our club has also been following this trend as we see more and more people at tryouts and membership numbers increase. For this reason, we have been able to expand our program to involve three teams:

title: UT Nursing Students' Association
descriptionSnippet: The ultimate purpose of The University of Texas Nursing Students' Association is to bring Texas nursing students closer together while providing as many opportunities to give back to our community as possible.
fullDescription: The ultimate purpose of The University of Texas Nursing Students' Association is to bring Texas nursing students closer together while providing as many opportunities to give back to our community as possible. We provide a variety of service opportunities, a platform for meaningful social connections, as well as numerous networking opportunities.

title: UT Racquetball Club
descriptionSnippet: To promote competitive racquetball within The University and to promote and develop an intercollegiate team to represent The University....
fullDescription:
UT Racquetball is all about promoting growth, camaraderie, and competition within the racquetball community on campus.

-The meeting times for the Fall semester will be every Monday and Thursday from 6:00PM to 9:00PM at the Rec Sports Center (RSC), located next to the stadium on San Jacinto.
-The racquetball club has courts 1-4 at these times.

title: UT Sailing Club
descriptionSnippet: UTSC is dedicated to providing an organized sailing program, improving the sailing ability of every member, and promoting recreational and competitive sailing! Our fleet consists of a range of boats from beginner to advanced, all situated on Lake Travis.

title: UT Sailing Team
descriptionSnippet: The University of Texas Sailing Team is a nationally competitive club sport. Our goal is to expand the love and knowledge of competitive sailing throughout the University community and our district at large.
fullDescription: The University of Texas Sailing Team is the nationally competitive club sport that travels across the U.S. to race against other colleges. We strive to compete at high levels while expanding the appreciation and love for sailboat racing throughout the University, our district, and the greater national sailing community.

title: UT Sciences Toastmasters Club
descriptionSnippet: This club helps people improve their public speaking and communication skills. The club hosts weekly meetings featuring speaking practice. This club is a chapter of Toastmasters International and is open to all students.
fullDescription: Official Toastmasters chapter for UT Austin students. UTSTM provides a welcoming and friendly environment for people of all backgrounds (undergrads, grad students, and non-students) to improve their public speaking and communications skills. "Friendship, diversity, and self-improvement" are the club's values. Come visit us to find out more about becoming a member.

title: UT Service Scholars
descriptionSnippet: UTSS enables students to enhance their leadership skills through a variety of service events and social seminars at the Longhorn Center for Community Engagement and across the great city of Austin.
fullDescription: The UT Service Scholars Program started as a collaboration between the Longhorn Center for Community Engagement and the LBJ School of Public Affairs. Scholars complete community service hours each semester while engaging in service-learning. Scholars choose where they serve while receiving guide towards a specific area in public service.

title: UT STAFF TOASTMASTERS
descriptionSnippet: National and State Affiliations: Toastmasters International, Toastmasters Texas (District 55)
fullDescription: The mission of UT Staff Toastmasters Club is to provide a mutually supportive, positive and continuous learning environment in which staff members have the opportunity to develop and practice communication and leadership skills that enrich their lives and lead to greater self-confidence and professional growth.

title: UT Student Organization Advisors
descriptionSnippet: The purpose of this group is to provide training, resources, and networking opportunities for UT faculty and staff that currently serve as an adviser for a student organization.
fullDescription: The Student Activities area of the Office of the Dean of Students has created several resources in order to help advisors in their work with registered student organizations. This group was created to assist with providing training, support, resources, and networking opportunities for UT faculty and staff that currently serve as an advisor for a student organization.

title: UT Student Society of Health-System Pharmacists
descriptionSnippet: Membership for pharmacy students interested in health-system pharmacy. Organization opportunities geared towards pharmacy residencies and specialty pharmacy practice.
fullDescription: The University of Texas Student Society of Health-System Pharmacists has over 100 members who are all pharmacy students enrolled in the University of Texas College of Pharmacy. We are an affiliated chapter of the American Society of Health-System Pharmacists (ASHP) a 30,000+ member national organization of pharmacists from diverse workplaces in the profession of pharmacy. We are also affiliated with the state level organization, the Texas Society of Health-System Pharmacists (TSHP) and the local Austin Society of Health-System Pharmacists (AASHP).

title: UT Ukes
descriptionSnippet: Promoting healthy living and connecting the community through ukulele music. Students, faculty, staff, and all ukulele skill levels are welcome. Come play!
fullDescription: We are a free spirited ukulele group!

title: UT Water Ski Team
descriptionSnippet: To represent The University at sanctioned tournaments of the South Central Conference of the American Ski Association....
fullDescription: Texas Water Ski was established to represent The University at sanctioned tournaments of the South Central Conference of the American Ski Association. We are a RecSports sponsored organization and ski on a private boat at a private lake. All necessary equipment is provided by the team

title: UT Women's Club Soccer
descriptionSnippet: Promote personal growth and skill development among student athletes.
fullDescription: The University of Texas Women's Club Soccer Team is an organization that is committed to promoting personal growth and skill development among student athletes. In order to achieve these goals, we provide both a competitive and supportive environment that allows our members to gain opportunitites and build relationships that enhance their college experience. Our members build the habit of demonstrating excellence in the classroom and on the field in their training and competition. Our success as an organization comes directly from the quality of experiences and the depth of relationships forme throughout the course of the season.

title: UT Women's Ultimate Frisbee
descriptionSnippet: To render and perpetuate the love of ultimate frisbee in Austin and, specifically, at UT, through athleticism and sportsmanship.
fullDescription: To render and perpetuate the love of ultimate frisbee in Austin and, specifically, at UT, through athleticism and sportsmanship.

title: UT Women's Volleyball Club
descriptionSnippet: Texas Women's Club Volleyball allows dedicated women with an interest in the game to continue playing at a competitive level. UTWVC has consistently been ranked as one of the best clubs in the region and nation.
fullDescription: Texas Women’s Club Volleyball is a great way for women on campus to continue their love for the fast-growing sport. The UT RecSports affiliated organization is comprised of two teams. Both teams practice twice a week, for 3 hours each practice and actively participate in various fundraising, volunteer, and social events. As an organization, we pride ourselves on our highly competitive nature. Teams will travel to different cities and states to compete against the best teams in the nation. Every year UTWVC teams are national title-contending teams. Our mission is to promote the development of the sport of volleyball, while providing a fun, competitive environment.

title: UT Women's Water Polo
descriptionSnippet: To teach and compete in water polo nation wide.
fullDescription: To teach and compete in Water Polo nation wide

title: UTalent Records
descriptionSnippet: It is UTalent Records’ mission to help independent UT Austin student artists grow to a new level of success by helping them reach their passion while educating and providing UT students with hands-on experience about how to run a record label.
fullDescription: As an innovative organization, UTalent Records brings many unique aspects to the table. It encourages people's passion for music and provides a wholistic and educational learning experience about how to run a record label by bridging artistry and business. Austin, "The Live Music Capital of the World" has so many opportunities for students who wish to get involved in the music scene - UTalent Records is a platform organization that helps students do just that within the UT community and more.

title: UTeach-Liberal Arts
descriptionSnippet: UTeach-Liberal Arts is a professional teacher preparation program for undergraduate and post-baccalaureate students planning to teach middle school or high school English, Languages Other Than English, or social studies.
fullDescription: UTeach-Liberal Arts is a professional middle and high school teacher preparation program for The University of Texas at Austin undergraduate and post-baccalaureate students planning to teach English, Languages Other Than English, or social studies.

title: UTeeth for the Youth
descriptionSnippet: UTeeth for the Youth is a pre-dental outreach organization that seeks to educate disadvantaged elementary school children by delivering education resources on oral hygiene and dental health. We hope to show kids the importance of preventative care.

title: Valley Alliance of Mentors for Opportunities and Scholarships
descriptionSnippet: The Valley Alliance for Mentors for Opportunities and Scholarships chapter in Austin, is an organization dedicated to bringing together VAMOS scholars from the valley in efforts to further professional growth and development.

title: ValleyHorns
descriptionSnippet: ValleyHorns is a student organization that focuses on the support of UT students who have a connection to the Rio Grande Valley or any border community, through cultural events and being a safe space for conversation.

title: Vector Student Engineering Magazine
descriptionSnippet: We are the student run engineering magazine on campus.
fullDescription: Hello! We are Vector Student Engineering Magazine.

title: Vietnamese Students Association
descriptionSnippet: To make friendships between Vietnamese students and other international students and the University community. To exhibit Vietnamese culture whenever it is possible.
fullDescription: The Vietnamese Student Association was established at the University of Texas on October 12, 1972. Today, we are one of the largest student-run organizations on campus. We welcome people of all backgrounds to join VSA and to see what we're all about. As a social and cultural student organization, VSA is a great way to meet new people and to make lifelong friends. Being a student-run organization, VSA puts great emphasis on the community, the Vietnamese culture, sports, and the Texas VSA family.

title: Voices Against Violence
descriptionSnippet: Voices Against Violence (VAV) transforms the campus community by addressing interpersonal violence through dynamic programming that creates safety, cultivates support and promotes growth.
fullDescription: Voices Against Violence (VAV) Student Organization is a collective of survivors and allies who are passionate about ending violence and creating a culture where consent and healthy relationships are valued on our campus. We strive to create a safer space to heal and thrive through our organization meetings, dynamic events, connections to resources, and peer education. We maintain an unwavering commitment to supporting survivors, ending interpersonal violence, increasing bystander intervention, and promoting social justice. We acknowledge the unique experiences of marginalized groups, recognize the intersections of oppression and interpersonal violence, and strive to ensure that our community is inclusive. VAV is open to all enrolled students at UT Austin.

title: Voices of Afrika
descriptionSnippet: Voices of Afrika is an a capella group focused on channeling music from across the African and African American diaspora.
fullDescription: Voices of Afrika is an a capella group focused on channeling sounds from across the African diaspora.

title: Volunteer Chamber Orchestra
descriptionSnippet: VCO is an audition-only chamber orchestra that performs concerts in nursing homes, hospitals, and parks. We aim to bring the joy of classical and pops music to the community around us.
fullDescription: VCO is an audition-based chamber string orchestra that rehearses weekly and performs community service concerts at hospitals and nursing homes in the Austin area. We perform a mixture of traditional classical repertoire and pops music adapted for our audiences. Our members are primarily music majors and former participants in the Texas All-Region and All-State Orchestras. We are passionate about our mission to spread the joy of music to the community around us, especially to those who do not have access to expensive performances.

title: We Are Last
descriptionSnippet: We Are Last is an organization focused on building community and making a difference through serving those around us. Our main goal is to unite students in acts of service by providing meals to the homeless in Austin, Texas.
fullDescription: We Are Last is a community service organization that focuses on pouring back into the community that supports us as college students. Our primary focus is serving the homeless population in Austin, Texas. We hope to truly make a difference in the world around us as we shape hearts and minds to become more service-oriented. Additionally, We Are Last will organize trips to Houston in order to serve those affected by Hurricane Harvey in 2017.

title: Well Aware at UT
descriptionSnippet: Well Aware at UT Austin is committed to raising awareness of global water issues and the strategies needed to create sustainable solutions. It is the first-ever student chapter of a global, Austin-based nonprofit called Well Aware.
fullDescription: Well Aware at UT Austin is a new student org committed to raising awareness of global water issues and the strategies needed to create sustainable solutions. It is the first-ever student chapter of a global, Austin-based nonprofit called Well Aware. Well Aware provides sustainable water systems to communities in East Africa. It has provided clean water for life to over 145,000 people since 2010 and is continuing to grow in impact through it's community-driven approach. Becoming a part of this student organization is an opportunity to get involved with the local and global community, and have a collaborative social impact.

title: Wellness Network
descriptionSnippet: UT's healthy campus coalition
fullDescription:
Wellness Network is a campus-wide coalition committed to assessing and
addressing the health and wellness needs of students, faculty, and staff at The
University of Texas at Austin. The Wellness Network brings together advocates
for health and wellness from across UT-Austin in order to share information,
strategies, and resources. Through this collaboration, we aim to shape the
environment in which we learn, live, work, and play to support overall health
and healthy choices. The Wellness Network works toward a campus community where
the healthy choice is the easy choice.

title: White Rose Society
descriptionSnippet: The White Rose Society is a Holocaust remembrance and genocide awareness group. Join to help us end genocide.
fullDescription: The White Rose Society is a Holocaust remembrance and genocide awareness group. Join now to take a stand and promote awareness and action over apathy towards genocide.

title: Willie Nelson Center Students
descriptionSnippet: The Willie Nelson Center Students for Peace and Conflict Resolution - Supports the development of a Willie Nelson Conflict Resolution Center that educates students about conflict and fosters involvement in events and activities towards living more peace.
fullDescription: To support the development of a Willie Nelson Conflict Resolution Center and educate students about and foster involvement in events and activities towards living a more peaceful life.

title: Women in Aerospace for Leadership and Development
descriptionSnippet: To provide aerospace industry project-based leadership and development opportunities for undergraduate engineering students. The vision is for more women to graduate with confidence and experience in the field of aerospace engineering.
fullDescription: WIALD (pronounced “wild”) is a student run organization at the University of Texas at Austin. The percentage of women applying for the undergraduate Aerospace Engineering program at The University of Texas at Austin is historically low. In an effort to alleviate this problem, a group of women in engineering came together during the fall semester of 2009 with the help of faculty members and the Women in Engineering Program (WEP) and formed Women in Aerospace for Leadership Development (WIALD). The main objective of the group is to facilitate the development of leadership skills for women in all undergraduate engineering majors while attracting and retaining more women in engineering by making group activities fun, exciting, and ultimately valuable in achieving long-range career goals. Each year we focus on a different hands-on project. In the past, we have launched a payload into space, sent a balloon into the upper atmosphere, flown on NASA’s “Vomit Comet,” and modified a drone to carry a glider which autonomously navigates to pre-determined waypoints. Check out our website, sites.utexas.edu/wiald for more information.

title: Women in Biomedical Engineering
descriptionSnippet: WBME fosters a community of students, postdocs, faculty members, and alumni within the Biomedical Engineering department through social, academic, and professional opportunities.

title: Women in Business Association
descriptionSnippet: Women in Business Association (WBA) strives to increase our members' knowledge of and involvement in the world of business by inviting educated and experienced women to speak and share advice with our organization. Members are encouraged to interact wi...
fullDescription: Women in Business Association (WBA) strives to increase members’ knowledge of and involvement in the world of business in numerous ways. First, we invite educated and experienced women from a variety of different fields, including finance, accounting, management information systems, supply chain, technology, and more. Members are encouraged to interact with our invited speakers to promote rapport within our organization as well as gain an increased understanding of what it is like to have a business career. We also place a heavy emphasis on professional development through networking opportunities, technical workshops, and informative events that can help guide female undergraduates through the recruiting process. In addition, we focus on building personal connections between our members through unique social, fundraising, and community service events, so members can build a circle of friends and mentors. As a note, we are open to ALL majors, generally anybody who is interested in pursuing a career in business.

title: Women in Civil, Architectural, and Environmental Engineering
descriptionSnippet: An inclusive peer and professional organization aimed at promoting the interest of women in Civil, Architectural and Environmental Engineering.
fullDescription:
Goals:
• Create a professional network for civil engineering students, graduates, and faculty members.
• Build an inclusive social community for undergraduates interested in Civil Engineering.
• Equip members with peer mentorship in their studies.

title: Women in Computer Science
descriptionSnippet: To provide a community for Women in Computer Science to meet other women, network with top technology companies, and encourage more women to join the technology field.
fullDescription: To provide opportunities for professional and personal growth through networking and events on technical and career-oriented topics.

title: Women in Electrical and Computer Engineering (Women in ECE)
descriptionSnippet: Women in ECE fosters a community of engineering women within the Electrical and Computer Engineering department through social, academic, and professional opportunities.
fullDescription: The purpose of the women in ECE is to reach out and engage women from all levels in the department - from undergraduate to graduate to faculty. This group will foster a network within ECE that will serve professional, social, and academic purposes. Women in ECE is open to men and women.

title: Women in Engineering Program
descriptionSnippet: The Women in Engineering Program (WEP) helps women in the Cockrell School get connected, develop as engineering leaders, and graduate with skills for life. WEP strives to recruit, retain and graduate more women from engineering.
fullDescription: The Women in Engineering Program (WEP) helps women in the Cockrell School get connected, develop as engineering leaders, and graduate with skills for life.
